original: @151a # // rgya gar skad du /
analyzed: @151a # // rgya gar skad du /
translated: In Sanskrit:

original: b'ada n+ya ya t'i ka /
analyzed: b'ada n+ya ya t'i ka /
translated: VƒÅdanyƒÅya

original: bod skad du //
analyzed: bod skad du //
translated: In Tibetan:

original: rtsod pa'i rigs pa'i 'grel pa /üîΩgsung gi mnga' bdag la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: rtsod pa'i rigs pa'i 'grel pa / gsung gi mnga' bdag la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: The Commentary on the Logic of DebateüîΩHomage to the Lord of Speech.

original: don dam pa gsung ba la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: don dam pa gsung ba la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Homage to the one who speaks the ultimate.

original: gang dag rigs pa'i rtsod pa snyan par rab grub pa'i //
analyzed: gang dag rigs pa'i rtsod pa snyan par rab grub pa'i //
translated: Those who are well-established in the sweet sound of logical debate,

original: bzod dang snying brtse sbyin dang dul ba rab ldan pa'i //
analyzed: bzod dang snying brtse sbyin dang dul ba rab ldan pa'i //
translated: Endowed with patience, compassion, generosity, and discipline,

original: rigs pa mkhyen pa'i mchog gyur de la phyag 'tshal nas //
analyzed: rigs pa mkhyen pa'i mchog gyur de la phyag 'tshal nas //
translated: Having paid homage to the supreme knower of logic,

original: rtsod pa'i rigs pa gzhung @151b bzhin du ni bshad par bya //
analyzed: rtsod pa'i rigs pa gzhung @151b bzhin du ni bshad par bya //
translated: I will explain the logic of debate according to the texts.

original: rtsod pa dag la rgyu can gyis //
analyzed: rtsod pa dag la rgyu can gyis //
translated: In debates, those with reasons

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i ngag dang po 'dis ni rab tu byed pa 'di'i 'brel ba dang / brjod par bya ba'i dgos pa dang / brjod par bya ba dang / dgos pa'i dgos pa'i dgos pas bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i ngag dang po 'dis ni rab tu byed pa 'di'i 'brel ba dang / brjod par bya ba'i dgos pa dang / brjod par bya ba dang / dgos pa'i dgos pa'i dgos pas bstan pa yin no //
translated: In this first statement and so on, the connection of this chapter, the purpose of the subject matter, the subject matter, and the purpose of the purpose are shown.

original: gzhan du na dgos pa la sogs pa'i rab tu byed pa la rtog pa sngon du gtong ba rnams kyi yan lag tu byed pa ma yin pa de lta na 'dir rab tu bshad pas ci zhig bya /
analyzed: gzhan du na dgos pa la sogs pa'i rab tu byed pa la rtog pa sngon du gtong ba rnams kyi yan lag tu byed pa ma yin pa de lta na 'dir rab tu bshad pas ci zhig bya /
translated: Otherwise, if the purpose and so on are not stated as a preliminary for those who contemplate the treatise, then what is the point of stating them here?

original: de srid du rtog par mi 'gyur ba de lta na rab tu byed pa 'di'i dgos pa ni ci zhig bya /
analyzed: de srid du rtog par mi 'gyur ba de lta na rab tu byed pa 'di'i dgos pa ni ci zhig bya /
translated: If they are not stated, then what is the point of this treatise?

original: 'brel ba zhes bya ba ci zhig yin /
analyzed: 'brel ba zhes bya ba ci zhig yin /
translated: What is called ‚Äúconnection‚Äù?

original: ji srid du ma brjod pa de srid du rab tu byed pa la /
analyzed: ji srid du ma brjod pa de srid du rab tu byed pa la /
translated: As long as it is not stated,

original: dga' ba skyes bar mi 'gyur na slar yang thos pa dang bsam pa la 'jug par byed par 'gyur ba'i yan lag ci zhig yin /
analyzed: dga' ba skyes bar mi 'gyur na slar yang thos pa dang bsam pa la 'jug par byed par 'gyur ba'i yan lag ci zhig yin /
translated: one will not be pleased with the treatise, so what is the point of engaging in listening and contemplation?

original: de'i phyir rtog pa sngon du gtong ba'i nyan pa skye bo rnams rab tu spro ba skye ba'i don du rab tu byed pa'i 'brel ba la sogs pa'i tshig gdon mi za bar rab tu brjod par bya'o zhe na /
analyzed: de'i phyir rtog pa sngon du gtong ba'i nyan pa skye bo rnams rab tu spro ba skye ba'i don du rab tu byed pa'i 'brel ba la sogs pa'i tshig gdon mi za bar rab tu brjod par bya'o zhe na /
translated: Therefore, in order to generate enthusiasm in those who listen and contemplate, the words of the treatise, such as the connection, must definitely be stated.

original: de'i dir dgag pa'i don gyi phyir 'dir brjod par bya ba dang / dgos pa ni dngos su bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i dir dgag pa'i don gyi phyir 'dir brjod par bya ba dang / dgos pa ni dngos su bstan pa yin no //
translated: The point of this is to refute that, and here the topic and purpose are directly taught.

original: de lta na 'di de zhes bya ba'i sgra de ma thag tu bstan pas sgyu can gyis rgol ba bden pa ma yin par rnam par gzhog pas tshar gcod pa dag dpyad par byas pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta na 'di de zhes bya ba'i sgra de ma thag tu bstan pas sgyu can gyis rgol ba bden pa ma yin par rnam par gzhog pas tshar gcod pa dag dpyad par byas pa yin no //
translated: Thus, the word ‚Äúthat‚Äù is taught immediately after, and the refutation of the opponent‚Äôs position is analyzed by the refuter through the establishment of the falsity of the opponent‚Äôs position.

original: de dag gi phyi ma yang bsal ba yin no //
analyzed: de dag gi phyi ma yang bsal ba yin no //
translated: The latter of those is also refuted.

original: de'i phyir de'i sgras ni brjod par bya ba bstan to //
analyzed: de'i phyir de'i sgras ni brjod par bya ba bstan to //
translated: Therefore, the word ‚Äúthat‚Äù teaches the topic.üîΩBut here, the topic is taught by the treatise itself.

original: 'o na 'dir rab tu byed pas kyang brjod par bya ba'i thabs su bstan pa yin na /
analyzed: 'o na 'dir rab tu byed pas kyang brjod par bya ba'i thabs su bstan pa yin na /
translated: If that is so, then since the treatise itself teaches the topic,

original: gang dag rigs pas rtsod par smra ba de ji ltar mi bden pa'i rnam par gzhag pa'i dngos po spangs pa nyid nyi tshe brjod par bya ba bstan zhe na /
analyzed: gang dag rigs pas rtsod par smra ba de ji ltar mi bden pa'i rnam par gzhag pa'i dngos po spangs pa nyid nyi tshe brjod par bya ba bstan zhe na /
translated: how is it that the opponent‚Äôs position, which is expressed through reasoning, is taught as the topic, having been rejected through the establishment of the falsity of the opponent‚Äôs position?

original: gal te yang de ni de lta na yang gang gi phyir sgyu can /
analyzed: gal te yang de ni de lta na yang gang gi phyir sgyu can /
translated: Even though that is so, the opponent is deceptive.

original: gzhan dag gis rigs par smra ba dag pham par byed pa de'i phyir bstan bcos byed pa yid mi bde ba phul du byung bas rigs pas rtsod par smra ba dag pham par ma bzod nas de bsal ba zhig brjod par bya ba nyid du bstan to //
analyzed: gzhan dag gis rigs par smra ba dag pham par byed pa de'i phyir bstan bcos byed pa yid mi bde ba phul du byung bas rigs pas rtsod par smra ba dag pham par ma bzod nas de bsal ba zhig brjod par bya ba nyid du bstan to //
translated: Since others defeat the logicians, the author of the treatise, in order to defeat the logicians who speak of debate, has taught the refutation of that, because of the excellence of his displeasure.

original: de ltar na gal te spyi don gzhan sgrub pa'i yan lag ma yin pa dang / skyon mi brjod pa thog mar ston zhe na /
analyzed: de ltar na gal te spyi don gzhan sgrub pa'i yan lag ma yin pa dang / skyon mi brjod pa thog mar ston zhe na /
translated: If it is asked why the purpose is not stated first, since it is not a part of establishing another meaning, and since the faults are not stated,

original: rigs pas tshar gcod par byed pa rang gi ngo bo shes pas rigs pas tshar gcod pa'i gnas bde bar shes par nus pa'i phyir rigs pas tshar gcod pa'i gnas thog mar ston to //
analyzed: rigs pas tshar gcod par byed pa rang gi ngo bo shes pas rigs pas tshar gcod pa'i gnas bde bar shes par nus pa'i phyir rigs pas tshar gcod pa'i gnas thog mar ston to //
translated: the basis of refutation is stated first, because one who is able to understand the basis of refutation by means of understanding the nature of refutation is able to understand the basis of refutation well.

original: sun dbyung ba'i don du zhes bya ba'i 'dis dgos pa bstan to //
analyzed: sun dbyung ba'i don du zhes bya ba'i 'dis dgos pa bstan to //
translated: By this, ‚Äúfor the purpose of refutation,‚Äù the purpose is taught.

original: gang gi @152a * //
analyzed: gang gi @152a * //
translated: For what purpose?

original: phyir bden pa ma yin pa'i rnam par gzhag pas sgyu can gyis tshar gcod par byed pa sun dbyung ba tsam du brjod do //
analyzed: phyir bden pa ma yin pa'i rnam par gzhag pas sgyu can gyis tshar gcod par byed pa sun dbyung ba tsam du brjod do //
translated: Since the deceptive one is refuted by means of a false presentation, it is said to be mere refutation.

original: 'on te 'dir yang sun dbyung ba 'ba' zhig ni don med de sun dbyung ba nyid 'bras bur 'dod pa yin na /
analyzed: 'on te 'dir yang sun dbyung ba 'ba' zhig ni don med de sun dbyung ba nyid 'bras bur 'dod pa yin na /
translated: But if you think that refutation alone is pointless, and that the effect is the refutation itself,üîΩthen the mere understanding of the specific nature of things is also the effect.

original: 'on kyang de lta na dngos po'i khyad par shes pa nyid kyang 'bras bu yin no zhe na gang rigs pas tshar gcad pa'i gnas su yongs su shes pa'i mtshan nyid ni gang gi tshe yang de dag de ltar sgyu can sun dbyung ba nyid 'dir dgos pa
analyzed: 'on kyang de lta na dngos po'i khyad par shes pa nyid kyang 'bras bu yin no zhe na gang rigs pas tshar gcad pa'i gnas su yongs su shes pa'i mtshan nyid ni gang gi tshe yang de dag de ltar sgyu can sun dbyung ba nyid 'dir dgos pa
translated: When the nature of the understanding of the specific nature of things is fully understood, then the refutation itself is the effect.

original: nyid du mngon par 'dod ba de lta na yang /
analyzed: nyid du mngon par 'dod ba de lta na yang /
translated: But even though the refutation itself is the effect,

original: gang gi sgyu can gyis rigs par smra ba rnams la yang rigs pa ma yin pas tshar gcod pa na /
analyzed: gang gi sgyu can gyis rigs par smra ba rnams la yang rigs pa ma yin pas tshar gcod pa na /
translated: when the sophist is defeated by the logician through the sophist‚Äôs own sophistry,

original: dngos po'i khyad par yongs su shes pa yang 'bras bu'i zhar la 'ongs pa yin no zhes de yang 'dir 'bras bu nyid du khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: dngos po'i khyad par yongs su shes pa yang 'bras bu'i zhar la 'ongs pa yin no zhes de yang 'dir 'bras bu nyid du khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: then the understanding of the specific nature of things is also the effect.

original: sgyu can bden par rnam par 'jog pa nye bar bkod pa yin na ni gnod pa med do //
analyzed: sgyu can bden par rnam par 'jog pa nye bar bkod pa yin na ni gnod pa med do //
translated: But if the sophist is posited as true, then there is no refutation.

original: de'i phyir sun dbyung bar byed par bstan pa ni 'bras bu yin par mngon par 'dod do //
analyzed: de'i phyir sun dbyung bar byed par bstan pa ni 'bras bu yin par mngon par 'dod do //
translated: Therefore, the demonstration of the refutation is the purpose that is the effect.

original: 'dir brtsams so zhes bya ba 'dis ni 'brel ba bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dir brtsams so zhes bya ba 'dis ni 'brel ba bstan pa yin no //
translated: Here, the statement I have composed this indicates the relation.

original: de ltar na sgyu can la sogs pa sun dbyung bar bya ba'i don gyi phyir rab tu byed pa 'di rtsom pa'i don yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na sgyu can la sogs pa sun dbyung bar bya ba'i don gyi phyir rab tu byed pa 'di rtsom pa'i don yin no //
translated: Thus, the purpose of composing this treatise is to refute the deceptive and so on.

original: rab tu byed pa ni sgyu can la sogs pa bsal b'i thabs su bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: rab tu byed pa ni sgyu can la sogs pa bsal b'i thabs su bstan pa yin no //
translated: The treatise is taught as the means to eliminate the deceptive and so on.

original: de lta na yang bden pa ma yin pas tshar gcod pa ni dgos pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta na yang bden pa ma yin pas tshar gcod pa ni dgos pa yin no //
translated: However, the purpose is to refute the deceptive and so on.

original: rab tu byed pa ni thabs yin la /
analyzed: rab tu byed pa ni thabs yin la /
translated: The treatise is the means,

original: rab tu byed pa dang dgos pa ni thabs dang thabs las byung ba'i mtshan nyid kyi 'brel ba dang byed pa dang bsgrub par bya ba'i mtshan nyid kyi 'brel ba 'di ni de ltar rgyu dang 'bras bu'i mtshan nyid yin no //
analyzed: rab tu byed pa dang dgos pa ni thabs dang thabs las byung ba'i mtshan nyid kyi 'brel ba dang byed pa dang bsgrub par bya ba'i mtshan nyid kyi 'brel ba 'di ni de ltar rgyu dang 'bras bu'i mtshan nyid yin no //
translated: and the relation between the treatise and the purpose is the relation characterized by means and that which arises from the means, and the relation characterized by action and that which is to be accomplished. This is the nature of the relation between cause and effect.

original: de lta na rab tu byed pa ni sgrub par byed pa yin la bsgrub par bya ba ni 'bras bu yin te /
analyzed: de lta na rab tu byed pa ni sgrub par byed pa yin la bsgrub par bya ba ni 'bras bu yin te /
translated: Thus, the treatise is the proof, and the result is that which is to be proved.

original: rgyu ni rab tu byed pa yin la 'bras bu 'dod pa yin no //
analyzed: rgyu ni rab tu byed pa yin la 'bras bu 'dod pa yin no //
translated: The cause is the treatise, and the result is the desire to prove.

original: de'i phyir na yang bden pa ma yin pa la sogs pa sun dbyung ba'i don gyi phyir rab tu byed pa 'di brtsams so zhes bya bar gnas so //
analyzed: de'i phyir na yang bden pa ma yin pa la sogs pa sun dbyung ba'i don gyi phyir rab tu byed pa 'di brtsams so zhes bya bar gnas so //
translated: Therefore, this treatise is composed for the purpose of refuting the unreal, etc.

original: de ltar rnam par gnas pa la res 'ga' 'ga' zhig gis dris na ci mi bden par rnam par gzhag pa nye bar bkod pa la sogs pa sun dbyung ba yin te /
analyzed: de ltar rnam par gnas pa la res 'ga' 'ga' zhig gis dris na ci mi bden par rnam par gzhag pa nye bar bkod pa la sogs pa sun dbyung ba yin te /
translated: Thus, if someone were to question this position, the refutation of the unreal, etc., would be presented.

original: sun 'byin bar byed pa yang la lar nye bar sbyar bar bya ba ma yin te /
analyzed: sun 'byin bar byed pa yang la lar nye bar sbyar bar bya ba ma yin te /
translated: The refutation is not to be applied everywhere,

original: bya rog gi so brtag pa bzhin du de yang gnas pa @152b ma yin pa la mngon par zhen par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: bya rog gi so brtag pa bzhin du de yang gnas pa @152b ma yin pa la mngon par zhen par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: just as the crow‚Äôs tooth is not to be examined. That is not a real entity, but is imagined.

original: de'i phyir 'di bshad pas rtsod pa dag la rgyu can gyis /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di bshad pas rtsod pa dag la rgyu can gyis /
translated: Therefore, this is explained in order to refute the objection that the treatise is pointless.

original: yang dag pa ma yin pa'i rnam par gzhag pa nye bar bkod pa'i rigs pa smra ba dag la yang tshar gcod pa des na dgos par gzhag pa de ni ngag gi don yin no //
analyzed: yang dag pa ma yin pa'i rnam par gzhag pa nye bar bkod pa'i rigs pa smra ba dag la yang tshar gcod pa des na dgos par gzhag pa de ni ngag gi don yin no //
translated: The purpose is to refute those who propound unreal systems, and that is the point of the treatise.

original: gang gi phyir /üîΩrigs par smra ba rnams la yang //
analyzed: gang gi phyir / rigs par smra ba rnams la yang //
translated: BecauseüîΩeven for logiciansüîΩthe deceptive are refuted

original: sgyu can rigs pa med pa yi //üîΩpham par byed pa de yi phyir //üîΩji ltar rigs par smra ba sgyu can gyis pham par bsrung bar 'gyur ba'i phyir mi bden pa'i rnam par gzhag pa tshar gcad pa'i don du rab tu byed pa'i 'di brtags so zhes bya ba ji snyed pa bsdus pa'i don yin no //
analyzed: sgyu can rigs pa med pa yi // pham par byed pa de yi phyir // ji ltar rigs par smra ba sgyu can gyis pham par bsrung bar 'gyur ba'i phyir mi bden pa'i rnam par gzhag pa tshar gcad pa'i don du rab tu byed pa'i 'di brtags so zhes bya ba ji snyed pa bsdus pa'i don yin no //
translated: without logic.üîΩTherefore, this chapter is composed in order to refute those who propound unreal systems, so that the deceptive logicians may be refuted without logic. This is the summarized meaning.

original: yan lag gi don gyis stong pa'i rigs par smra ba rnams la yang zhes bya ba ni 'dir rigs pa'i sgras ni tshad mar brjod par bya ba gtso bo'i 'jug pa yin pas rigs pa ma yin no zhes sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: yan lag gi don gyis stong pa'i rigs par smra ba rnams la yang zhes bya ba ni 'dir rigs pa'i sgras ni tshad mar brjod par bya ba gtso bo'i 'jug pa yin pas rigs pa ma yin no zhes sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: The meaning of the words is as follows. The phrase ‚Äúeven for logicians‚Äù is stated here because the term ‚Äúlogic‚Äù is the primary referent of the term ‚Äúvalid cognition.‚Äù Therefore, it should be applied as ‚Äúit is not logic.‚Äù

original: yang na 'jig rten pa la rab tu grub pa'i rigs pas 'thad pa'i don ni rigs pa'i sgra'i don du brjod do //
analyzed: yang na 'jig rten pa la rab tu grub pa'i rigs pas 'thad pa'i don ni rigs pa'i sgra'i don du brjod do //
translated: Or else, the meaning of the word reasoning is the object that is established by reasoning that is well known in the world.

original: de lta na yang gang rigs pas 'thad pa'i don du brjod pa yin pa de ni rigs par smra ba yin no zhes 'jig rten la grub bo //
analyzed: de lta na yang gang rigs pas 'thad pa'i don du brjod pa yin pa de ni rigs par smra ba yin no zhes 'jig rten la grub bo //
translated: In that case, one who speaks of an object that is established by reasoning is said to speak reasonably, as is well known in the world.

original: de yang rigs pas don yul du byed pa'i phyir rigs par brjod do //
analyzed: de yang rigs pas don yul du byed pa'i phyir rigs par brjod do //
translated: And that object is called reasoning because it is the domain of reasoning.

original: ji ltar sngon po la sogs pa don cis mngon sum gyi yin pa'i phyir mngon sum du brjod ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar sngon po la sogs pa don cis mngon sum gyi yin pa'i phyir mngon sum du brjod ce na /
translated: How is it that blue and so on are called directly perceived because they are the objects of direct perception?

original: de lta na gang rigs pas 'thad pa'i don du smras pa de ni rigs pas smras pa zhes 'jig rten la grub po //
analyzed: de lta na gang rigs pas 'thad pa'i don du smras pa de ni rigs pas smras pa zhes 'jig rten la grub po //
translated: In that case, one who speaks of an object that is established by reasoning is said to speak reasonably, as is well known in the world.

original: don de yang rigs pa'i yul yin pa'i phyir rigs par brjod de /üîΩji ltar sngon po la sogs pa don cis mngon sum yul yin /
analyzed: don de yang rigs pa'i yul yin pa'i phyir rigs par brjod de / ji ltar sngon po la sogs pa don cis mngon sum yul yin /
translated: And that object is called reasoning because it is the domain of reasoning.

original: mngon sum du brjod ce na /
analyzed: mngon sum du brjod ce na /
translated: How is it that blue and so on are the objects of direct perception and are called directly perceived?

original: de yang rigs pas rtsod par nus pa de ni 'dir rigs par smras pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de yang rigs pas rtsod par nus pa de ni 'dir rigs par smras pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Moreover, one who is able to argue logically is called a ‚Äúlogical disputant‚Äù here.

original: tshad mas smra ba med na rigs pas smra ba ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: tshad mas smra ba med na rigs pas smra ba ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: If one does not speak with valid cognitions, one is not a logical disputant. This is the meaning.

original: gal te rigs pa'i sgras mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa gnyis ka yang brjod par bya ba yin na /
analyzed: gal te rigs pa'i sgras mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa gnyis ka yang brjod par bya ba yin na /
translated: If the word ‚Äúlogical‚Äù is to be taken as referring to both direct perception and inference,

original: de lta na yang skabs kyi dbang gis spyi'i sgra bye brag la 'jug pa yin pa des kyang rigs pa nyen pa ni rjes su dpag pa nyid brjod par bya ba yin la /
analyzed: de lta na yang skabs kyi dbang gis spyi'i sgra bye brag la 'jug pa yin pa des kyang rigs pa nyen pa ni rjes su dpag pa nyid brjod par bya ba yin la /
translated: then, even though the word ‚Äúgeneral‚Äù is used in the context of a particular, the logical disputant is one who speaks with inference,

original: mngon sum gyis ma yin pa de'i phyir rtsod pa rnams mngon sum gyi dbang du ma byas so //
analyzed: mngon sum gyis ma yin pa de'i phyir rtsod pa rnams mngon sum gyi dbang du ma byas so //
translated: and not with direct perception. Therefore, the disputants do not rely on direct perception.

original: yang na rigs pas 'thad pa'i don la rtsod par nus na khyed @153a * //üîΩ'di'i rigs pa smra ba yin te /
analyzed: yang na rigs pas 'thad pa'i don la rtsod par nus na khyed @153a * // 'di'i rigs pa smra ba yin te /
translated: Or else, one who is able to argue logically about a point that is logically tenable isüîΩa ‚Äúlogical disputant‚Äù here.

original: rigs pas 'thad pa'i don la rtsod pa zhes bya ba'i don yin no //
analyzed: rigs pas 'thad pa'i don la rtsod pa zhes bya ba'i don yin no //
translated: This is the meaning of ‚Äúlogical disputant.‚Äù

original: rigs pa'i sgra bshad pa de dag gis ni mngon sum rjes su dpag pa gnyi ga sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: rigs pa'i sgra bshad pa de dag gis ni mngon sum rjes su dpag pa gnyi ga sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: These etymologies of ‚Äúreason‚Äù are to be applied to both direct perception and inference.

original: 'di nyid 'dir bshad na rgyal bar blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'di nyid 'dir bshad na rgyal bar blta bar bya'o //
translated: This very point should be seen in the following verse from NƒÅgƒÅrjuna:

original: de lta na 'jig rten pa dang mthun pa'i rigs pa'i don du smra ba ni rigs pa smra ba yin par grub bo //
analyzed: de lta na 'jig rten pa dang mthun pa'i rigs pa'i don du smra ba ni rigs pa smra ba yin par grub bo //
translated: Thus, one who speaks in accordance with what is reasonable in the world is established as a speaker of reason.

original: yang gi sgra ni srid pa'i don yin te /
analyzed: yang gi sgra ni srid pa'i don yin te /
translated: The word ‚Äúalso‚Äù has the sense of possibility.

original: rgyal bar 'os pa yang pham pa yin te /
analyzed: rgyal bar 'os pa yang pham pa yin te /
translated: One who is worthy of victory is also defeated,

original: sgyu can gyis pham pa mi srid na yang pham pa zhes bya ba'i don yin no //
analyzed: sgyu can gyis pham pa mi srid na yang pham pa zhes bya ba'i don yin no //
translated: because it is possible that one who is deceitful is defeated, even though it is not the case that one who is not deceitful is defeated. This is the meaning of the word ‚Äúdefeated.‚Äù

original: pham pa zhes smras pa ci zhig yin zhe na /
analyzed: pham pa zhes smras pa ci zhig yin zhe na /
translated: What is it that is called ‚Äúdefeated‚Äù?

original: rtsod pa dag la zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: rtsod pa dag la zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: He says, ‚Äúin debates.‚Äù

original: phyogs snga ma dang phyi ma dag yongs su 'dzin pa sngon du song ba'i rgol ba dang phyir rgol ba dag gis rang dang gzhan gyi phyogs grub par byed pa dang grub pa'i don du brjod nas rtsod pa yin no //
analyzed: phyogs snga ma dang phyi ma dag yongs su 'dzin pa sngon du song ba'i rgol ba dang phyir rgol ba dag gis rang dang gzhan gyi phyogs grub par byed pa dang grub pa'i don du brjod nas rtsod pa yin no //
translated: Debating is when proponents and opponents, having taken up the prior and subsequent positions, speak for the sake of establishing their own position and refuting the other‚Äôs position.

original: gang yang slob ma tshangs par spyod pa dang lhan cig tu rtsod pa na tshig dor la sogs pa spangs nas rgyal bar 'dod pa rnams lhan cig tshig dor dang ltag chod brjod na tshar bcad pa'i gnas dang 'brel ba yin no //
analyzed: gang yang slob ma tshangs par spyod pa dang lhan cig tu rtsod pa na tshig dor la sogs pa spangs nas rgyal bar 'dod pa rnams lhan cig tshig dor dang ltag chod brjod na tshar bcad pa'i gnas dang 'brel ba yin no //
translated: When one debates with a student who is celibate, one should avoid such things as losing one‚Äôs temper. If one who wishes to win a debate uses such things as losing one‚Äôs temper and talking nonsense, one is in a position to be defeated.

original: rang gi phyogs la gnas nas rtsod pa dman pa gzu bo ma yin pa la gcig rtsod pa brjod pa ni gzu bo ma yin pa'i mtshan nyid du bshad pa de ni rang gi gzhung lugs tsam sha stag brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: rang gi phyogs la gnas nas rtsod pa dman pa gzu bo ma yin pa la gcig rtsod pa brjod pa ni gzu bo ma yin pa'i mtshan nyid du bshad pa de ni rang gi gzhung lugs tsam sha stag brjod par bya'o //
translated: When one debates while abiding in one‚Äôs own position, one should state only one‚Äôs own textual system, which is explained to be the characteristic of not being a bad debater.

original: 'o na 'di ni 'jig rten pa ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na 'di ni 'jig rten pa ma yin no zhe na /
translated: ‚Äú But this is not worldly practice!‚Äù

original: rgyal bar 'dod pas rtsod pa la tshig dor dang ltag chod ni tshar gcod pa'i gnas 'ga' zhig ni dgag pa yin pa'i phyir rigs pa smra ba dang brjod pa ni tha dad pa med pa yin no //
analyzed: rgyal bar 'dod pas rtsod pa la tshig dor dang ltag chod ni tshar gcod pa'i gnas 'ga' zhig ni dgag pa yin pa'i phyir rigs pa smra ba dang brjod pa ni tha dad pa med pa yin no //
translated: One who wishes to win a debate should avoid such things as losing one‚Äôs temper. Because some of the things that are grounds for defeat are negated, the one who speaks rationally and the one who speaks without being different are not different.

original: bden pa ma yin pa'i rnam par gzhag pa nye bar bkod pa zhes bya ba la bden pa ma yin pa'i rnam par gzhag pa ni tshig dor ba dang ltag chod brjod pas de dag nye bar dgod par byed pa ni tshar gcod pa'i gnas yin no //
analyzed: bden pa ma yin pa'i rnam par gzhag pa nye bar bkod pa zhes bya ba la bden pa ma yin pa'i rnam par gzhag pa ni tshig dor ba dang ltag chod brjod pas de dag nye bar dgod par byed pa ni tshar gcod pa'i gnas yin no //
translated: The term falsely positing means that one is defeated if one posits something that is not true, such as a verbal quibble or a frivolous rejoinder.

original: sgyu can zhes bya ba ni zhib tu dpyad nas rang gi rgyud kyi kha na ma tho ba sped par byed cing gzhan gyi rgyud kyi yon tan la smod par byed pa ni sgyu can zhes 'jig rten la grags shing brjod do //
analyzed: sgyu can zhes bya ba ni zhib tu dpyad nas rang gi rgyud kyi kha na ma tho ba sped par byed cing gzhan gyi rgyud kyi yon tan la smod par byed pa ni sgyu can zhes 'jig rten la grags shing brjod do //
translated: One who is deceptive is one who, after careful consideration, conceals his own faults and disparages the good qualities of others. This is well known and commonly said in the world.

original: bstan bcos las 'chab pa dang phrag dog nyid du gyur pa la rab tu grags so //üîΩtshar gcod par byed pas zhes bya ba ni phan pa la 'dir tshar gcod pa zhes bya ba'i sgra brjod do //
analyzed: bstan bcos las 'chab pa dang phrag dog nyid du gyur pa la rab tu grags so // tshar gcod par byed pas zhes bya ba ni phan pa la 'dir tshar gcod pa zhes bya ba'i sgra brjod do //
translated: In the treatises, concealment and envy are well known.üîΩThe term defeats means that one is defeated by one's own benefit.

original: pham par gyur ba ni brlag par byas pas zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: pham par gyur ba ni brlag par byas pas zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The term defeated means destroyed.

original: phyir zhes bya ba sgra de'i don ni shes par smra ba rnams la yang gang gi @153b phyir tshar gcod par byed pa de'i phyir zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: phyir zhes bya ba sgra de'i don ni shes par smra ba rnams la yang gang gi @153b phyir tshar gcod par byed pa de'i phyir zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of the word ‚Äúbecause‚Äù is that which refutes the assertion of the logicians.

original: de sun dbyung ba'i don du zhes bya ba ni do rnams dgag pa ni sun dbyung ba'o //
analyzed: de sun dbyung ba'i don du zhes bya ba ni do rnams dgag pa ni sun dbyung ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIn order to refute that‚Äù means that the refutation is the negation of those.

original: de'i shugs kyis mi bden par rnam par 'jog pa dang sgyu can dang tshar gcod par byed pa rnams dang 'brel ba yang yin no //
analyzed: de'i shugs kyis mi bden par rnam par 'jog pa dang sgyu can dang tshar gcod par byed pa rnams dang 'brel ba yang yin no //
translated: By implication, it is also related to the unreal, the deceptive, and the refutation.

original: de la mi bden pa'i rnam par gzhag pa de snyed cig la sun dbyung ba yin te /
analyzed: de la mi bden pa'i rnam par gzhag pa de snyed cig la sun dbyung ba yin te /
translated: Among those, the unreal is the object of refutation.

original: gang gi tshe mi bden pa'i rnam par gzhag par byed pa ni mi bden pa nyid kyis gzhan la gsal bar byas pa yin te /
analyzed: gang gi tshe mi bden pa'i rnam par gzhag par byed pa ni mi bden pa nyid kyis gzhan la gsal bar byas pa yin te /
translated: When one makes an unreal presentation, one makes it clear to others by means of the unreal.

original: de'i tshe rigs pa nyid kyis tha dad pa gsal bar byas pa na 'ga' zhig kyang pham par 'gyur ba med pa'i phyir mi bden pa'i rnam par gzhag pa sun dbyung bar mdzad pa yin la sgyu can rnams kyang rigs par smra ba nyid kyis gsal bar sunüîΩdbyung bar mdzad pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i tshe rigs pa nyid kyis tha dad pa gsal bar byas pa na 'ga' zhig kyang pham par 'gyur ba med pa'i phyir mi bden pa'i rnam par gzhag pa sun dbyung bar mdzad pa yin la sgyu can rnams kyang rigs par smra ba nyid kyis gsal bar sun dbyung bar mdzad pa yin no //
translated: At that time, when the reason itself makes the difference clear, there is no defeat for anyone. Therefore, the false position is refuted. And the deceitful are also refuted by the very fact that they speak with reason.

original: tshar gcod par byed pa yang sgyu can gyis rigs pa ma yin pa byed pas tshar gcod par grags pa de ltar 'byin pas gsum po de dag sun 'byin pa ni de sun dbyung ba'i don yin no //
analyzed: tshar gcod par byed pa yang sgyu can gyis rigs pa ma yin pa byed pas tshar gcod par grags pa de ltar 'byin pas gsum po de dag sun 'byin pa ni de sun dbyung ba'i don yin no //
translated: The refutation of the three is the meaning of the refutation.

original: 'di brtsams so zhes bya ba ni rab tu byed pa'i don bdag nyid kyi blo la yongs su rdzogs nas rnam par gnas pa 'di zhes bya ba'i sgra shes pas nges par byas pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di brtsams so zhes bya ba ni rab tu byed pa'i don bdag nyid kyi blo la yongs su rdzogs nas rnam par gnas pa 'di zhes bya ba'i sgra shes pas nges par byas pa yin no //
translated: The phrase I have composed this is a statement of certainty by the speaker, who has fully completed and established in his own mind the meaning of the treatise. The word this refers to the treatise.

original: brtsams so zhes bya ba ni rab tu byed pa'i gzhung gi don brtsam par bya bar bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: brtsams so zhes bya ba ni rab tu byed pa'i gzhung gi don brtsam par bya bar bstan pa yin no //

original: rab tu byed pa zhes bya ba yang ci zhig yin zhe na /
analyzed: rab tu byed pa zhes bya ba yang ci zhig yin zhe na /
translated: What is a ‚Äúchapter‚Äù?

original: sgrub pa'i yan lag ma yin tshig //üîΩces bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: sgrub pa'i yan lag ma yin tshig // ces bya ba la sogs pa smos so //

analyzed: sgrub pa'i yan lag ma yin par brjod pa zhes bya ba'i don to //

original: yang na ni sgrub pa'i yan lag ma yin pa de'i tshe sgrub pa'i yan lag ma yin pa'i tshig ni sgrub par byed pa'i yan lag ma yin ba de ni brjod par bya ba yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: yang na ni sgrub pa'i yan lag ma yin pa de'i tshe sgrub pa'i yan lag ma yin pa'i tshig ni sgrub par byed pa'i yan lag ma yin ba de ni brjod par bya ba yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Or, if it is not a part of a proof, then a statement that is not a part of a proof is a statement that is not a part of a proof. The meaning is that it is to be stated.

analyzed: skyon mi brjod pa ni skyon mi brjod pa'o // skyin ma yin pa bsal bar byas so //

original: zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i don to //

original: yang skyon ma pa ni skyon min pa ste /
analyzed: yang skyon ma pa ni skyon min pa ste /

analyzed: de brjod par gyur pas na skyon mi brjod par gyur pa'o //
translated: Since he states that, he does not state a fault.

original: skyon ma yin pa bsal bar byas //
analyzed: skyon ma yin pa bsal bar byas //
translated: He clears away what is not a fault

analyzed: zhes bya ba'i don to // gnyis po dag tshar @154a * //
translated: means that he does not state a fault.

original: gcad pa'i gnas yin zhes bya ba ni rgol ba dang phyir rgol ba gnyis po rigs pas pham pa'i gnas yin no //
analyzed: gcad pa'i gnas yin zhes bya ba ni rgol ba dang phyir rgol ba gnyis po rigs pas pham pa'i gnas yin no //
translated: The two are the basis for defeat means that the two, the proponent and the opponent, are the basis for defeat by reasoning.

analyzed: de ltar na sgrub pa'i yan lag ma yin pa'i tshig gis ni rgol ba pham pa yin no //
translated: Thus, the proponent is defeated by words that are not a part of the proof.

original: skyon mi brjod pa ni phyir rgol ba pham pa'i gnas yin no //üîΩgzhan dag na /
analyzed: skyon mi brjod pa ni phyir rgol ba pham pa'i gnas yin no // gzhan dag na /

analyzed: mi rigs phyir na mi 'dod do // zhes bya ba ni ji skad brjod pa'i tshar gcod pa'i gnas gnyis po dag las gzhan du dam bcas nas yod par dgod pa la sogs pa yin pa de ni gang gi phyir rigs pas tshar gcad pa'i gnas ma yin pa de de'i phyir rigs pa smra ba
translated: Others say, Because it is unreasonable, it is not asserted.

original: rnams ni tshar gcad pa'i gnas su mi 'dod do //
analyzed: rnams ni tshar gcad pa'i gnas su mi 'dod do //
translated: The two bases for defeat as they have been stated, the proponent is defeated by not stating a reason and example, and the opponent is defeated by not stating a fault. Other than those two, such as stating the thesis, The eye does not see visible form, is not a basis for defeat by reasoning.üîΩTherefore, the proponents of reasoning do not assert that because it is unreasonable, it is not asserted.

original: yang zhes bya ba de'i sgra ni gang gi phyir gyi don to //
analyzed: yang zhes bya ba de'i sgra ni gang gi phyir gyi don to //
translated: The word ‚Äúalso‚Äù has the sense of ‚Äúbecause.‚Äù

original: phyir na zhes bya ba'i sgra ni de'i phyir gyi don to //
analyzed: phyir na zhes bya ba'i sgra ni de'i phyir gyi don to //
translated: The word ‚Äútherefore‚Äù has the sense of ‚Äúfor this reason.‚Äù

original: 'dod pa'i don zhes bya ba ni rgol bas sgrub par byed pas mngon par 'dod pa bsgrub pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i don zhes bya ba ni rgol bas sgrub par byed pas mngon par 'dod pa bsgrub pa yin no //
translated: The ‚Äúdesired object‚Äù is the object that is desired by the disputant.

original: sgrub pa zhes bya ba'i dngos po sgrub par byed do //
analyzed: sgrub pa zhes bya ba'i dngos po sgrub par byed do //
translated: The ‚Äúproof‚Äù is the establishment of the object.

original: sgrub pa'i sgras ni rgyu dang sgrub par byed pa zhes bya bar 'dod do //
analyzed: sgrub pa'i sgras ni rgyu dang sgrub par byed pa zhes bya bar 'dod do //
translated: The word ‚Äúproof‚Äù is accepted as meaning ‚Äúcause‚Äù and ‚Äúmeans of proof.‚Äù

original: de sgrub par byed pa'i yan lag yin no zhes bya ba ni grub pa'i dngos po 'di sgrub par byed pa de ni 'dir yan lag gi sgra brjod do //
analyzed: de sgrub par byed pa'i yan lag yin no zhes bya ba ni grub pa'i dngos po 'di sgrub par byed pa de ni 'dir yan lag gi sgra brjod do //
translated: The ‚Äúmember of the proof‚Äù is that which proves the object to be established. Here the word ‚Äúmember‚Äù is used to express that.

original: de lta na yang sgrub par byed pa'i yan lag dang phan 'dogs par byed ces bya ba ni rnam grangs yin no //
analyzed: de lta na yang sgrub par byed pa'i yan lag dang phan 'dogs par byed ces bya ba ni rnam grangs yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúMember of the proof‚Äù and ‚Äúbeneficial‚Äù are synonyms.

original: de yang 'dir yan lag tu byed pa la sogs pa yin no //
analyzed: de yang 'dir yan lag tu byed pa la sogs pa yin no //
translated: And that is the member here that is the means of proof, etc.

original: 'on ni rgol ba dbang du byas pa ni gzhan gyi don gyi rjes su dpag pa'i skabs yin te de ji ltar dngos po'i ngo bo 'di yan lag yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'on ni rgol ba dbang du byas pa ni gzhan gyi don gyi rjes su dpag pa'i skabs yin te de ji ltar dngos po'i ngo bo 'di yan lag yin zhe na /
translated: But the opponent is brought under control in the context of inference for the sake of others. How is this nature of a thing a part of that?

original: gzhan gyi don gyi rjes su dpag pa la yang don gyi ngo bo yan lag yin no //
analyzed: gzhan gyi don gyi rjes su dpag pa la yang don gyi ngo bo yan lag yin no //
translated: In inference for the sake of others, the nature of the thing is a part.

original: de lta na yang don gyis don go bar byed kyi sgras ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta na yang don gyis don go bar byed kyi sgras ni ma yin no //
translated: Even so, the meaning is understood through the meaning, not through the words.

original: sgras kyang sgra'i don la rten par byed pa'i phyir sgrub par byed par 'dod de rang nyid kyis nus pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: sgras kyang sgra'i don la rten par byed pa'i phyir sgrub par byed par 'dod de rang nyid kyis nus pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Words are accepted as establishing because they support the meaning of the words, not because they are themselves capable.

original: de brjod pa ni bsgrub pa'i yan lag brjod pa'o zhes bya ba bsgrub pa'i sgrub par byed pa rjod par byed pa'i don yin no //
analyzed: de brjod pa ni bsgrub pa'i yan lag brjod pa'o zhes bya ba bsgrub pa'i sgrub par byed pa rjod par byed pa'i don yin no //
translated: The statement of that is the statement of a part of the proof. The word proof has the meaning of establishing.

original: de mi brjod pa'i 'di ni tshar gcad pa'i gnas yin no zhes bya ba ni gal te rgol ba las grub par sgrub par byed pa mi brjod pa de'i tshe pham pa'i gnas su brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de mi brjod pa'i 'di ni tshar gcad pa'i gnas yin no zhes bya ba ni gal te rgol ba las grub par sgrub par byed pa mi brjod pa de'i tshe pham pa'i gnas su brjod par bya'o //
translated: The failure to state that is a ground for defeat. If one fails to state the proof that establishes the thesis to the opponent, then that should be declared a ground for defeat.

original: ci zhig byed pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci zhig byed pa yin zhe na /
translated: What is it?

original: de ni khas len pa'i rgol ba ni zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de ni khas len pa'i rgol ba ni zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: He says, ‚ÄúThe disputant who accepts the thesis.‚Äù

original: spobs pa med pas mi smra bar 'dug pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni de'i sgras brjod par mi nus @154b pas ma 'brel ba yin no //
analyzed: spobs pa med pas mi smra bar 'dug pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni de'i sgras brjod par mi nus @154b pas ma 'brel ba yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúBecause he is speechless and remains silent‚Äù means that he is unable to express himself by means of words.

original: 'di skad ston pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di skad ston pa yin te /
translated: This is what is being shown:

original: rtsod pa'i dus su spobs pa med pas mi smra bar 'dug nas cung zad kyang brjod pa med do //
analyzed: rtsod pa'i dus su spobs pa med pas mi smra bar 'dug nas cung zad kyang brjod pa med do //
translated: In the time it takes to dispute, he remains silent because he is speechless and does not say anything at all.

original: spobs pa med pa ni 'di mi brjod pa'i rgyu yin te /
analyzed: spobs pa med pa ni 'di mi brjod pa'i rgyu yin te /
translated: Speechlessness is the reason why he does not express himself.

original: mi smra ba na /
analyzed: mi smra ba na /
translated: When he remains silent,

original: dngos su mi brjod par bstan pa yin no zhes bshad do //
analyzed: dngos su mi brjod par bstan pa yin no zhes bshad do //
translated: he does not actually express himself.

original: sgrub pa'i yan lag la nus pa med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni yang na sgrub par byed pa'i yan lag nus pa med par 'gyur te gtan tshigs ma brjod pas de ni ma grub par byed par nus par 'gyur //
analyzed: sgrub pa'i yan lag la nus pa med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni yang na sgrub par byed pa'i yan lag nus pa med par 'gyur te gtan tshigs ma brjod pas de ni ma grub par byed par nus par 'gyur //
translated: ‚ÄúBecause the means of proof are ineffective‚Äù means that the means of proof are ineffective, because the reason is not stated.

original: de lta na gtan tshigs ma brjod pa ni bstan to zhes bya ba'i don yin no //
analyzed: de lta na gtan tshigs ma brjod pa ni bstan to zhes bya ba'i don yin no //
translated: Thus, the meaning of ‚Äúhe does not express himself‚Äù is that the reason is not stated.

original: 'di ni 'bras bur gyur pa ni phal pa yin pas ma brjod par bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni 'bras bur gyur pa ni phal pa yin pas ma brjod par bstan pa yin no //
translated: This is taught to show that the result is ordinary, so it is not mentioned.

original: de lta na nus pa ni sgrub par byed par brjod na yang sgrub par byed pa dang 'bras bu ma thob na ji ltar yang de sgrub par byed pa'i yan lag yin zhe na /
analyzed: de lta na nus pa ni sgrub par byed par brjod na yang sgrub par byed pa dang 'bras bu ma thob na ji ltar yang de sgrub par byed pa'i yan lag yin zhe na /
translated: If that is so, even if the means of accomplishment is stated, how can it be a means of accomplishment if the result is not obtained?

original: rtags rnam pa gsum nyid ni mngon sum ma yin pa sgrub pa'i yan lag ste zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: rtags rnam pa gsum nyid ni mngon sum ma yin pa sgrub pa'i yan lag ste zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The three types of reason are the means of accomplishing what is not directly perceived.

original: gtan tshigs rnam pa gsum lkog tu gyur pa'i don sgrub pa'i thabs yin no //
analyzed: gtan tshigs rnam pa gsum lkog tu gyur pa'i don sgrub pa'i thabs yin no //
translated: The three types of reason are the means of accomplishing a hidden object.

original: de lta na dngos po sgrub pa dang / dngos po med pa sgrub par byed pa zhes bya ba gtan tshigs gnyis te /
analyzed: de lta na dngos po sgrub pa dang / dngos po med pa sgrub par byed pa zhes bya ba gtan tshigs gnyis te /
translated: Thus, there are two types of reason: accomplishing an existent and accomplishing a non-existent.

original: dngos po sgrub par byed pa la yang tha dad par bsgrub par bya ba sgrub don grub pa la bye brag med pa'i zhe na /
analyzed: dngos po sgrub par byed pa la yang tha dad par bsgrub par bya ba sgrub don grub pa la bye brag med pa'i zhe na /
translated: If accomplishing an existent is accomplished without distinction, what is the point of accomplishing a non-existent?

original: 'dod pa'i do par byed pa'i dbye bas rnam pa gnyis yin no //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i do par byed pa'i dbye bas rnam pa gnyis yin no //
translated: It is twofold by the division of accomplishing the desired object.

original: de ltar re zhig de dag 'dir gang gi gtan tshigs su 'gyur ba yin snyam na /üîΩmed na mi 'byung ba nyid du nges par gyur pa'i phyir gang yang gsum kho na las lhag pa ni med do //
analyzed: de ltar re zhig de dag 'dir gang gi gtan tshigs su 'gyur ba yin snyam na / med na mi 'byung ba nyid du nges par gyur pa'i phyir gang yang gsum kho na las lhag pa ni med do //
translated: Thus, if one thinks that these are the reasons here,üîΩthen there are not more than three, because it is ascertained that they are the invariable concomitants.

original: ci ste rnam pa gsum yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci ste rnam pa gsum yin zhe na /
translated: But if there are three,

original: rang bzhin dang 'bras bu dang mi dmigs pa'o zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: rang bzhin dang 'bras bu dang mi dmigs pa'o zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: then they are nature, effect, and non-apprehension.

original: de dag las rnam pa gzhan du mtshan nyid kyis byed par nus pa ma yin pa'i phyir 'dir ma brjod do //
analyzed: de dag las rnam pa gzhan du mtshan nyid kyis byed par nus pa ma yin pa'i phyir 'dir ma brjod do //
translated: Since they are not able to function as characteristics in any other way, they are not mentioned here.

original: 'dir yang khyab par sgrub par byed pa tsam 'di dag la byed par 'dod pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dir yang khyab par sgrub par byed pa tsam 'di dag la byed par 'dod pa yin no //
translated: Here, too, it is held that they function as mere proofs of pervasion.

original: ji ltar rtags rnam pa gsum la 'dir sgrub par byed pa 'di yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar rtags rnam pa gsum la 'dir sgrub par byed pa 'di yin zhe na /
translated: How is it that there are three kinds of reasons here, and how do they prove?

original: bsgrub par bya bas khyab pa rab tu bsgrubs nas chos can la yod par sgrub par byed de zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: bsgrub par bya bas khyab pa rab tu bsgrubs nas chos can la yod par sgrub par byed de zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Having established the pervasion by the probandum, one proves that it exists in the subject.

original: gang gi tshe bsgrub par bya ba'i chos kyis khyab pa rab tu bstan nas chos can la yod par gyur par bstan pa de'i tshe gtan tshigs su nus pa yin te /
analyzed: gang gi tshe bsgrub par bya ba'i chos kyis khyab pa rab tu bstan nas chos can la yod par gyur par bstan pa de'i tshe gtan tshigs su nus pa yin te /
translated: When the pervasion by the property to be established is well-taught, and when the presence on the subject is taught, then the reason is able.

original: ji ltar khyab pa bstan pa yin /
analyzed: ji ltar khyab pa bstan pa yin /
translated: How is the pervasion taught?

original: ji ltar chos can la yod par gyur ba bstan pa yin zhe na @155a * //
analyzed: ji ltar chos can la yod par gyur ba bstan pa yin zhe na @155a * //
translated: How is the presence on the subject taught?

original: 'di ltar gang yod pa'am byas pa de thams cad ni mi rtag pa ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar gang yod pa'am byas pa de thams cad ni mi rtag pa ste /
translated: Thus, it is said: ‚ÄúWhatever exists or is produced is impermanent,

original: dper na bum pa la sogs pa lta bu'o zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: dper na bum pa la sogs pa lta bu'o zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: like a pot, etc.‚Äù

original: ji ltar zhes bya ba ni nye bar bstan pa'i ngag go //
analyzed: ji ltar zhes bya ba ni nye bar bstan pa'i ngag go //
translated: ‚ÄúThus‚Äù is a demonstrative verbal particle.

original: gang zhes bya ba ni ma lus pa'i sgra yin pa'i phyir thams cad kyi don rjod par byed do //
analyzed: gang zhes bya ba ni ma lus pa'i sgra yin pa'i phyir thams cad kyi don rjod par byed do //
translated: ‚ÄúWhatever‚Äù is a term for the entirety of something, and thus it expresses the meaning of ‚Äúall.‚Äù

original: yod pa zhes bya ba ni yod cing bdog par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: yod pa zhes bya ba ni yod cing bdog par gyur pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúExists‚Äù means to be existent and to be possessed.

original: byas pa zhes bya ba ni rgyu dang rkyen las skyes pa des na 'di skad du ston par 'gyur te /
analyzed: byas pa zhes bya ba ni rgyu dang rkyen las skyes pa des na 'di skad du ston par 'gyur te /
translated: ‚ÄúProduced‚Äù means to be arisen from causes and conditions. Thus, it is taught as follows:

original: gang zhes bya ba ni cung zad cig yod pa'am rgyu dang rkyen las yod pa gang yin pa de ni 'jig par khong du chud par bya ste /
analyzed: gang zhes bya ba ni cung zad cig yod pa'am rgyu dang rkyen las yod pa gang yin pa de ni 'jig par khong du chud par bya ste /
translated: Whatever exists even the slightest bit, or exists from causes and conditions, should be understood as perishable.

original: dper na bum pa lta bu ste /
analyzed: dper na bum pa lta bu ste /
translated: For example, like a pot.

original: 'di ni de srid du khyab pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni de srid du khyab pa yin no //
translated: This is the pervasion.

original: sgra yang yod pa 'am ma byas pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni sgra yod pa 'am sgra byas pa dang ldan yin no zhes 'dis chos bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: sgra yang yod pa 'am ma byas pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni sgra yod pa 'am sgra byas pa dang ldan yin no zhes 'dis chos bstan pa yin no //
translated: Sound is existent or non-produced. This teaches the property of the subject.

original: sgra thams cad la don 'di brtag par bya ste /
analyzed: sgra thams cad la don 'di brtag par bya ste /
translated: This meaning should be examined for all sounds.

original: res 'ga' yod pa'am res 'ga' byas pas yin no zhes bya bar dgongs pa yin no //
analyzed: res 'ga' yod pa'am res 'ga' byas pas yin no zhes bya bar dgongs pa yin no //
translated: The intention is that it is because sometimes it exists or sometimes it is produced.

original: rigs pa can gzhan dag yan lag dag rim gyis nges par brjod par 'dod de //
analyzed: rigs pa can gzhan dag yan lag dag rim gyis nges par brjod par 'dod de //
translated: Other logicians desire to state the parts in sequence.

original: de'i phyir rang gi grub pa'i mtha' rim gyis nges pa dgag pa'i phyir //
analyzed: de'i phyir rang gi grub pa'i mtha' rim gyis nges pa dgag pa'i phyir //
translated: Therefore, in order to refute the sequence of their tenets,

original: 'di la yang go rims nges pa 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin te zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: 'di la yang go rims nges pa 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin te zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: it is said: There is no sequence here at all.

original: 'dir yang gang sngar khyab pa bstan pa yin la phyis phyogs kyi chos yin te de nas ni khyab pa yin no zhes bya ba nges pa yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'dir yang gang sngar khyab pa bstan pa yin la phyis phyogs kyi chos yin te de nas ni khyab pa yin no zhes bya ba nges pa yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Here also, there is no certainty that the pervasion is taught first and the property of the subject later, for sometimes the pervasion is taught later.

original: rgyu ni ci zhig gis 'dod pa'i don grub pa la bye brag med pa'i zhe na /
analyzed: rgyu ni ci zhig gis 'dod pa'i don grub pa la bye brag med pa'i zhe na /
translated: What is the reason for establishing the desired meaning without distinction?

original: 'dod pa'i don sgrub par gnyi ga la bye brag med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i don sgrub par gnyi ga la bye brag med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no distinction between the two in establishing the desired meaning.

original: gal te 'dod pa'i don grub pa yang cha shas su brjod pa de bzhin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te 'dod pa'i don grub pa yang cha shas su brjod pa de bzhin no zhe na /
translated: If the establishment of the desired meaning is also stated in parts, so be it.

original: go rims nges pa'i yan lag tu byas pa la khyad par ci yang med do //
analyzed: go rims nges pa'i yan lag tu byas pa la khyad par ci yang med do //
translated: There is no difference at all in making the order a part.

original: des kyang chos can la dang por yod par bsgrubs nas phyis kyang khyab par rab tu bsgrub pa nyid yin te zhes bya ba ni cig car yang phyogs kyi chos bstan nas khyab pa rab tu bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: des kyang chos can la dang por yod par bsgrubs nas phyis kyang khyab par rab tu bsgrub pa nyid yin te zhes bya ba ni cig car yang phyogs kyi chos bstan nas khyab pa rab tu bstan pa yin no //
translated: By that, even if the existence in the subject is established first and then the pervasion is established, it is said that even simultaneously, the property of the subject is taught and the pervasion is taught.

original: dper na sgra ni yod pa'am byas pa yin la zhes bya ba ni dngos po phyogs kyi chos bstan pa yin no //üîΩde lta bu gang yin pa de thams cad mi rtag pa yin te// dper na bum pa la sogs pa'i lta bu'o zhes bya ba ni gzhan yang gang dag yod pa'am byas pa yin pas 'di yang mi rtag pa yin te /
analyzed: dper na sgra ni yod pa'am byas pa yin la zhes bya ba ni dngos po phyogs kyi chos bstan pa yin no // de lta bu gang yin pa de thams cad mi rtag pa yin te// dper na bum pa la sogs pa'i lta bu'o zhes bya ba ni gzhan yang gang dag yod pa'am byas pa yin pas 'di yang mi rtag pa yin te /
translated: For example, ‚Äúsound is either existent or produced‚Äù teaches the property of the subject.üîΩ‚Äú Whatever is like that is impermanent, like a pot, for example‚Äù teaches the pervasion.

original: @155b dper na bum pa bzhin no zhes bya ba 'dis ni khyab pa bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: @155b dper na bum pa bzhin no zhes bya ba 'dis ni khyab pa bstan pa yin no //
translated: ‚Äú Whatever is existent or produced is also impermanent, like a pot, for example‚Äù teaches the pervasion.

original: ji ltar 'di dag gis khyab pa rab tu grub pa yang yin zhe na /üîΩ'dir khyab pa sgrub par byed pa ni bsgrub par bya ba las bzlog pa la gnod pa can gyi tshad ma nye bar bstan pa ste zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: ji ltar 'di dag gis khyab pa rab tu grub pa yang yin zhe na / 'dir khyab pa sgrub par byed pa ni bsgrub par bya ba las bzlog pa la gnod pa can gyi tshad ma nye bar bstan pa ste zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: How is the pervasion established by these?üîΩHere, the proof of the pervasion is the demonstration of an undermining valid cognition in the opposite of the probandum.

original: 'dir zhes bya ba ni sbyor ba dgod pa de'i tshe mi mthun pa'i phyogs la gnod pa can gyi tshad ma bstan par gyur pas khyab pa bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dir zhes bya ba ni sbyor ba dgod pa de'i tshe mi mthun pa'i phyogs la gnod pa can gyi tshad ma bstan par gyur pas khyab pa bstan pa yin no //
translated: Here means at the time of positing the syllogism, the pervasion is taught by demonstrating an undermining valid cognition in the discordant side.

original: gal te 'ga' zhig rtsod pa yin te de yang dngos por gyur ba dang skad cig ma ma yin pa zhes bya ba ci 'dir 'gal ba zhes bya bar rab tu brjod par bya ba zhe na /
analyzed: gal te 'ga' zhig rtsod pa yin te de yang dngos por gyur ba dang skad cig ma ma yin pa zhes bya ba ci 'dir 'gal ba zhes bya bar rab tu brjod par bya ba zhe na /
translated: If someone argues that this is contradictory, then what is it that is called contradictory here?

original: gal te yod pa'am byas pa thams cad skad cig ma re rer 'jig par ma gyur na zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gal te yod pa'am byas pa thams cad skad cig ma re rer 'jig par ma gyur na zhes bya ba ni /
translated: If all that exists or is produced were not to disintegrate moment by moment,

original: gang gi tshe yod pa'am byas pa thams cad skad cig skad cig mi 'jig pa de'i tshe skad cig ma ma yin pa la rim dang cig car don byed par mi rigs pa'i phyir yod pa'i mtshan nyid ni don byed nus pa yin la /
analyzed: gang gi tshe yod pa'am byas pa thams cad skad cig skad cig mi 'jig pa de'i tshe skad cig ma ma yin pa la rim dang cig car don byed par mi rigs pa'i phyir yod pa'i mtshan nyid ni don byed nus pa yin la /
translated: then at that time, since it is illogical that what is not momentary performs a function either gradually or instantaneously, the definition of existence is that which is able to perform a function.

original: de las bzlog pa'i phyir med pa kho nar 'gyur te zhes bya ba ni gang yang skad cig ma ma yin pa'i don ni rim gyis kyang de don med pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de las bzlog pa'i phyir med pa kho nar 'gyur te zhes bya ba ni gang yang skad cig ma ma yin pa'i don ni rim gyis kyang de don med pa ma yin te /
translated: Since it is the opposite of that, it would definitely be nonexistent.

original: lhan cig byed pa la ni mi ltos pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lhan cig byed pa la ni mi ltos pa'i phyir ro //
translated: That which is not momentary does not perform a function even gradually, because it does not rely on cooperating conditions.

original: lhag cig byed pa la ltos na ni dngos po rnams rim gyis don gyi bya ba byed par 'gyur te /
analyzed: lhag cig byed pa la ltos na ni dngos po rnams rim gyis don gyi bya ba byed par 'gyur te /
translated: If it were dependent on the activity of another, then things would perform the function of an object gradually,

original: rtag pa'i khyad par bogs dbyung du med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtag pa'i khyad par bogs dbyung du med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the difference of permanence cannot be enhanced.

original: lhan cig byed pa la ltos pa med pa des na rim gyis byed pa ni ma yin la cig car byed par yang mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: lhan cig byed pa la ltos pa med pa des na rim gyis byed pa ni ma yin la cig car byed par yang mi 'gyur te /
translated: Since it is not dependent on the activity of another, it does not perform the function gradually, nor does it perform it all at once,

original: don gyi bya ba byed pa'i rang bzhin yin na ni phyi nas kyang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: don gyi bya ba byed pa'i rang bzhin yin na ni phyi nas kyang 'gyur ro //
translated: because if it has the nature of performing the function of an object, it will do so later.

original: 'di don gyi bya ba byed pa gang yin pa de ni skad cig ma gnyis pa la sogs pa'i gnas skabs rnams su 'bras bu ci'i phyir na byed par mi 'gyur //
analyzed: 'di don gyi bya ba byed pa gang yin pa de ni skad cig ma gnyis pa la sogs pa'i gnas skabs rnams su 'bras bu ci'i phyir na byed par mi 'gyur //
translated: Why would that which performs the function of an object not perform its effect in the states of the second moment and so on?

original: gang gi phyir skad cig ma ma yin pa rnams ni rim gyis sbyor ba la sogs pa 'thad pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir skad cig ma ma yin pa rnams ni rim gyis sbyor ba la sogs pa 'thad pa ma yin no //
translated: Because it is not tenable that things that are not momentary perform their function gradually and so on.

original: de'i phyir don gyi bya ba byed par nus pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir don gyi bya ba byed par nus pa ma yin te /
translated: Therefore they are not able to perform the function of an object.

original: gang yod pa'i mtshan nyid yin pa dang de ni skad cig ma ma yin pa las ldog pa'i phyir yod pa ni skad cig ma ma yin pa la zhugs pa med do //
analyzed: gang yod pa'i mtshan nyid yin pa dang de ni skad cig ma ma yin pa las ldog pa'i phyir yod pa ni skad cig ma ma yin pa la zhugs pa med do //
translated: Because it is the characteristic of what exists, and because it is the opposite of what is not momentary, existence does not occur in what is not momentary.

original: de lta na don gyi bya ba byed pa gang yin pa de ni yod pa bstan gto //
analyzed: de lta na don gyi bya ba byed pa gang yin pa de ni yod pa bstan gto //
translated: Thus, whatever performs the function of an object is taught to be existent.

original: skad cig ma ma yin pa don gyi bya ba byed pa med pa yin na /
analyzed: skad cig ma ma yin pa don gyi bya ba byed pa med pa yin na /
translated: What is not momentary does not perform the function of an object.

original: gang las de dag yod par 'gyur /
analyzed: gang las de dag yod par 'gyur /
translated: From what would those exist?

original: gang gi phyir nye bar brjod pa'i nus pa thams cad dang bral ba'i mtshan nyid ni nye @156a * //
analyzed: gang gi phyir nye bar brjod pa'i nus pa thams cad dang bral ba'i mtshan nyid ni nye @156a * //
translated: Because the characteristic of what is devoid of all the capacities of expression is inexpressible.

original: bar brjod pa med pa yin no zhes bya ba ni gang zhig la las yang dang yang du gnas pa'i mthar med par shes pa tsam yin pa de'i phyir des na brjod du med pa zhes brjod do //
analyzed: bar brjod pa med pa yin no zhes bya ba ni gang zhig la las yang dang yang du gnas pa'i mthar med par shes pa tsam yin pa de'i phyir des na brjod du med pa zhes brjod do //
translated: That which is merely known to be without an end to the repeated abiding of action is therefore called inexpressible.

original: nges par nus pa thams cad brjod du med pa byas pa zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: nges par nus pa thams cad brjod du med pa byas pa zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: It is definitely inexpressible because it is devoid of all capacities.

original: thams cad smos pa ni bum pa la sogs pa'i yul la nus pa dang mi nus pa tha dad pa mthong ba'i phyir med pa'i yongs su spangs pa'i don yin pa de lta na snam bus ni gos la sogs pa'i don gyi bya ba byed pa dang /
analyzed: thams cad smos pa ni bum pa la sogs pa'i yul la nus pa dang mi nus pa tha dad pa mthong ba'i phyir med pa'i yongs su spangs pa'i don yin pa de lta na snam bus ni gos la sogs pa'i don gyi bya ba byed pa dang /
translated: The term ‚Äúall‚Äù is mentioned because the capacity and incapacity of objects such as pots are seen to be different.

original: mi byed pa dang bum pa yang chu 'dzin pa la sogs pa'i don gyi bya ba byed pa dang mi byed pa de dag de tsam gyis yod pa ma yin pa dang med pa bshad pas yin no //
analyzed: mi byed pa dang bum pa yang chu 'dzin pa la sogs pa'i don gyi bya ba byed pa dang mi byed pa de dag de tsam gyis yod pa ma yin pa dang med pa bshad pas yin no //
translated: Thus, a cloth does not perform the function of an object such as a cloth, and it does not perform the function of an object such as a pot that holds water, and so on.

original: gal te gnod par byed pa'i chad ma bstan kyang nyes pa ci zhig tu 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: gal te gnod par byed pa'i chad ma bstan kyang nyes pa ci zhig tu 'gyur zhe na /
translated: If you ask, ‚ÄúWhat is the fault if you do not state a reason that refutes the object of negation?‚Äù

original: de ltar sgrub par byed pa'i bsgrub par bya ba las ldog pa zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de ltar sgrub par byed pa'i bsgrub par bya ba las ldog pa zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The text says, ‚ÄúThe object of affirmation is reversed.‚Äù

original: sngar bshad pa'i rnam pas gal te gtan tshigs bsgrub par bya ba'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs la gnod pa tsam gyis tshad ma nye bar bstan pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: sngar bshad pa'i rnam pas gal te gtan tshigs bsgrub par bya ba'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs la gnod pa tsam gyis tshad ma nye bar bstan pa de'i tshe /
translated: As explained earlier, if you merely state a reason that refutes the discordant side of the object of affirmation, then the object of affirmation is reversed.

original: gal te mi mthun pa'i phyogs la ma mthong du zin kyang de de ltar gtan tshigs mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang lhan cig par 'gal ba med par phyir yod pa'am byas pa'i gtan tshigs mi mthun pa'i phyogs la rtag ces bya ba la yang yod par dogs parüîΩ'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: gal te mi mthun pa'i phyogs la ma mthong du zin kyang de de ltar gtan tshigs mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang lhan cig par 'gal ba med par phyir yod pa'am byas pa'i gtan tshigs mi mthun pa'i phyogs la rtag ces bya ba la yang yod par dogs par 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: Even if one does not see the reason in the discordant side, still there is doubt that it exists there, or that the reason, being produced, exists in the discordant side, which is permanent.

original: dogs pa yod na yang nyes pa ci zhig yod ce na /
analyzed: dogs pa yod na yang nyes pa ci zhig yod ce na /
translated: If there is doubt, what is the fault?

original: de'i phyir ldog pa la the tshom za ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir ldog pa la the tshom za ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Therefore, it says, ‚ÄúIf there is doubt about the contrapositive,‚Äù and so on.

original: gang gi tshe gtan tshigs mi mthun pa'i phyogs las ldog pa la the tshom za ba de'i tshe ma nges pa'i gtan tshigs su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang gi tshe gtan tshigs mi mthun pa'i phyogs las ldog pa la the tshom za ba de'i tshe ma nges pa'i gtan tshigs su 'gyur ro //
translated: When there is doubt about the contrapositive of the reason in the discordant side, then the reason is inconclusive.

original: 'o na ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs la gtan tshigs ma mthong na mthong ba dang 'bral bas gzhan med par sgrub par byed pa yod pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: 'o na ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs la gtan tshigs ma mthong na mthong ba dang 'bral bas gzhan med par sgrub par byed pa yod pa ma yin nam /
translated: But if one does not see the reason in the discordant side, then, since it is not seen, is it not the case that there is no proof of its nonexistence?

original: de la gnod par byed pa'i tshad ma gzhan gyis dgos pa ci zhig yod ce na /
analyzed: de la gnod par byed pa'i tshad ma gzhan gyis dgos pa ci zhig yod ce na /
translated: What need is there for another valid cognition to invalidate it?

original: de'i phyir ma mthong ba tsam gyis kyang ldog pa ma yin te zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir ma mthong ba tsam gyis kyang ldog pa ma yin te zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore, it is said, ‚ÄúIt is not that the reason is reversed merely by non-perception.‚Äù

original: ma mthong ba tsam gyis mi mthun pa'i phyogs la gtan tshigs ldog par nus pa ma yin no //
analyzed: ma mthong ba tsam gyis mi mthun pa'i phyogs la gtan tshigs ldog par nus pa ma yin no //
translated: The reason is not reversed with respect to the discordant class merely by non-perception.

original: 'dir rgyu dang khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa la sogs pa go bar byed pa nyid ni 'dir gzung bar bya ba bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dir rgyu dang khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa la sogs pa go bar byed pa nyid ni 'dir gzung bar bya ba bstan pa yin no //
translated: Here, the mere non-perception of the cause, the pervader, etc. is understood to be the teaching of the object to be grasped.

original: ci ste nus pa ma yin zhe na bskal ba la sogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: ci ste nus pa ma yin zhe na bskal ba la sogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: But if it is not possible, then the text says ‚Äúin regard to things that are distant in space, time, and nature,‚Äù etc.

original: yul dang dus dang rang bzhin gyis bskal ba'i don rnams @156b la thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin pa'i mthong ba'i shes pa log pas bskal ba de dag la med par sgrub par byed par nus pa ma yin te /
analyzed: yul dang dus dang rang bzhin gyis bskal ba'i don rnams @156b la thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin pa'i mthong ba'i shes pa log pas bskal ba de dag la med par sgrub par byed par nus pa ma yin te /
translated: In regard to things that are distant in space, time, and nature, it is not possible to prove their non-existence by the reversal of the seeing consciousness of one who is not omniscient.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: thams cad gzigs pa ma yin pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: thams cad gzigs pa ma yin pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: ‚ÄúNot seeing all‚Äù and so on.

original: gang yang dbang po las 'das pa mthong ba ni ma yin te /
analyzed: gang yang dbang po las 'das pa mthong ba ni ma yin te /
translated: Also, it is not that what is beyond the senses is not seen.

original: de'i don yod du zin kyang don 'ga' zhig mi dmigs pas med pa ni ma yin pa de'i phyir mi dmigs pas med pa grub pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i don yod du zin kyang don 'ga' zhig mi dmigs pas med pa ni ma yin pa de'i phyir mi dmigs pas med pa grub pa ni ma yin te /
translated: Even if the object exists, it is not nonexistent because some object is not observed. Therefore, nonexistence is not established by nonobservation.

original: dmigs pa'i rig byar gyur pa nyid kyi mi dmigs pa med par nus pa nges pa yin gyi bskal ba rnams la ni ma yin no //
analyzed: dmigs pa'i rig byar gyur pa nyid kyi mi dmigs pa med par nus pa nges pa yin gyi bskal ba rnams la ni ma yin no //
translated: It is certain that the nonexistence of what is suitable to be observed is due to nonobservation, not due to eons.

original: de ltar gang las ma mthong ba tsam gyis gtan tshigs mi mthun pa'i phyogs las ldog pa grub pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de ltar gang las ma mthong ba tsam gyis gtan tshigs mi mthun pa'i phyogs las ldog pa grub pa ni ma yin te /
translated: Thus, mere nonseeing from some place does not establish the pervasion of the reason, that is, that it does not exist in the discordant class.

original: de'i phyir gnod pa can gyi tshad ma bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir gnod pa can gyi tshad ma bshad par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, the measure that contradicts that should be explained.

original: de yang ci 'dra ba zhig yin zhe na /
analyzed: de yang ci 'dra ba zhig yin zhe na /
translated: What is it like?

original: gnod par byed pa'i mtshan ma yang //
analyzed: gnod par byed pa'i mtshan ma yang //
translated: The sign that contradicts

original: zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: is also like that.

original: don gyis ldog pa rtogs par byed pa yin no zhes bya ba tshig lhag ma'o //
analyzed: don gyis ldog pa rtogs par byed pa yin no zhes bya ba tshig lhag ma'o //
translated: The meaning is that it causes the opposite to be understood. This is the remainder of the sentence.

original: rim dang cig car 'brel ba med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang la rim dang cig car 'brel pas don byed pa med pa de ni 'ga' zhig la yang nus pa yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rim dang cig car 'brel ba med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang la rim dang cig car 'brel pas don byed pa med pa de ni 'ga' zhig la yang nus pa yod pa ma yin te /
translated: ‚ÄúThere is no connection with sequential or simultaneous activity‚Äù and so on. That which is devoid of the capacity for sequential or simultaneous activity is devoid of the capacity for any activity.

original: dper na ri bong gi rva lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na ri bong gi rva lta bu'o //
translated: For example, like the horn of an ass.

original: 'dis ni gnod par byed pas rjes su 'gro ba bstan pa yin no /
analyzed: 'dis ni gnod par byed pas rjes su 'gro ba bstan pa yin no /
translated: This shows the pervasion by the reason.

original: skad cig ma ma yin pa ni rim dang cig car la sogs pa don byed pa la sbyor ba ma yin no //
analyzed: skad cig ma ma yin pa ni rim dang cig car la sogs pa don byed pa la sbyor ba ma yin no //
translated: That which is not momentary is not connected with sequential or simultaneous activity.

original: 'dis ni phyogs kyi chos brjod pa yin te /
analyzed: 'dis ni phyogs kyi chos brjod pa yin te /
translated: This expresses the property of the subject.

original: de'i phyir de ni 'ga' zhig tu nus pa med pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir de ni 'ga' zhig tu nus pa med pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is devoid of the capacity for any activity.

original: gang la nus pa med pa de ni med pa'i bdag nyid yin te /
analyzed: gang la nus pa med pa de ni med pa'i bdag nyid yin te /
translated: That which is devoid of the capacity for activity is devoid of intrinsic reality.

original: de lta na nus pa med pa la med pas khyab pa yin pa de'i phyir skad cig ma ma yin pa rnams ni rim dang cig car la sogs par sbyor ba med do //
analyzed: de lta na nus pa med pa la med pas khyab pa yin pa de'i phyir skad cig ma ma yin pa rnams ni rim dang cig car la sogs par sbyor ba med do //
translated: Thus, the absence of the capacity for activity is pervaded by non-existence. Therefore, that which is not momentary is not connected with sequential or simultaneous activity.

original: med pa sgrub par mi byed kyi yod pa'i mtshan nyid kyi gtan tshigs ni de las ldog pa yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: med pa sgrub par mi byed kyi yod pa'i mtshan nyid kyi gtan tshigs ni de las ldog pa yin pa'i phyir /
translated: The reason for the existence of something is the opposite of that.

original: gnod par byed pa'i tshad ma zhes brjod do //
analyzed: gnod par byed pa'i tshad ma zhes brjod do //
translated: Therefore, it is called a valid cognition that contradicts.

original: des na yod pa'i byas pa la sogs pa 'di ni gang gi tshe gnod par byed pa'i tshad ma brtag pa la yod pa ldog par 'gyur ba de'i tshe de ni mi rtag par rnam par gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: des na yod pa'i byas pa la sogs pa 'di ni gang gi tshe gnod par byed pa'i tshad ma brtag pa la yod pa ldog par 'gyur ba de'i tshe de ni mi rtag par rnam par gnas pa yin no //
translated: Thus, when the existence of a product, etc. is contradicted by a valid cognition that contradicts, then at that time, it is established as impermanent.

original: de'i phyir na gang yod pa'am byas pa de thams cad mi rtag pa yin no zhes rtsa ba tshad mas khyab pa grub pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir na gang yod pa'am byas pa de thams cad mi rtag pa yin no zhes rtsa ba tshad mas khyab pa grub pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is established by valid cognition that whatever exists or is a product is all impermanent.

original: de tsam gyis kyang zhes bya ba la sogs @157a * //
analyzed: de tsam gyis kyang zhes bya ba la sogs @157a * //
translated: The mere presence of that, etc.

original: pa ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs la gnod pa can gyi tshad ma bstan pa nyid bsgrub par bya ba'i chos kyi sgrub par byed pa chos tsam rjes su 'gro ba yin no zhes bya bar grub pa yin no //
analyzed: pa ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs la gnod pa can gyi tshad ma bstan pa nyid bsgrub par bya ba'i chos kyi sgrub par byed pa chos tsam rjes su 'gro ba yin no zhes bya bar grub pa yin no //
translated: The mere presence of the valid cognition that contradicts the discordant side is established as the mere property that is the pervasion of the probandum.

original: 'dis ni de'i rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs kyi mtshan nyid ni gang bsgrub par bya ba'i chos kyi sgrub par byed pa chos tsam ni rjes su 'brel ba yin no //
analyzed: 'dis ni de'i rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs kyi mtshan nyid ni gang bsgrub par bya ba'i chos kyi sgrub par byed pa chos tsam ni rjes su 'brel ba yin no //
translated: This shows that the definition of a reason of nature is: that which is related to the mere property of the probandum is the proof of the probandum.

original: gal te de lta na ma mthong ba tshad ma ma yin na de /
analyzed: gal te de lta na ma mthong ba tshad ma ma yin na de /
translated: If that is so, then if non-perception is not a valid means of knowledge, then

original: 'dir yang ma mthong ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni ji ltar rtsa ba tshad mas ma mthong bas tshad mar gyur pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'dir yang ma mthong ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni ji ltar rtsa ba tshad mas ma mthong bas tshad mar gyur pa ma yin no //
translated: here also, the passage beginning ‚Äúnon-perception‚Äù shows that because the root is not perceived by a valid means of knowledge, it is not a valid means of knowledge.

original: ma mthong ba dang tshad ma ma yin pa de las kyang gang gi phyir rim dang cig car mi rigs pa nyid la nus pa med pas khyab pa mi 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma mthong ba dang tshad ma ma yin pa de las kyang gang gi phyir rim dang cig car mi rigs pa nyid la nus pa med pas khyab pa mi 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because non-perception is not a valid means of knowledge, and because it is not possible for it to be either gradual or instantaneous, the pervasion is not established.

original: de ltar na rim dang cig car la sogs pa med na don byed ma mthong ba'i phyir ma mthong ba'i tshad mas khyab ba bstan pa med do //
analyzed: de ltar na rim dang cig car la sogs pa med na don byed ma mthong ba'i phyir ma mthong ba'i tshad mas khyab ba bstan pa med do //
translated: Thus, if there is no gradual or instantaneous, etc., then because the performance of a function is not perceived, the pervasion of non-perception by a valid means of knowledge is not shown.

original: de yang tshad ma ma yin pa de'i phyir khyab pa grub pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de yang tshad ma ma yin pa de'i phyir khyab pa grub pa ma yin no //
translated: And because that is not a valid means of knowledge, the pervasion is not established.

original: de yang gi gtan tshigs dang // yang khyab pa ma grub pa'i phyir gang gi tshe gnod pa can gyi tshad mas khyab pa ma grub pa de'i tshe rtsa ba la yang tshad mas grub pa'i khyab pa med do //
analyzed: de yang gi gtan tshigs dang // yang khyab pa ma grub pa'i phyir gang gi tshe gnod pa can gyi tshad mas khyab pa ma grub pa de'i tshe rtsa ba la yang tshad mas grub pa'i khyab pa med do //
translated: Moreover, the reason ‚Äúbecause‚Äù is not established, and the pervasion is not established. When the pervasion is not established by a valid cognition that contradicts it, then there is no pervasion established by a valid cognition with respect to the root either.

original: 'di la yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: 'di la yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: Here, he says, ‚ÄúIn this case, too,‚Äù and so on.

original: 'on te 'di la yang gnod pa can gyi tshad ma yin na gnod pa can gyi tshad ma gzhan yang nye bar sbyor ba de'i tshe de la yang gnod pa can gyi tshad ma gzhan gyis nye bar sbyor ba yin no //
analyzed: 'on te 'di la yang gnod pa can gyi tshad ma yin na gnod pa can gyi tshad ma gzhan yang nye bar sbyor ba de'i tshe de la yang gnod pa can gyi tshad ma gzhan gyis nye bar sbyor ba yin no //
translated: If there is a valid cognition that contradicts it in this case, too, and another valid cognition that contradicts it is applied, then in that case, another valid cognition that contradicts it is applied to that.

original: de'i tshe de la yang gnod pa can gyi tshad ma gzhan gsum pa brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i tshe de la yang gnod pa can gyi tshad ma gzhan gsum pa brjod par bya'o //
translated: In that case, another third valid cognition that contradicts it should be stated with respect to that.

original: gsum pa dang bzhi pa la sogs pa thug pa med par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni phyogs snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: gsum pa dang bzhi pa la sogs pa thug pa med par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni phyogs snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The third, fourth, and so on would be endless, as in the previous position.

original: 'dir grub pa'i mtha' smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir grub pa'i mtha' smras pa /
translated: Here, the proponent of the conclusion says:

original: ma yin te //
analyzed: ma yin te //
translated: No, because

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: he says and so on.

original: med pa sgrub par byed pa ma mthong bas na zhes bya ba ni phyogs phyi ma yin te /
analyzed: med pa sgrub par byed pa ma mthong bas na zhes bya ba ni phyogs phyi ma yin te /
translated: ‚ÄúBecause non-existence is not established by non-perception‚Äù is the second position.

original: ma mthong ba thams cad khyod kyang tshad mar mi 'dod pa ni ma yin la /
analyzed: ma mthong ba thams cad khyod kyang tshad mar mi 'dod pa ni ma yin la /
translated: You do not accept that all non-perception is not a valid cognition.

original: med pa sgrub par byed pa'i ma mthong ba ni spangs pa ma yin te //
analyzed: med pa sgrub par byed pa'i ma mthong ba ni spangs pa ma yin te //
translated: And non-perception does not eliminate the establishment of non-existence.

original: de nyid mthong ba yin no //
analyzed: de nyid mthong ba yin no //
translated: That itself is perception.
