original: ma mthong bas ni bsgrub par bya ba log pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gang ma mthong ba ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs la gtan tshigs med par sgrub par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: ma mthong bas ni bsgrub par bya ba log pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gang ma mthong ba ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs la gtan tshigs med par sgrub par byed pa yin te /
translated: ‚ÄúBecause the opposite of the probandum is not perceived,‚Äù etc. means that non-perception establishes the absence of the reason in the discordant side.

original: de ma mthong bas mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang gtan tshigs 'gal ba'i chos su gtogs par nye bar 'jog pa'i phyir gnod par byed pa'i tshad ma nyid kyis bstan pa yin @157b no //
analyzed: de ma mthong bas mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang gtan tshigs 'gal ba'i chos su gtogs par nye bar 'jog pa'i phyir gnod par byed pa'i tshad ma nyid kyis bstan pa yin @157b no //
translated: Because of not perceiving that, it is shown by the very valid cognition that contradicts the inclusion of the discordant side and the reason as having contradictory properties.

original: de'i phyir 'di ni 'de 'dra ba ma mthong ba ma spangs pa yin pa'i phyir zhes bya bar dgongs pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di ni 'de 'dra ba ma mthong ba ma spangs pa yin pa'i phyir zhes bya bar dgongs pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the intended meaning is that this is not eliminated because of not perceiving such.

original: rgyu cis sgrub par byed pa'i gtan tshigs mi mthun pa'i phyogs las ldog par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: rgyu cis sgrub par byed pa'i gtan tshigs mi mthun pa'i phyogs las ldog par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: If you ask, ‚ÄúBy what means is the reason reversed from the discordant side?‚Äù

original: de'i phyir de lta na ni gtan tshigs de bsgrub bya med pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir de lta na ni gtan tshigs de bsgrub bya med pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Therefore, it is said, ‚ÄúIn that case, because the probandum does not exist, etc.‚Äù

original: gang gi tshe gtan tshigs dang bsgrub bya'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs su gyur pa la 'gal ba'i chos su tshad mas grub pa na gtan tshigs yin no //
analyzed: gang gi tshe gtan tshigs dang bsgrub bya'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs su gyur pa la 'gal ba'i chos su tshad mas grub pa na gtan tshigs yin no //
translated: When the contradictory property is established by valid knowledge in the discordant side of the reason, it is a reason.

original: bsgrub par bya ba med na med par 'grub par 'gyur gyi gzhan du ni ma yin no //
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba med na med par 'grub par 'gyur gyi gzhan du ni ma yin no //
translated: If the probandum does not exist, it is established that it does not exist, but not otherwise.

original: gal te mi mthun pa'i phyogs la gtan tshigs yod na yang gnod par byed pa ma grub pa yin na nyes pa ci zhig yod par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: gal te mi mthun pa'i phyogs la gtan tshigs yod na yang gnod par byed pa ma grub pa yin na nyes pa ci zhig yod par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: If the reason exists in the discordant side, but the refutation is not established, what fault is there?

original: rnam pa gzhan du na de la 'di gnod pa can zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te //
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan du na de la 'di gnod pa can zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te //
translated: If it is otherwise, it is said, ‚ÄúIn that case, it is not a refutation, etc.‚Äù

original: gnod pa can gyi chos sam tshad ma las gzhan gyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs la gtan tshigs ma mthong ba de'i tshe the tshom du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gnod pa can gyi chos sam tshad ma las gzhan gyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs la gtan tshigs ma mthong ba de'i tshe the tshom du 'gyur ro //
translated: When one does not see the reason in the discordant side, which is other than the property of the subject or the valid cognition that is harmful, then there is doubt.

original: ci mi mthun pa'i phyogs las gtan tshigs ldog gam 'on te ma yin /
analyzed: ci mi mthun pa'i phyogs las gtan tshigs ldog gam 'on te ma yin /
translated: Does the reason turn away from the discordant side or not?

original: gal te de lta na ma mthong bas kyang ldog pa sgrub par byed pa ma gtogs pa de ji ltar ma mthong ba tsam ni ldog pa ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te de lta na ma mthong bas kyang ldog pa sgrub par byed pa ma gtogs pa de ji ltar ma mthong ba tsam ni ldog pa ma yin no zhe na /
translated: If so, then it is established that the reason turns away from the discordant side by not being seen. How is it that mere non-seeing is not turning away?

original: dngos po thams cad mi dmigs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: dngos po thams cad mi dmigs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says, The non-observation of all things... and so on.

original: gal te ma mthong bas med pa sgrub par byed pa ni yod par 'gyur ba de 'dir spangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gal te ma mthong bas med pa sgrub par byed pa ni yod par 'gyur ba de 'dir spangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If non-seeing establishes non-existence, then that is rejected here.

original: dngos po mi dmigs pa thams cad ni dngos po la gnod pa can ma yin te /
analyzed: dngos po mi dmigs pa thams cad ni dngos po la gnod pa can ma yin te /
translated: Not all non-observations of things are harmful to things.

original: de'i phyir bshad pa de nyid sgra'i don yin pa'am sgra yin pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir bshad pa de nyid sgra'i don yin pa'am sgra yin pa'o //
translated: Therefore, that explanation is either the meaning of the term or the term itself.

original: dngos po thams cad mi dmigs par gnod pa can ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: dngos po thams cad mi dmigs par gnod pa can ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it is not a fault not to apprehend all things.

original: thug pa med par thal bar 'gyur ba spang ba'i don gyi phyir ro //
analyzed: thug pa med par thal bar 'gyur ba spang ba'i don gyi phyir ro //
translated: The point is to avoid the absurd consequence of an infinite regress.üîΩIn response to that, he says, ‚ÄúIt is not possible through a sequence or

original: de la rim dang cig car dang ldan pas nus pa la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de la rim dang cig car dang ldan pas nus pa la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: simultaneously, etc.‚Äù

original: 'di dang 'di rnams la sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'di dang 'di rnams la sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: This should be applied to all of these.üîΩThe root proof is the non-apprehension of the pervader, which is explained

original: rtsa ba'i tshad ma ni khyab par byed pas mi dmigs pa na gnon pa can gyi tshad ma bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: rtsa ba'i tshad ma ni khyab par byed pas mi dmigs pa na gnon pa can gyi tshad ma bshad pa yin no //
translated: as the proof of the absence of a pervader.üîΩIf the relation of the pervaded and the pervader were established, then that

original: gal te khyab par bya ba dang khyab par byed pa'i dngos po grub na de yang de ltar 'grub par 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: gal te khyab par bya ba dang khyab par byed pa'i dngos po grub na de yang de ltar 'grub par 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: would be established.

original: de'i phyir de nyid khyab par bya ba dang khyab par byed pa 'dis rab tu bstan pa yin no //üîΩrim dang cig car gyis nus pa la khyab pa yin te nus par gyur pa yin na rim gyis sam cig @158a * //
analyzed: de'i phyir de nyid khyab par bya ba dang khyab par byed pa 'dis rab tu bstan pa yin no // rim dang cig car gyis nus pa la khyab pa yin te nus par gyur pa yin na rim gyis sam cig @158a * //
translated: Therefore, that is precisely what is demonstrated by the pervasion.üîΩIt is pervaded by the possibility of a sequence or simultaneity. If something

original: car las rnam pa gzhan pa ni med do //
analyzed: car las rnam pa gzhan pa ni med do //
translated: is possible, then it must be either sequential or simultaneous. There is no otherüîΩalternative.

original: rnam pa gzhan ci'i phyir med ce na /
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan ci'i phyir med ce na /
translated: Why is there no other mode?

original: rnam pa gzhan ni mi srid do zhes bya pa smos so //
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan ni mi srid do zhes bya pa smos so //
translated: He says, ‚ÄúBecause another mode is impossible.‚Äù

original: rim dang cig car las ma gtogs pa'i rnam pa gzhan ni mi srid pa de'i phyir rnam pa ma lus pa la rim dang cig car gyis khyab pa yin no ;
analyzed: rim dang cig car las ma gtogs pa'i rnam pa gzhan ni mi srid pa de'i phyir rnam pa ma lus pa la rim dang cig car gyis khyab pa yin no ;
translated: Because another mode, apart from gradual and instantaneous, is impossible, therefore all modes are pervaded by gradual and instantaneous.

original: / de lta na gang rim gyis ma yin na ni de thams cad rim pa med pa yin no //
analyzed: / de lta na gang rim gyis ma yin na ni de thams cad rim pa med pa yin no //
translated: Thus, if something is not gradual, then it is all not gradual.

original: gang yang rim pa med pa ma yin pa ste de thams cad ni rim gyis yin no //
analyzed: gang yang rim pa med pa ma yin pa ste de thams cad ni rim gyis yin no //
translated: And if something is not not gradual, then it is all gradual.

original: de lta na yang phung po gsum pa srid par ga la 'gyur /
analyzed: de lta na yang phung po gsum pa srid par ga la 'gyur /
translated: In that case, how could a third possibility exist?

original: gang gi tshe phung po gsum pa mi srid pa de'i tshe rim dang cig car gyis nus pa la khyab par grub pa yin no //
analyzed: gang gi tshe phung po gsum pa mi srid pa de'i tshe rim dang cig car gyis nus pa la khyab par grub pa yin no //
translated: When a third possibility is impossible, then the pervasion by gradual and instantaneous is established.

original: des na khyab par byed pa'i chos //
analyzed: des na khyab par byed pa'i chos //
translated: Therefore, the pervasion of the pervader

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gang gi phyir rim dang rim pa ma yin pas nus pa la khyab pa de'i phyir rim dang rim pa ma yin pa'i sbyor ba log na skad cig ma ma yin pa la nus pa yang ldog par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gang gi phyir rim dang rim pa ma yin pas nus pa la khyab pa de'i phyir rim dang rim pa ma yin pa'i sbyor ba log na skad cig ma ma yin pa la nus pa yang ldog par 'gyur ro //
translated: ‚ÄúBecause‚Äù and so on is the reason: because the capacity is pervaded by sequential and nonsequential, therefore, when the application of sequential and nonsequential is refuted, the capacity of the nonmomentary is also refuted.

original: gang gi tshe nus pa la rim dang cig car gyis khyab par 'gyur ba de'i tshe nus pa med pas /
analyzed: gang gi tshe nus pa la rim dang cig car gyis khyab par 'gyur ba de'i tshe nus pa med pas /
translated: When the capacity is pervaded by sequential and simultaneous, then, since there is no capacity,

original: rim dang cig car zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gang kho na nus pa de rim dang cig car gyis khyab pa grub par gyur pa de nyid de las bzlog pa rim dang cig car mi rigs pa yang nus pa med pas khyab pa 'grub par 'gyur
analyzed: rim dang cig car zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gang kho na nus pa de rim dang cig car gyis khyab pa grub par gyur pa de nyid de las bzlog pa rim dang cig car mi rigs pa yang nus pa med pas khyab pa 'grub par 'gyur
translated: ‚Äúsequential and simultaneous‚Äù and so on is the reason: because the capacity is established as pervaded by sequential and simultaneous, therefore, the establishment of the pervasion that the absence of capacity is pervaded by the impossibility of sequential and simultaneous is established.

original: ba'i phyir de yang re 'ga' zhig kyang thug pa med par thal bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ba'i phyir de yang re 'ga' zhig kyang thug pa med par thal bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, it follows that there is no infinite regress.

original: de ltar na rtsa ba'i tshad ma ni khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pas gnod par byed pa'i tshad ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na rtsa ba'i tshad ma ni khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pas gnod par byed pa'i tshad ma yin no //
translated: Thus the primary valid cognition is the valid cognition that refutes by means of the nonobservation of the pervader.

original: gnod par byed pa'i tshad ma la yang rnam pa gzhan med pa yin la gnod par byed pa tshad ma rnam pa gzhan med pas na rim dang rim pa ma yin pas phan tshun spangs te /üîΩgnas pa'i mtshan nyid yin par khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: gnod par byed pa'i tshad ma la yang rnam pa gzhan med pa yin la gnod par byed pa tshad ma rnam pa gzhan med pas na rim dang rim pa ma yin pas phan tshun spangs te / gnas pa'i mtshan nyid yin par khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: Since there is no other mode of the valid cognition that is the object of refutation, it should be understood that they are mutually exclusive and exhaustive.

original: gang gi phyir rim pa las tha dad pa'i don gang ji snyed pa de thams cad rim pa yin par rnam par gzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir rim pa las tha dad pa'i don gang ji snyed pa de thams cad rim pa yin par rnam par gzhag par bya'o //
translated: Because all objects that are different from sequential are posited as sequential.

original: rim pa ma yin pa las tha dad pa gang ji snyed pa de thams cad rim gyis zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: rim pa ma yin pa las tha dad pa gang ji snyed pa de thams cad rim gyis zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: All that is different from nonsequential is taught as sequential.

original: de'i phyir rnam pa gzhan gyi dngos po grub pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir rnam pa gzhan gyi dngos po grub pa yin no //
translated: Therefore the existence of another mode is established.

original: dngos po'i rnam pa gzhan med pas rim dang cig car gyis nus pa la khyab pa grub pa yin no //
analyzed: dngos po'i rnam pa gzhan med pas rim dang cig car gyis nus pa la khyab pa grub pa yin no //
translated: Since there is no other mode of an entity, the pervasion of potency by sequential and nonsequential is established.

original: nus pa'i mtshan nyid ni yod pa ma yin la /
analyzed: nus pa'i mtshan nyid ni yod pa ma yin la /
translated: The definition of potency does not exist.

original: skad cig ma ma yin pa rnams kyang rim pa dang cig car las @158b ldog pa yin na nus pa las kyang ldog pa yin no //
analyzed: skad cig ma ma yin pa rnams kyang rim pa dang cig car las @158b ldog pa yin na nus pa las kyang ldog pa yin no //
translated: If they are not momentary, they are also excluded from sequential and simultaneous activity, and therefore they are also excluded from potentiality.

original: nus pa'i mtshan nyid yod pa ni skad cig ma ma yin par gyur pa de'i tshe thug pa med par 'gyur te ma mthong ba tsam gyis ldog par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nus pa'i mtshan nyid yod pa ni skad cig ma ma yin par gyur pa de'i tshe thug pa med par 'gyur te ma mthong ba tsam gyis ldog par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If the characteristic of potentiality exists, and it is not momentary, then there would be an infinite regress, because it would not be excluded by mere non-apprehension.

original: de lta na rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs kyi sbyor ba bdag ni sgrub pa'i yan lag tu sgrub pas pa yin te zhes bya ba ni ji skad du /
analyzed: de lta na rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs kyi sbyor ba bdag ni sgrub pa'i yan lag tu sgrub pas pa yin te zhes bya ba ni ji skad du /
translated: Thus, the application of the reason of essence is established as a part of the proof, as in Sound is impermanent, because it is produced.

original: nye bar brjod pa de ni rigs pas gnod pa can gyi tshad ma bstan pas rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs kyis sgrub pa'i yan lag tu bsgrubs pa yin no //
analyzed: nye bar brjod pa de ni rigs pas gnod pa can gyi tshad ma bstan pas rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs kyis sgrub pa'i yan lag tu bsgrubs pa yin no //
translated: That statement is established as a part of the proof by the reason of essence, because it shows the valid cognition that contradicts the reasoning.

original: nus pa med pa de ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gang gi tshe yang bshad zin pa'i rigs pas sgrub pa'i yan lag tu sgrub par byed par mi 'gyur ba de'i tshe tshar gcad pa'i gnas su brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: nus pa med pa de ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gang gi tshe yang bshad zin pa'i rigs pas sgrub pa'i yan lag tu sgrub par byed par mi 'gyur ba de'i tshe tshar gcad pa'i gnas su brjod par bya'o //
translated: ‚ÄúWhen it is not a means of proof‚Äù and so on. When it is not a means of proof, it is not a part of the proof. At that time, it should be called a ground for defeat.

original: rgyu ci yin zhe na /
analyzed: rgyu ci yin zhe na /
translated: What is the reason?

original: 'dod pa'i don rab tu ma bsgrubs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i don rab tu ma bsgrubs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: It is said, ‚Äúbecause the desired object is not established.‚Äù

original: gang gi phyir 'dod pa'i don ma bsgrubs pa de'i phyir pham pa'i gnas yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'dod pa'i don ma bsgrubs pa de'i phyir pham pa'i gnas yin no //
translated: Because the desired object is not established, it is a ground for defeat.

original: 'dod pa'i don zhes bya ba ni dam bca' ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i don zhes bya ba ni dam bca' ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: ‚ÄúDesired object‚Äù means the thesis.

original: 'on te dngos po'i nus pa'i gtan tshigs su bshad pa de ces pham par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te dngos po'i nus pa'i gtan tshigs su bshad pa de ces pham par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: But if the reason is stated as the capacity of a thing, how can there be defeat?

original: dngos po'i nus pa'i gtan tshigs zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te //
analyzed: dngos po'i nus pa'i gtan tshigs zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te //
translated: It is said, ‚Äúwhen the reason is the capacity of a thing,‚Äù and so on.

original: gal te don dam par nus pa'i gtan tshigs su bshad pa de lta na yang ji snyed pa'i nus pas gsal bar mi byed pa de snyed du bsgrub par nus pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gal te don dam par nus pa'i gtan tshigs su bshad pa de lta na yang ji snyed pa'i nus pas gsal bar mi byed pa de snyed du bsgrub par nus pa ma yin no //
translated: If it is explained as a reason of capability in the ultimate, then to that extent it is not capable of establishing what is not manifest by the power of capability.

original: 'di yang byed pa bzhin du yod pa tsam gyis 'bras bu byed pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di yang byed pa bzhin du yod pa tsam gyis 'bras bu byed pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Moreover, it is not that an effect is produced by mere existence, like an agent.

original: shes par byed pa'i gtan tshigs su gyur na shes pa'i bdag nyid ltos nas rang gi 'bras bu byed pa yin te gzhan du ni ma yin no //
analyzed: shes par byed pa'i gtan tshigs su gyur na shes pa'i bdag nyid ltos nas rang gi 'bras bu byed pa yin te gzhan du ni ma yin no //
translated: When it becomes a reason of cognition, it produces its own effect in dependence on the nature of cognition, not otherwise.

original: de ltar re zhig rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs sgrub pa'i yan lag tu nus pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar re zhig rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs sgrub pa'i yan lag tu nus pa yin no //
translated: Thus, up to this point, capability is a part of the proof by the reason of nature.

original: 'on te 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs ji lta bu yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs ji lta bu yin zhe na /
translated: But how is it a reason of effect?

original: 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs su zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs su zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says The reason of effect is a part of the probandum, and so on.

original: 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs su bshad pa bsgrub par byed pa'i yan lag mtshungs par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs su bshad pa bsgrub par byed pa'i yan lag mtshungs par byed pa yin te /
translated: The reason of effect, which is explained as a part of the probandum, is made similar.

original: de ji ltar byed pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: de ji ltar byed pa yin zhe na /
translated: How is it made?

original: gang 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs su zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gang 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs su zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: ‚ÄúIf you say that the effect is the logical proof of the cause, etc.‚Äù

original: gang gi phyir 'bras bus rgyu sgrub par byed pa'i don khas blangs pa yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'bras bus rgyu sgrub par byed pa'i don khas blangs pa yin no //
translated: Because you accept that the effect proves the cause.

original: des na rgyus 'bras bu'i dngos po sgrub par byed pa nus pa ma yin @159a * //
analyzed: des na rgyus 'bras bu'i dngos po sgrub par byed pa nus pa ma yin @159a * //
translated: Therefore, the cause is not able to prove the existence of the effect.

original: no ; /'on te /
analyzed: no ; /'on te /
translated: But if you say,

original: ji ltar de dag de ltar grub pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar de dag de ltar grub pa yin zhe na /
translated: ‚ÄúHow are they established in that way?‚Äù

original: dper na 'di yod na yod pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: dper na 'di yod na yod pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: ‚ÄúFor example, when this exists, that comes to be,‚Äù etc.

original: rgyu 'di las 'bras bu 'di skyed pa yin no zhes mngon sum gyis rtogs pa yin no //
analyzed: rgyu 'di las 'bras bu 'di skyed pa yin no zhes mngon sum gyis rtogs pa yin no //
translated: One understands by direct perception that this effect is produced from this cause.

original: de ltar na mngon sum gyis me nye bar dmigs par 'gyur ba las de ma thag tu sngar ma mthong ba'i du ba mngon sum kho nas rab tu rtogs pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na mngon sum gyis me nye bar dmigs par 'gyur ba las de ma thag tu sngar ma mthong ba'i du ba mngon sum kho nas rab tu rtogs pa yin no //
translated: Thus, by direct perception, one understands that fire is perceived nearby, and immediately after that, one understands by direct perception alone the previously unseen smoke.

original: mes bskyed par bya ba'i du ba 'di yin no zhes mngon sum gyis stobs kyis nges par skyed par byed pa de'i phyir yod na yod par mngon sum gyis rtogs pa yin no //
analyzed: mes bskyed par bya ba'i du ba 'di yin no zhes mngon sum gyis stobs kyis nges par skyed par byed pa de'i phyir yod na yod par mngon sum gyis rtogs pa yin no //
translated: The power of direct perception determines that this smoke is produced by fire, and therefore, when it exists, direct perception understands its existence.

original: gang yang de las gzhan pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gang la yang de mngon par 'dod pa'i rgyu med pa de la yod par gyur du zin kyang gzhan pa'i rgyu rnams las 'di'i 'bras bu skye bar mi 'gyur ba'i phyir mi dmigs par khong duüîΩchud par bya'o //
analyzed: gang yang de las gzhan pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gang la yang de mngon par 'dod pa'i rgyu med pa de la yod par gyur du zin kyang gzhan pa'i rgyu rnams las 'di'i 'bras bu skye bar mi 'gyur ba'i phyir mi dmigs par khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: As for the statement when it is not observed in any other way, if there is no other cause that is desired, then even if it were to exist, because its effect would not arise from other causes, it should be understood as unobserved.

original: de lta na de las rgyu ni dmigs pa'i rig byar gyur pa las mi dmigs pas 'bras bu la yang de lta ba'i rnam pa mi dmigs pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta na de las rgyu ni dmigs pa'i rig byar gyur pa las mi dmigs pas 'bras bu la yang de lta ba'i rnam pa mi dmigs pa yin no //
translated: In that case, the cause is observed as a perceptible object, and because it is not observed, the effect is also like that, in the aspect of non-observation.

original: de'i phyir rgyu med na 'bras bu med na ba ni mi dmigs par khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir rgyu med na 'bras bu med na ba ni mi dmigs par khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, when the cause does not exist, the effect does not exist, and it should be understood as unobserved.

original: de yang thabs gang gis yin zhe na /
analyzed: de yang thabs gang gis yin zhe na /
translated: By what means is that?

original: yod pa dad med pa sgrub par byed pa'i tshad ma dag gis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: yod pa dad med pa sgrub par byed pa'i tshad ma dag gis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: ‚ÄúBy valid cognitions that establish existence and nonexistence‚Äù and so on.

original: 'dir yod pa sgrub par byed pa'i tshad ma ni mngon sum yin no //
analyzed: 'dir yod pa sgrub par byed pa'i tshad ma ni mngon sum yin no //
translated: Here, a valid cognition that establishes existence is direct perception.

original: med pa sgrub par byed pa'i tshad ma ni mi dmigs pa yin no //
analyzed: med pa sgrub par byed pa'i tshad ma ni mi dmigs pa yin no //
translated: A valid cognition that establishes nonexistence is non-apprehension.

original: des na mngon sum dang mi dmigs pa dag gis zhes bya ba smos pa yin no //
analyzed: des na mngon sum dang mi dmigs pa dag gis zhes bya ba smos pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, it says ‚Äúby direct perception and non-apprehension.‚Äù

original: ci rgyu yang mngon sum gyis 'dir byed pa yin na ci mi dmigs pa nyid 'ba' zhig gis de grub par 'gyur ram zhe na /
analyzed: ci rgyu yang mngon sum gyis 'dir byed pa yin na ci mi dmigs pa nyid 'ba' zhig gis de grub par 'gyur ram zhe na /
translated: If a cause is also established by direct perception here, is it established by non-apprehension alone?

original: de lta na 'bras bu nyid the tshom med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de lta na 'bras bu nyid the tshom med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: In that case, it says ‚Äúthe effect itself is ascertained without doubt‚Äù and so on.

original: gal te mngon sum gyis kyang yod pa dang med pa shes pa yin no //
analyzed: gal te mngon sum gyis kyang yod pa dang med pa shes pa yin no //
translated: If existence and nonexistence are known by direct perception,

original: mi dmigs pa 'ba' zhig yod pa dang med pa rtogs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: mi dmigs pa 'ba' zhig yod pa dang med pa rtogs pa ma yin no //
translated: non-apprehension alone does not ascertain existence and nonexistence.

original: de'i tshe 'bras bu nyid du the tshom med par bsgrub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe 'bras bu nyid du the tshom med par bsgrub par 'gyur ro //
translated: At that time, the effect itself is ascertained without doubt.

original: gal te yang de ltar ma brjod na yang nyes pa ci zhig yod ce na /
analyzed: gal te yang de ltar ma brjod na yang nyes pa ci zhig yod ce na /
translated: But if one does not say that, what is the fault?

original: rnam pa gzhan du na de med na med do zhes bya ba 'ba' zhig ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan du na de med na med do zhes bya ba 'ba' zhig ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: In response, he says, ‚ÄúOtherwise, if one says only ‚Äòit does not exist when that does not exist,‚Äô etc.‚Äù

original: gal te na de yod na yod par 'gyur ro zhes de 'ba' zhig ma brjod pa de'i tshe med na @159b med par 'gyur ro zhes brjod pa de srid du de'i rgyu the tshom med par bsgrub par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te na de yod na yod par 'gyur ro zhes de 'ba' zhig ma brjod pa de'i tshe med na @159b med par 'gyur ro zhes brjod pa de srid du de'i rgyu the tshom med par bsgrub par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If one says only ‚Äúwhen that exists, it exists,‚Äù then at that time, when one says ‚Äúit does not exist when that does not exist,‚Äù one cannot establish the cause of that without doubt.

original: de lta na de ji ltar de la mngon par 'dod pa'i rgyu med pa dang gzhan las kyang 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta na de ji ltar de la mngon par 'dod pa'i rgyu med pa dang gzhan las kyang 'gyur te /
translated: In that case, how could it be that the effect does not have a cause as it is desired, and how could it arise from another?

original: de la don med pa de ni ci mngon par 'dod pa'i rgyu med pa las mi 'byung ba'i yang na gzhan med pa las yin /
analyzed: de la don med pa de ni ci mngon par 'dod pa'i rgyu med pa las mi 'byung ba'i yang na gzhan med pa las yin /
translated: In that case, what is the point of saying that it does not arise from a cause as it is desired, or that it does not arise from another?

original: de nyid gzhan gyis don rtogs par dogs pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de nyid gzhan gyis don rtogs par dogs pa yin no zhe na /
translated: If one thinks that it is just the other that is the cause of the effect, then the other is not able to produce it.

original: de la gzhan gyis nus pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de la gzhan gyis nus pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: In response to that, he says, ‚ÄúWhat is the other‚Äôs ability to produce it?‚Äù

original: ci zhig gzhan gyis de la nus pa'i don skyod pa med /
analyzed: ci zhig gzhan gyis de la nus pa'i don skyod pa med /
translated: What is the other‚Äôs ability to produce it?

original: de na de'i 'bras bu mi skye ba'am //
analyzed: de na de'i 'bras bu mi skye ba'am //
translated: There, its effect will not arise.

original: yang na mngon par 'dod pa'i rgyu med pa de'i phyir skye ba yin /
analyzed: yang na mngon par 'dod pa'i rgyu med pa de'i phyir skye ba yin /
translated: Or else, it arises due to the absence of a cause that is desired,üîΩbut not desired.

original: 'on te gang mngon par 'dod pa'i rgyu med na mi 'byung ba de'i tshe ci gzhan gyis yul la dogs par byed pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te gang mngon par 'dod pa'i rgyu med na mi 'byung ba de'i tshe ci gzhan gyis yul la dogs par byed pa yin no zhe na /
translated: If it does not occur when the cause that is desired does not exist, then what is the use of suspecting another object?üîΩEven when they cease, their cessation would be capricious.

original: de dag ldog na yang ldog pa 'dod rgyal bar 'gyur te zhes bya ba ni gang yang mngon par 'dod pa'i rgyu ldog pa na la lar ldog pa de'i 'bras bur 'gyur te /
analyzed: de dag ldog na yang ldog pa 'dod rgyal bar 'gyur te zhes bya ba ni gang yang mngon par 'dod pa'i rgyu ldog pa na la lar ldog pa de'i 'bras bur 'gyur te /
translated: Even when the cause that is desired ceases, sometimes the effect would not cease.

original: de lta na yang de 'dod rgyal bar btags ba yin no //
analyzed: de lta na yang de 'dod rgyal bar btags ba yin no //
translated: In that case, it would be designated as capricious.

original: ci 'dod rgyal ba ji ltar yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci 'dod rgyal ba ji ltar yin zhe na /
translated: How is it capricious?üîΩThe example of taking a mother as a bride, etc.

original: ma bag mar len pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te ma bag mar len pa ni aa ma bag mar len pa'o //
analyzed: ma bag mar len pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te ma bag mar len pa ni aa ma bag mar len pa'o //
translated: Taking a mother as a bride is taking a mother as a wife.

original: de skye ba'i yul gang du ma bag mar blangs pas skye ba'o //
analyzed: de skye ba'i yul gang du ma bag mar blangs pas skye ba'o //
translated: The place where one is born is the place where one‚Äôs mother was a bride.

original: ma bag mar blangs pas skye ba yin no zhes rnam par sbyar ro //
analyzed: ma bag mar blangs pas skye ba yin no zhes rnam par sbyar ro //
translated: One is born because one‚Äôs mother was a bride.

original: de ru skyes pa de ni bag mar len par 'dod pa'i yul skyes pa na shing 'bra go bsal ba'i phyir 'bras bu 'bra gor brjod do //
analyzed: de ru skyes pa de ni bag mar len par 'dod pa'i yul skyes pa na shing 'bra go bsal ba'i phyir 'bras bu 'bra gor brjod do //
translated: The fruit of the sugar-cane is called ‚Äúsugar-cane‚Äù because it is the cause of the birth of the sugar-cane.

original: skye ba zhes bya ba ni rab tu grags pa'o //
analyzed: skye ba zhes bya ba ni rab tu grags pa'o //
translated: Birth is well known.

original: sog po par sig gi yul du ma bag mar len pa rab tu grub pa der yang 'bra go skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sog po par sig gi yul du ma bag mar len pa rab tu grub pa der yang 'bra go skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The sugar-cane is born in the country of the VƒÅr·π£ikas, where the marriage of girls is well known.

original: yul gzhan rnams sum bag mar len pa med na de la 'bras bu 'bra go yang med do //
analyzed: yul gzhan rnams sum bag mar len pa med na de la 'bras bu 'bra go yang med do //
translated: In other countries, where the marriage of girls is not known, the sugar-cane is not known.

original: de la dper na yul gzhan du ma bag ma len pa med na 'bras bu 'bra go skye ba med pa de ni 'dod rgyal ba yin no //
analyzed: de la dper na yul gzhan du ma bag ma len pa med na 'bras bu 'bra go skye ba med pa de ni 'dod rgyal ba yin no //
translated: The non-birth of the sugar-cane in other countries, where the marriage of girls is not known, is accidental.üîΩIn the same way, the non-existence of the effect is accidental when the cause is not known.

original: de bzhin du la lar mngon par 'dod pa'i rgyu med na 'bras bu med pa ni 'dod rgyal pa yin te srid par gyur pa de'i phyir de med kyang yod pa ni tshig tsam 'ba' zhig yin pas nus pa la the tshom za bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du la lar mngon par 'dod pa'i rgyu med na 'bras bu med pa ni 'dod rgyal pa yin te srid par gyur pa de'i phyir de med kyang yod pa ni tshig tsam 'ba' zhig yin pas nus pa la the tshom za bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Since existence is possible without the cause, the assertion that something exists when its cause is absent is mere words, and so is not convincing.

original: de'i phyir gang kho na yod na yod pa sgrub par byed pa'i tshad mas rgyu dang 'bras bu yod par nus pa de ltar gyur pa ci'i yon tan yin zhe na /
analyzed: de'i phyir gang kho na yod na yod pa sgrub par byed pa'i tshad mas rgyu dang 'bras bu yod par nus pa de ltar gyur pa ci'i yon tan yin zhe na /
translated: Therefore, if something exists when something else exists, and if the valid cognition that establishes the existence of that other thing is capable of establishing the existence of the effect, then what is the good of that other thing?

original: de ltar na nus pa de'i 'bras bu grub bo zhes bya ba la sogs pa @160a * //
analyzed: de ltar na nus pa de'i 'bras bu grub bo zhes bya ba la sogs pa @160a * //
translated: In response to this, it is said, ‚ÄúThe effect of that capability is established, etc.‚Äù

original: smos te / sngar bshad pa'i rnam par sgrub par gyur ba gang yin pa de ni de'i 'bras bu nyid du grub par gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: smos te / sngar bshad pa'i rnam par sgrub par gyur ba gang yin pa de ni de'i 'bras bu nyid du grub par gyur pa yin no //
translated: Whatever is established as the effect of that which was previously explained is the effect of that.

original: grub par gyur pa ni yon tan ci yin zhe na /
analyzed: grub par gyur pa ni yon tan ci yin zhe na /
translated: What is the good of that which is established?

original: grub pa yang rang yod na yod pa grub pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: grub pa yang rang yod na yod pa grub pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: In response to this, it is said, ‚ÄúThat which is established is established as existing when it exists, etc.‚Äù

original: gang gi tshe de'i 'bras bu grub par gyur pa yin pa de'i tshe de'i 'bras bur gyur na /
analyzed: gang gi tshe de'i 'bras bu grub par gyur pa yin pa de'i tshe de'i 'bras bur gyur na /
translated: When the effect of that is established, then it becomes the effect of that.

original: gang la yod par 'gyur ba de la 'bras bu yang yod par bstan pa rgyu ci yin zhe na /
analyzed: gang la yod par 'gyur ba de la 'bras bu yang yod par bstan pa rgyu ci yin zhe na /
translated: What is the good of that in which the effect exists?

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu 'khrul ba med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu 'khrul ba med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: In response to this, it is said, ‚ÄúBecause there is no error regarding cause and effect, etc.‚Äù

original: gang gi phyir 'bras bu ni rgyu med na mi 'byung ba de'i phyir rang rig pas yod par gyur pas de yod par sgrub par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'bras bu ni rgyu med na mi 'byung ba de'i phyir rang rig pas yod par gyur pas de yod par sgrub par byed pa yin no //
translated: Because an effect does not occur without a cause, therefore, since it exists through reflexive awareness, it establishes its existence.

original: gang de ltar la lar 'bras bu rgyu la mi 'khrul bar grub pa de ni ma 'khrul ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa de lta na yang cung zad 'bras bu dang rgyu 'khrul ba med par gyur pa de srid du 'bras bu thams cad rang gi rgyu
analyzed: gang de ltar la lar 'bras bu rgyu la mi 'khrul bar grub pa de ni ma 'khrul ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa de lta na yang cung zad 'bras bu dang rgyu 'khrul ba med par gyur pa de srid du 'bras bu thams cad rang gi rgyu
translated: Even though it is established that in some cases an effect is not mistaken in regard to its cause, and that which is not mistaken is called ‚Äúnondeceptive,‚Äù and so on, to the extent that there is no error of effect and cause, to that extent all effects are not mistaken in regard to their causes.

original: la 'khrul ba med pa de nyid ni rigs pas gnod pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: la 'khrul ba med pa de nyid ni rigs pas gnod pa yin no zhe na /
translated: That is precisely the rational refutation.

original: de la rigs pa ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de la rigs pa ni 'di yin te /
translated: The reason is as follows.

original: gang gi phyir 'bras bu thams cad rang gi rgyu las gzhan du gyur pas nus pa yin na /
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'bras bu thams cad rang gi rgyu las gzhan du gyur pas nus pa yin na /
translated: If all effects are capable of being different from their causes,

original: de lta na 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs sgrub par byed pa'i yan lag tu byed pa yin te /
analyzed: de lta na 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs sgrub par byed pa'i yan lag tu byed pa yin te /
translated: then it would be a reason that proves an effect.

original: de ltar mi nus na 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs kyang sgrub par byed pa'i yan lag tu brjod pa ma yin no zhes 'di ni rtogs par sla ba yin no //
analyzed: de ltar mi nus na 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs kyang sgrub par byed pa'i yan lag tu brjod pa ma yin no zhes 'di ni rtogs par sla ba yin no //
translated: If it cannot be done in this way, then the inference based on the effect is not a part of the proof. This is easy to understand.

original: rgol ba de dag pham pa'i gnas yin no zhes de dag rtogs pa'i don yin no //
analyzed: rgol ba de dag pham pa'i gnas yin no zhes de dag rtogs pa'i don yin no //
translated: The point of this is to show that the opponent is defeated.

original: gal te yang de ltar nus pas mi byed na nyes pa ci yod ce na /
analyzed: gal te yang de ltar nus pas mi byed na nyes pa ci yod ce na /
translated: If one is able to do it in this way, but does not do it, what is the fault?

original: mi nus pa de'i tshe 'bras bur ma grub pas zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: mi nus pa de'i tshe 'bras bur ma grub pas zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: If one is not able to do it, then the effect is not established.

original: ji snyed pa bshad zin pa'i rnam pas mi nus na de snyed pa de'i 'bras bur mi 'grub po //
analyzed: ji snyed pa bshad zin pa'i rnam pas mi nus na de snyed pa de'i 'bras bur mi 'grub po //
translated: If one is not able to do it in the way that has been explained, then the effect is not established.

original: gal te na de ltar yin na de la nyes pa ci yod ce na /
analyzed: gal te na de ltar yin na de la nyes pa ci yod ce na /
translated: If that is so, what is the fault?

original: don gzhan zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: don gzhan zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: He says, ‚ÄúThe other meaning . . . ‚Äù

original: gang yang gang la 'brel ba'i rang bzhin du ma gyur pa de ni nye bar gyur kyang gdon mi za bar gzhan nye bar gyur pa bstan pa ma yin no//
analyzed: gang yang gang la 'brel ba'i rang bzhin du ma gyur pa de ni nye bar gyur kyang gdon mi za bar gzhan nye bar gyur pa bstan pa ma yin no//
translated: If something is not of the nature of a relation, then even if it is present, it does not necessarily indicate the presence of the other.

original: de lta na yang pham par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: de lta na yang pham par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: Even so, there is defeat.

original: 'dod pa'i don ma grub pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i don ma grub pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The opponent who has not yet established the desired meaning, etc.üîΩIf the opponent has not yet established the desired meaning, then it is reasonable that he is refuted.

original: gal te 'dod pa'i don ma grub pa'i rgol ba ni de'i tshe tshar gcad pa'i gnas su rigs pa yin no //
analyzed: gal te 'dod pa'i don ma grub pa'i rgol ba ni de'i tshe tshar gcad pa'i gnas su rigs pa yin no //
translated: If the opponent has not yet established the desired meaning, then it is reasonable that he is refuted.

original: 'dis ni 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i don gyi 'bras bu nyid las de ltar 'da' bar mi 'gyur na de ji @160b ltar pham pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'dis ni 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i don gyi 'bras bu nyid las de ltar 'da' bar mi 'gyur na de ji @160b ltar pham pa yin zhe na /
translated: This shows that if the future object is not yet established, then it is not yet refuted. How then is he defeated?

original: 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs kyi dngos por khas blangs pas de ma bstan zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs kyi dngos por khas blangs pas de ma bstan zhes bya ba ni /
translated: If the opponent accepts the reason as an effect, then it is not shown that way.

original: gal te yang 'bras bu'i dngos po las ma 'das par de lta na yang yod pa tsam gyis go bar byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gal te yang 'bras bu'i dngos po las ma 'das par de lta na yang yod pa tsam gyis go bar byed pa ma yin te /
translated: Even if the opponent has not yet established the desired meaning, it is not understood merely by its existence.

original: 'on kyang 'bras bu nyid du shes par gyur pas yod pa go bar byed par 'gyur gyi gzhan ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang 'bras bu nyid du shes par gyur pas yod pa go bar byed par 'gyur gyi gzhan ni ma yin no //
translated: But if it is understood as an effect, then its existence is understood, not otherwise.

original: de ltar 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs sgrub par byed pa'i yan lag tu sgrub par byed pa nus par blta'o //
analyzed: de ltar 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs sgrub par byed pa'i yan lag tu sgrub par byed pa nus par blta'o //
translated: Thus, the reason as an effect should be seen as capable of establishing the thesis as a part of the proof.

original: gzhan yang rtags gsum po de bsgrub pa'i phyir mi dmigs pa yang zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: gzhan yang rtags gsum po de bsgrub pa'i phyir mi dmigs pa yang zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Moreover, in order to prove those three reasons, he says, ‚Äúnon-observation as well.‚Äù

original: sgrub par byed pa'i yan lag tu nus pa yin no zhes bya ba ni tshig lhag ma'o //
analyzed: sgrub par byed pa'i yan lag tu nus pa yin no zhes bya ba ni tshig lhag ma'o //
translated: The remainder of the sentence is, ‚Äúis capable of being a branch of proof.‚Äù

original: yang ci 'dra ba zhig ce na /
analyzed: yang ci 'dra ba zhig ce na /
translated: What kind of non-observation is it?

original: sgrub par byed pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: sgrub par byed pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says, ‚Äúthat which is a branch of proof,‚Äù and so on.

original: gang de'i don mi dmigs pa de ni gang gi tshe dmigs pa'i rig byar gyur pa las mi dmigs par bshad par gyur pa de'i tshad ma dmigs par sgrub par byed pa'i yan lag tu nus par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang de'i don mi dmigs pa de ni gang gi tshe dmigs pa'i rig byar gyur pa las mi dmigs par bshad par gyur pa de'i tshad ma dmigs par sgrub par byed pa'i yan lag tu nus par 'gyur ro //
translated: That non-observation of the object of that is explained as non-observation of what is suitable to appear. At that time, it is capable of being a branch of proof of non-observation of a valid cognition.

original: de ltar yang rgyu'i rnam pa nyid mi dmigs par bstan pas de sgrub par byed par ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: de ltar yang rgyu'i rnam pa nyid mi dmigs par bstan pas de sgrub par byed par ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: In that case, since non-observation of the aspect of the cause itself is taught, how could it be a proof of that?

original: de 'dra ba'i mi dmigs pa kho na'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de 'dra ba'i mi dmigs pa kho na'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says, ‚Äúonly that kind of non-observation,‚Äù and so on.

original: gang gi phyir dmigs pa'i rig byar gyur pa las gang mi dmigs pa nyid ni dngos po med pa sgrub par byed pa yin gyi gzhan ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir dmigs pa'i rig byar gyur pa las gang mi dmigs pa nyid ni dngos po med pa sgrub par byed pa yin gyi gzhan ni ma yin no //
translated: Because non-apprehension of something that is an object of apprehension establishes non-existence, not anything else.

original: ci'i phyir gzhan ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir gzhan ma yin zhe na /
translated: Why not anything else?

original: dmigs pa'i rig byar ma gyur pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: dmigs pa'i rig byar ma gyur pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says, ‚Äúbecause of not being an object of apprehension,‚Äù and so on.

original: gang mi dmigs pa'i rig byar gyur pa ma yin pa de'i don ni rtogs pa'i mngon sum log pas kyang med par mi 'grub ste /
analyzed: gang mi dmigs pa'i rig byar gyur pa ma yin pa de'i don ni rtogs pa'i mngon sum log pas kyang med par mi 'grub ste /
translated: The meaning of that is that non-apprehension of something that is not an object of apprehension is not established by the absence of a direct perception of the object.

original: gal te 'dir dmigs pa'i rig byar gyur pa ji ltar yin zhe na /
analyzed: gal te 'dir dmigs pa'i rig byar gyur pa ji ltar yin zhe na /
translated: If it is asked, ‚ÄúHow is it an object of apprehension here?‚Äù

original: de la dmigs pa'i rig byar gyur pa las zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos to //
analyzed: de la dmigs pa'i rig byar gyur pa las zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos to //
translated: He says, ‚Äúbecause of being an object of apprehension of that,‚Äù and so on.

original: rang bzhin khyad par can ni yul khyad par can du gyur pa'i don gyis gzhan bsal ba ni /
analyzed: rang bzhin khyad par can ni yul khyad par can du gyur pa'i don gyis gzhan bsal ba ni /
translated: The special nature is the object that has become a special object. The exclusion of other is

original: rgyu dang / de ma thag pa dang / bdag po'i rang bzhin gzhan bsal ba ni de rnams tshogs pa tshang ba ste /
analyzed: rgyu dang / de ma thag pa dang / bdag po'i rang bzhin gzhan bsal ba ni de rnams tshogs pa tshang ba ste /
translated: the exclusion of other causes, immediate conditions, and dominant conditions. The complete collection of those isüîΩthe complete collection of causes.

original: rang bzhin khyad par can dang rkyen gzhan tshang ba dang de gnyis ni dmigs pa'i rig byar gyur pa'i sgras bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin khyad par can dang rkyen gzhan tshang ba dang de gnyis ni dmigs pa'i rig byar gyur pa'i sgras bshad par bya'o //
translated: The special nature and the presence of other conditions should be explained as the object of the word ‚Äúappear.‚Äù

original: de yang rang bzhin khyad par can bstan pa ni gang bdag nyid ma yin pa'i snang ba @161a * //üîΩzhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de yang rang bzhin khyad par can bstan pa ni gang bdag nyid ma yin pa'i snang ba @161a * // zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Moreover, the teaching of the special nature is stated with ‚Äúthe appearance of what is not itself.‚Äù

original: bdag nyid ma yin pa'i ngo bo ni bdag nyid kyi ngo bo ni gzhan gyi ngo bo ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bdag nyid ma yin pa'i ngo bo ni bdag nyid kyi ngo bo ni gzhan gyi ngo bo ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that the nature of what is not itself is not the nature of itself, that is, the nature of another.

original: de'i so sor snang ba'i shes pa'i rang gi rnam pa de ni gzhan gyis dben pa'i dngos po sgrub pa'i mngon sum du snang ba'i dang tshul can yin no zhes rnam par sbyar ro //
analyzed: de'i so sor snang ba'i shes pa'i rang gi rnam pa de ni gzhan gyis dben pa'i dngos po sgrub pa'i mngon sum du snang ba'i dang tshul can yin no zhes rnam par sbyar ro //
translated: The form of the cognition that appears as that is the form of the direct perception that establishes the thing that is isolated from other things.

original: rtogs par byed pa'i mngon sum la rab tu snang ba ni de'i ngo bo yang yin no zhes bya ba bsdus pa yin no //
analyzed: rtogs par byed pa'i mngon sum la rab tu snang ba ni de'i ngo bo yang yin no zhes bya ba bsdus pa yin no //
translated: The appearance in the direct perception that causes understanding is also its nature. This is the meaning that is included.

original: 'di skad ston pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di skad ston pa yin te /
translated: This is what is being taught.

original: gang dngos po'i rang bzhin gyi ngo bo rnams yongs su spangs pas rang kho na ngo bo mngon sum la so sor snang ba ni de 'dir rang bzhin khyad par can zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: gang dngos po'i rang bzhin gyi ngo bo rnams yongs su spangs pas rang kho na ngo bo mngon sum la so sor snang ba ni de 'dir rang bzhin khyad par can zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: That which is the nature of entities, the essence that is completely abandoned, and which appears individually to direct perception as just itself, is taught here as the special nature.

original: spyi'i don nye bar bsdu ba bstan pa ni /
analyzed: spyi'i don nye bar bsdu ba bstan pa ni /
translated: The summary of the general meaning is taught:

original: de 'dra ba yod par gyur pa'i dmigs pa'i rgyu can zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de 'dra ba yod par gyur pa'i dmigs pa'i rgyu can zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The cause of the observation of such an existent is called the condition of observation.

original: de 'dra ba zhes bya ba ni bskal pa ma yin par snang ba'i ngo bo'o //
analyzed: de 'dra ba zhes bya ba ni bskal pa ma yin par snang ba'i ngo bo'o //
translated: The word such refers to the essence that appears without being imagined.

original: de gang gi tshe dmigs pa'i rkyen gzhan tshogs pa rnams kyang gzhan gyi ngo bo so sor snang bas dben pa ni de rang gi ngo bos dmigs pa med pa de'i tshe med pa'i tha snyad kyi yul du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de gang gi tshe dmigs pa'i rkyen gzhan tshogs pa rnams kyang gzhan gyi ngo bo so sor snang bas dben pa ni de rang gi ngo bos dmigs pa med pa de'i tshe med pa'i tha snyad kyi yul du 'gyur ro //
translated: When that is devoid of the appearance of the individual essences of the other assembled conditions of the observed object, at that time it becomes the object of the convention of non-existence by its own essence.

original: gal te yang de ltar khyad par lta na nyes pa ci yod ce na /
analyzed: gal te yang de ltar khyad par lta na nyes pa ci yod ce na /
translated: If one observes it in that way, what is the fault?

original: de las rnam pa gzhan yod pa ma yin pa'i rtags ni the tshom za ba yin no zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de las rnam pa gzhan yod pa ma yin pa'i rtags ni the tshom za ba yin no zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The reason that ‚Äúit does not exist in any other way‚Äù is uncertain.

original: gal te dmigs pa'i rig byar gyur pa mi 'dod pa yin na ni /
analyzed: gal te dmigs pa'i rig byar gyur pa mi 'dod pa yin na ni /
translated: If you do not accept that it is an observed non-apprehension,

original: de'i tshe rtags nyid cung zad kyang med pa'i phyir the tshom yin pas gcig tu med pa'i tha snyad bskyed pa ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de'i tshe rtags nyid cung zad kyang med pa'i phyir the tshom yin pas gcig tu med pa'i tha snyad bskyed pa ma yin no zhe na /
translated: then, because the reason itself is not the slightest bit established, it is uncertain, and therefore it does not generate the expression ‚Äúdoes not exist in any way.‚Äù

original: lan bstan pa /
analyzed: lan bstan pa /
translated: The response to that is as follows:

original: 'dir yang rnam pa de lta bu thams cad ni zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: 'dir yang rnam pa de lta bu thams cad ni zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Here also, all such aspects are

original: 'dir yang zhes bya ba ni mi dmigs pa'o //üîΩdper na gcig dmigs pa'i rig byar gyur pa las mi dmigs pas /
analyzed: 'dir yang zhes bya ba ni mi dmigs pa'o // dper na gcig dmigs pa'i rig byar gyur pa las mi dmigs pas /
translated: Here also refers to non-apprehension.üîΩFor example, because of non-apprehension of one that is an observed object, it becomes the object of the expression ‚Äúdoes not exist.‚Äù

original: med pa'i tha snyad kyi yul du gyur pa de bzhin du gnas thams cad kyang med pa'i tha snyad sgrub par byed pa'i dmigs pa'i rig byar gyur pa'i mi dmigs pa'i thabs kyi khyab pa grub pa yin no //
analyzed: med pa'i tha snyad kyi yul du gyur pa de bzhin du gnas thams cad kyang med pa'i tha snyad sgrub par byed pa'i dmigs pa'i rig byar gyur pa'i mi dmigs pa'i thabs kyi khyab pa grub pa yin no //
translated: In the same way, all places are pervaded by the method of non-apprehension that is an observed object that establishes the expression ‚Äúdoes not exist.‚Äù

original: gcig po med pa'i tha snyad kyi rgyu mtshan yod kyang bla ste /
analyzed: gcig po med pa'i tha snyad kyi rgyu mtshan yod kyang bla ste /
translated: It is fine if there is a reason for the term nonexistence of one,

original: gang yang thams cad med pa'i rgyu mtshan yin no zhes bya ba ga las shes she na /
analyzed: gang yang thams cad med pa'i rgyu mtshan yin no zhes bya ba ga las shes she na /
translated: but how do you know that the reason is the nonexistence of everything?

original: 'ga' zhig med par khas len pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: 'ga' zhig med par khas len pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The response to that is ‚ÄúIf you do not accept that nonapprehension is the object of the term nonexistence,‚Äù and so on.

original: gal te yang 'ga' zhig dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid kyir gyur pa'i @161b mi dmigs pas med pa'i tha snyad kyi yul can khas len par mi byed na de'i tshe gzhan gyi yang rnam pa de lta bu'i mi dmigs pa gang yin pa de yang med pa'i tha snyad
analyzed: gal te yang 'ga' zhig dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid kyir gyur pa'i @161b mi dmigs pas med pa'i tha snyad kyi yul can khas len par mi byed na de'i tshe gzhan gyi yang rnam pa de lta bu'i mi dmigs pa gang yin pa de yang med pa'i tha snyad
translated: If you do not accept that nonapprehension, which has the character of the nonapprehension of something, is the subject of the term nonexistence, then you should not accept that the nonapprehension of that kind of anything is the object of the term nonexistence.

original: kyi yul du 'dod par mi bya ste mtshungs pa yin pa'i phyir zhes dgongs pa yin no //
analyzed: kyi yul du 'dod par mi bya ste mtshungs pa yin pa'i phyir zhes dgongs pa yin no //
translated: The point is that it is the same.

original: gal te rgyu mtshan de dag gis kyang yod par khas mi len na nyes pa cir 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: gal te rgyu mtshan de dag gis kyang yod par khas mi len na nyes pa cir 'gyur zhe na /
translated: If you do not accept existence because of those reasons, what is the fault?

original: rnam pa de lta bu med pa khas mi len na zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: rnam pa de lta bu med pa khas mi len na zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The response to that is ‚ÄúIf you do not accept the nonexistence of that kind of anything,‚Äù and so on.

original: gal te yang dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid kyir gyur ba mi dmigs pa tsam gyi rgyu mtshan yod pa la lar khas mi len na der med pa'i tha snyad kyi rgyu mtshan gzhan khas blang bar bya ste /
analyzed: gal te yang dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid kyir gyur ba mi dmigs pa tsam gyi rgyu mtshan yod pa la lar khas mi len na der med pa'i tha snyad kyi rgyu mtshan gzhan khas blang bar bya ste /
translated: If, in some contexts, one does not accept the reason for the existence of non-apprehension, which is the characteristic of the object of apprehension, one should accept another reason for the convention of non-existence there.

original: rgyu mtshan gzhan dang 'brel pa yang ma yin pa'i phyir de brjod par bya bar 'dod pa sngon du song ba yin no //
analyzed: rgyu mtshan gzhan dang 'brel pa yang ma yin pa'i phyir de brjod par bya bar 'dod pa sngon du song ba yin no //
translated: Since it is not related to another reason, it is preceded by the desire to express it.

original: rgyu cis dmigs pa'i rig byar gyur pa las ma dmigs pa'i don ni gcig tu med pa'i tha snyad skyed pa yin snyam na /
analyzed: rgyu cis dmigs pa'i rig byar gyur pa las ma dmigs pa'i don ni gcig tu med pa'i tha snyad skyed pa yin snyam na /
translated: If one thinks, ‚ÄúBy what reason is the meaning of non-apprehension of what has become the object of apprehension generated as the convention of non-existence?‚Äù

original: de lta bu'i rnam pa yod cing zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: de lta bu'i rnam pa yod cing zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: In regard to ‚Äúif there were such a form,‚Äù etc.,

original: gang dmigs pa'i rig byar gyur pa dang yod pa yin na gdon mi za bar dmigs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang dmigs pa'i rig byar gyur pa dang yod pa yin na gdon mi za bar dmigs par 'gyur te /
translated: if what has become the object of apprehension and exists is not apprehended, then it is certainly apprehended.

original: de ltar de snyed tha dad pa mthong ba yin no //
analyzed: de ltar de snyed tha dad pa mthong ba yin no //
translated: Thus, it is seen to be just that much different.

original: 'di 'dra ba mi dmigs pa med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gang gi tshe dmigs pa'i rig byar gyur pa las yod par gyur pa de ni gdon mi za bar dmigs par gyur par brjod do //
analyzed: 'di 'dra ba mi dmigs pa med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gang gi tshe dmigs pa'i rig byar gyur pa las yod par gyur pa de ni gdon mi za bar dmigs par gyur par brjod do //
translated: ‚ÄúSuch non-apprehension‚Äù and so on. When something is an object of apprehension, if it exists, then it is certainly said to be apprehended.

original: de ni 'di 'dra ba'i mi dmigs par brjod na med do zhes shes par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ni 'di 'dra ba'i mi dmigs par brjod na med do zhes shes par 'gyur ro //
translated: If it is said to be such a non-apprehension, it is understood to be non-existent.

original: de'i phyir yang dmigs pa'i rig byar gyur pa las mi dmigs pa med pa'i tha snyad kyi rgyu mtshan de tsam nyid yin te zhes nges pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir yang dmigs pa'i rig byar gyur pa las mi dmigs pa med pa'i tha snyad kyi rgyu mtshan de tsam nyid yin te zhes nges pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is certain that the mere non-apprehension of what is an object of apprehension is the reason for the convention of non-existence.

original: med pa'i tha snyad kyi rgyu mtshan de dag ni yod kyang bla ste /
analyzed: med pa'i tha snyad kyi rgyu mtshan de dag ni yod kyang bla ste /
translated: Even if those reasons for the convention of non-existence exist,

original: gang yang 'di kho na rgyu mtshan yin no zhes 'di ga las she na /
analyzed: gang yang 'di kho na rgyu mtshan yin no zhes 'di ga las she na /
translated: how can it be known that this alone is the reason?

original: gzhan ni de'i rgyu mtshan med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: gzhan ni de'i rgyu mtshan med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: It is said that ‚Äúanother is without a reason,‚Äù and so on.

original: med pa'i tha snyad ni /
analyzed: med pa'i tha snyad ni /
translated: The convention of non-existenceüîΩis not established by mere non-apprehension.

original: di skad bshad pa'i mi dmigs pas thob par 'gyur gyi rgyu mtshan gzhan ni yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: di skad bshad pa'i mi dmigs pas thob par 'gyur gyi rgyu mtshan gzhan ni yod pa ma yin no //
translated: It is thus that one should understand non-apprehension, and not for any other reason.

original: ji ltar med pa de ltar phyis bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: ji ltar med pa de ltar phyis bshad par bya'o //
translated: How it is that it does not exist will be explained later.

original: gzhan yang rgyu mtshan logs shig tu bstan pa ni /
analyzed: gzhan yang rgyu mtshan logs shig tu bstan pa ni /
translated: Moreover, the reason is stated separately:

original: gal te nus pa thams cad kyis dben pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gal te nus pa thams cad kyis dben pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: If it is devoid of all capacity, etc.

original: 'dir cung zad kyang nus pa med pa rgyu mtshan 'dis med pa'i tha snyad du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dir cung zad kyang nus pa med pa rgyu mtshan 'dis med pa'i tha snyad du 'gyur ro //
translated: Here, the expression of non-existence is due to the absence of any capacity whatsoever.

original: grub pa'i mtha' smra bas /üîΩdeng bdag nyid kyi rjes su zlos pa ni ma yin pas /
analyzed: grub pa'i mtha' smra bas / deng bdag nyid kyi rjes su zlos pa ni ma yin pas /
translated: The proponent of tenets says:

original: de ni @162a * //
analyzed: de ni @162a * //
translated: Since it is not a repetition of what has been said by me,üîΩthat is not so.

original: de ltar yin na zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de ltar yin na zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: If it were so,

original: ji ltar khyed mngon par 'dod pa 'di de ltar 'di dag ni 'on te de nyid yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar khyed mngon par 'dod pa 'di de ltar 'di dag ni 'on te de nyid yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin no //
translated: then, just as you assert, it would be just that, etc.

original: de nyid nus pa thams cad kyis dben pa ni ji skad bshad pa'i mi dmigs pa nyid kyis khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: de nyid nus pa thams cad kyis dben pa ni ji skad bshad pa'i mi dmigs pa nyid kyis khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: That which is devoid of all capacity should be understood by means of the non-apprehension as explained.

original: ci'i phyir ji skad bshad pa nyid kyis yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir ji skad bshad pa nyid kyis yin zhe na /
translated: Why is it just as explained?

original: thabs gzhan med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: thabs gzhan med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says, ‚Äúbecause there is no other method,‚Äù and so on.üîΩBecause there is no other method for understanding the absence of capacity, it is understood just because of that.üîΩWhen it is understood that there is no capacity, it is understood that there is no object.üîΩWhen it is understood that there is no object, it is understood that there is no apprehension.

original: gang gi phyir nus pa med par khong du chud par byed pa'i tha bas gzhan med pa de nyid kyi phyir de rtogs par 'gyur ba yin te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir nus pa med par khong du chud par byed pa'i tha bas gzhan med pa de nyid kyi phyir de rtogs par 'gyur ba yin te /
translated: When it is understood that there is no apprehension, it is understood that there is no non-apprehension.üîΩWhen it is understood that there is no non-apprehension, it is understood that there is no apprehension.üîΩWhen it is understood that there is no apprehension and no non-apprehension, it is understood that there is no object.üîΩWhen it is understood that there is no object, it is understood that there is no apprehension.üîΩWhen it is understood that there is no apprehension and no non-apprehension, it is understood that there is no object.

original: gang yang de ltar rtogs pa yod na zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gang gi tshe yang ji skad bshad pa'i nus pa med pa ni mi dmigs pas rtogs par khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: gang yang de ltar rtogs pa yod na zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gang gi tshe yang ji skad bshad pa'i nus pa med pa ni mi dmigs pas rtogs par khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: When it is understood that there is no object, it is understood that there is no apprehension.üîΩWhen it is understood that there is no apprehension and no non-apprehension, it is understood that there is no object.üîΩWhen it is understood that there is no object, it is understood that there is no apprehension.üîΩWhen it is understood that there is no apprehension and no non-apprehension, it is understood that there is no object.üîΩWhen it is understood that there is no object, it is understood that there is no apprehension.üîΩWhen it is understood that there is no apprehension and no non-apprehension, it is understood that there is no object.üîΩWhen it is understood that there is no object, it is understood that there is no apprehension.üîΩWhen it is understood that there is no apprehension and no non-apprehension, it is understood that there is no object.üîΩWhen it is understood that there is no object, it is understood that there is no apprehension.üîΩWhen it is understood that there is no apprehension and no non-apprehension, it is understood that there is no object.üîΩWhen it is understood that there is no object, it is understood that there is no apprehension.üîΩWhen it is understood that there is no apprehension and no non-apprehension, it is understood that there is no object.

original: nus pa med pa ni med pa'i tha snyad du byed pa de'i phyir mi dmigs pa nyid 'dir thog mar rgyu mtshan yin pa'i phyir tha snyad kyi rgyu mtshan du brjod par bya'o //üîΩgzhan yang rgyu mtshan gzhan nye bar bstan pa ni /
analyzed: nus pa med pa ni med pa'i tha snyad du byed pa de'i phyir mi dmigs pa nyid 'dir thog mar rgyu mtshan yin pa'i phyir tha snyad kyi rgyu mtshan du brjod par bya'o // gzhan yang rgyu mtshan gzhan nye bar bstan pa ni /
translated: When it is understood that there is no object, it is understood that there is no apprehension.

original: gal te blo dang sgra dang don gyi bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gal te blo dang sgra dang don gyi bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: When it is understood that there is no apprehension and no non

original: blo ni shes pa yin la sgra ni brjod pa'o //
analyzed: blo ni shes pa yin la sgra ni brjod pa'o //
translated: Mind is cognition, and sound is expression.

original: don byed pa ni nus pa ste /
analyzed: don byed pa ni nus pa ste /
translated: Causal efficiency is capability.

original: gang la de 'jug pa yin pa /
analyzed: gang la de 'jug pa yin pa /
translated: That which engages in it

original: de ni de la yod pa'i tha snyad du byed pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni de la yod pa'i tha snyad du byed pa yin no //
translated: is the convention of existence in regard to it.

original: gang la 'jug pa med pa de ni med pa'i tha snyad yin no zhes bya ba ni phyogs snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: gang la 'jug pa med pa de ni med pa'i tha snyad yin no zhes bya ba ni phyogs snga ma bzhin no //
translated: That which does not engage in it is the convention of non-existence. This is the prior position.

original: phyogs phyi ma /
analyzed: phyogs phyi ma /
translated: The subsequent position is as follows:

original: ji skad du bshad pa'i blo la snang ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: ji skad du bshad pa'i blo la snang ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Whatever appears to the mind as explained, etc.

original: gang yang ji skad du bshad pa'i ngo bor snang ba'i mngon sum gyi blo 'jug pa de la ni yod pa'i tha snyad du 'gyur pa yin la /
analyzed: gang yang ji skad du bshad pa'i ngo bor snang ba'i mngon sum gyi blo 'jug pa de la ni yod pa'i tha snyad du 'gyur pa yin la /
translated: That which engages the mind of direct perception that appears in the form explained becomes the convention of existence.

original: gang la dmigs pa'i rig byar gyur pa dag mi 'jug pa de ni med pa'i tha snyad yin no //
analyzed: gang la dmigs pa'i rig byar gyur pa dag mi 'jug pa de ni med pa'i tha snyad yin no //
translated: That which does not engage the objects of observation becomes the convention of non-existence.

original: ji skad du bshad pa'i blo la snang ba zhes bya ba ni bdag ma yin pa'i ngo bo so sor snang bas rnam par dben par mngon sum la snang ba'i don 'dzin pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don yin no //
analyzed: ji skad du bshad pa'i blo la snang ba zhes bya ba ni bdag ma yin pa'i ngo bo so sor snang bas rnam par dben par mngon sum la snang ba'i don 'dzin pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don yin no //
translated: The meaning of the phrase ‚Äúwhat appears to the awareness‚Äù as it has been explained is that the object that appears to direct perception is the apprehension of the entity that is not the self, which appears individually, and is thus empty.

original: de'i yul zhes bya ba ni ji skad bshad pa'i blo'i yul lo //
analyzed: de'i yul zhes bya ba ni ji skad bshad pa'i blo'i yul lo //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúits object‚Äù refers to the object of the awareness as it has been explained.

original: rjes su dpag pas yod pa'i tha snyad kyi rgyu mtshan du bstan pa ni mngon sum gyi yul ma yin pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pas yod pa'i tha snyad kyi rgyu mtshan du bstan pa ni mngon sum gyi yul ma yin pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: The statement that it is the reason for the conventional designation of existence by inference is the phrase ‚Äúthe object of direct perception.‚Äù

original: gang la mngon sum mi 'jug pa de la yang rtags 'ga' zhig las skyes pa'i shes pas yod pa'i tha snyad du byed pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni /
analyzed: gang la mngon sum mi 'jug pa de la yang rtags 'ga' zhig las skyes pa'i shes pas yod pa'i tha snyad du byed pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthat which is not the object of direct perception‚Äù and so on means that even though direct perception does not engage it, one can make the conventional designation of existence on the basis of a cognition that arises from some sign.

original: gang la rjes su dpag pa @162b mi 'jug pa de la med pa'i tha snyad du bya ba ma yin te /
analyzed: gang la rjes su dpag pa @162b mi 'jug pa de la med pa'i tha snyad du bya ba ma yin te /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthat which is not the object of inference‚Äù and so on means that one cannot make the conventional designation of nonexistence on the basis of that which is not the object of inference.

original: ma nges pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: ma nges pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: This is because it is not ascertained.

original: de log pa la zhes bya ba ni rjes su dpag pa med pa de nyid ma nges par bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de log pa la zhes bya ba ni rjes su dpag pa med pa de nyid ma nges par bstan pa yin no //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúin the absence of that‚Äù indicates that the absence of inference is uncertain.

original: bskal pa'i don zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: bskal pa'i don zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthe meaning of the term ‚Äònonexistence‚Äô‚Äù and so on.

original: gang yang dbang po'i don de ni mngon sum mam rjes su dpag pa ldog pa las med pa sgrub par byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gang yang dbang po'i don de ni mngon sum mam rjes su dpag pa ldog pa las med pa sgrub par byed pa ma yin te /
translated: The object of the sense faculty is not established as nonexistent by the presence of the sense faculty or by the absence of perception.

original: the tshom skyed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: the tshom skyed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it gives rise to doubt.

original: de ltar na de ni res 'ga' zhig blo 'jug pa na med pa'i tha snyad sgrub par byed pa yin pa dang ldog pa las med pa'i tha snyad byed pa ni thams cad dang thams cad du ma yin pa la dgag pa byed pa ni ma yin te
analyzed: de ltar na de ni res 'ga' zhig blo 'jug pa na med pa'i tha snyad sgrub par byed pa yin pa dang ldog pa las med pa'i tha snyad byed pa ni thams cad dang thams cad du ma yin pa la dgag pa byed pa ni ma yin te
translated: Thus, it is not the case that the presence of the sense faculty sometimes establishes the term ‚Äúnonexistent‚Äù and that the absence of perception always establishes the term ‚Äúnonexistent.‚Äù

original: / blo dang sgra thams cad ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: / blo dang sgra thams cad ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúno cognition or expression‚Äù and so on.

original: blo dang sgra tsam las yod par sgrub par byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: blo dang sgra tsam las yod par sgrub par byed pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not the case that cognition and expression alone establish existence.

original: blo dang sgra dag tha dad pa dang tha dad pa ma yin pas kyang dngos po tha dad pa dang / tha dad pa ma yin pa sgrub par byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: blo dang sgra dag tha dad pa dang tha dad pa ma yin pas kyang dngos po tha dad pa dang / tha dad pa ma yin pa sgrub par byed pa ma yin no //
translated: The mind and the word are neither different nor non-different, and therefore they do not prove the difference or non-difference of the thing.

original: gang la blo'i rnam pa tha dad par 'jug par byed pa de la thams cad du dngos po tha dad par byed pa 'am /
analyzed: gang la blo'i rnam pa tha dad par 'jug par byed pa de la thams cad du dngos po tha dad par byed pa 'am /
translated: When the mind and the word are applied in different aspects, then the thing is different in all cases.

original: gang la tha dad pa med pa'i rnam pa de la dngos po tha mi dad par byed pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: gang la tha dad pa med pa'i rnam pa de la dngos po tha mi dad par byed pa ni ma yin te /
translated: When they are applied in non-different aspects, then the thing is non-different.

original: de ltar sgra la yang blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar sgra la yang blta bar bya'o //
translated: This is also to be seen in the case of the word.

original: rgyu cis bsgrub par bya ba ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: rgyu cis bsgrub par bya ba ma yin zhe na /
translated: Why is it not to be established?

original: ji ltar yang 'das pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: ji ltar yang 'das pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says, ‚ÄúHow can the past, etc., be established?‚Äù

original: ma rig pa'i dbang gis de dag kyang 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa la sogs pa rnams kyis bag chags yongs su smin pa'i dbang gis nges pa 'ga' zhig tha snyad du byed pa'i blo dang sgra dag 'jug par mthong ba yin no //
analyzed: ma rig pa'i dbang gis de dag kyang 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa la sogs pa rnams kyis bag chags yongs su smin pa'i dbang gis nges pa 'ga' zhig tha snyad du byed pa'i blo dang sgra dag 'jug par mthong ba yin no //
translated: By the power of nescience, the mind and the word are seen to be applied to some certainty in the conventional, by the power of the maturation of the residual impressions of the past, etc.

original: sogs pa'i sgras ni ri bong gi rva la sogs pa bsdu'o //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras ni ri bong gi rva la sogs pa bsdu'o //
translated: The words ‚Äúand so on‚Äù include the horn of a rabbit and so on.

original: sna tshogs pa dang gcig pa'i don gyi bya ba byed pa'i phyir na sna tshogs pa'i bya ba byed pa dang / gcig pa'i bya ba byed par nus pa yin no zhes tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
analyzed: sna tshogs pa dang gcig pa'i don gyi bya ba byed pa'i phyir na sna tshogs pa'i bya ba byed pa dang / gcig pa'i bya ba byed par nus pa yin no zhes tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
translated: The meaning of the statement ‚Äúbecause it performs the function of a variety and the function of a unity‚Äù is that it is able to perform the function of a variety and the function of a unity.

original: dngos po med kyang de nyid bsal bar bya ba'i don du zhes bya ba ni sna tshogs pa dang gcig pa'i don gyi bya ba byed pa bsal ba yin no //
analyzed: dngos po med kyang de nyid bsal bar bya ba'i don du zhes bya ba ni sna tshogs pa dang gcig pa'i don gyi bya ba byed pa bsal ba yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúEven though it is not a real entity‚Äù means that the performance of the function of a variety and the function of a unity are not real entities.

original: sna tshogs pa dang gcig pa'i bdag nyid dngos pos kyang zhes bya ba ni sna tshogs pa'i bdag nyid dang gcig pa'i bdag nyid dag ni sna tshogs pa dang gcig pa'i bdag nyid la blo dang sgra dag 'jug pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sna tshogs pa dang gcig pa'i bdag nyid dngos pos kyang zhes bya ba ni sna tshogs pa'i bdag nyid dang gcig pa'i bdag nyid dag ni sna tshogs pa dang gcig pa'i bdag nyid la blo dang sgra dag 'jug pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: ‚ÄúEven though it is a real entity that has a variety and a unity of nature‚Äù means that the notions of a variety and a unity are applied to a variety and a unity of nature, respectively, because the notions and the terms are applied to them.

original: 'di skad ston pa @163a * //
analyzed: 'di skad ston pa @163a * //
translated: This is what is being demonstrated.

original: yin te / don sna tshogs kyi bya ba byed pa'i dngos po don sna tshogs byed par snang ba dang / sna tshogs kyi dngos po med kyang sna tshogs pa'i ngo bo blo dang sgra dag kyang mthong ba'i phyir de ltar don gcig byed pa'i dngos po dag la /
analyzed: yin te / don sna tshogs kyi bya ba byed pa'i dngos po don sna tshogs byed par snang ba dang / sna tshogs kyi dngos po med kyang sna tshogs pa'i ngo bo blo dang sgra dag kyang mthong ba'i phyir de ltar don gcig byed pa'i dngos po dag la /
translated: Because things that perform the function of various objects appear to perform various functions, and although various things do not exist, the cognition and words of various natures are seen.

original: don gcig byed par snang ba yin no //
analyzed: don gcig byed par snang ba yin no //
translated: Thus, things that perform a single function appear to perform a single function.

original: gcig pa'i bdag nyid med kyang gcig pa'i bdag nyid kyi dngos po'i blo dang sgra dag mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gcig pa'i bdag nyid med kyang gcig pa'i bdag nyid kyi dngos po'i blo dang sgra dag mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Although they do not have the nature of unity, the cognition and words of the nature of unity are seen.

original: 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa la sogs pa rnams kyi med pa rnams la 'jug pa ni dngos po yod pa ma yin pa'i sgrub par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa la sogs pa rnams kyi med pa rnams la 'jug pa ni dngos po yod pa ma yin pa'i sgrub par byed pa yin te /
translated: The engagement of non-existents such as the past and future is the proof of the non-existence of existent things.

original: sna tshogs pa'i don gyi bya ba byed pa rnams gcig gi rang bzhin la 'jug pa dang dngos po tha dad pa med pa go bar byed pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: sna tshogs pa'i don gyi bya ba byed pa rnams gcig gi rang bzhin la 'jug pa dang dngos po tha dad pa med pa go bar byed pa ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not that things that perform the function of various objects engage in the nature of unity, nor that the understanding of the non-difference of distinct things is the proof of the non-existence of existent things.

original: don gyi bya ba byed pa rnams ni gcig gi rang bzhin la 'jug pa yin te /
analyzed: don gyi bya ba byed pa rnams ni gcig gi rang bzhin la 'jug pa yin te /
translated: The performance of the function of the object is the engagement in the nature of one.

original: dngos po tha dad pa med pa sgrub par byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: dngos po tha dad pa med pa sgrub par byed pa ma yin te /
