translated: If the difference is from the object that is the referent of the promise, and the object that is the referent of the observation of something else, then that object is also the domain of the expression of non-existence.üîΩSince the pervasion is established, all such kinds are

original: ba la sogs pa yin no //
analyzed: ba la sogs pa yin no //
translated: so on.

original: 'ga' zhig ces bya ba ni don rgyas par bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: 'ga' zhig ces bya ba ni don rgyas par bshad pa yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúSome‚Äù is the extensive explanation of the object.

original: la lar zhes bya bas ni yul yongs su gzung ngo //
analyzed: la lar zhes bya bas ni yul yongs su gzung ngo //
translated: ‚ÄúSomewhere‚Äù is the complete apprehension of the object.

original: res 'ga' zhig ces bya bas ni rab tu byed pa'i brjod par bya ba ni gal te don 'ga' zhig yul la lar rnam pa 'ga' zhig de bzhin du mi dmigs su zin kyang de ni med pa'i tha snyad kyi yul du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: res 'ga' zhig ces bya bas ni rab tu byed pa'i brjod par bya ba ni gal te don 'ga' zhig yul la lar rnam pa 'ga' zhig de bzhin du mi dmigs su zin kyang de ni med pa'i tha snyad kyi yul du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: ‚ÄúSometimes‚Äù is the topic of the composition. If some object somewhere is not observed in some way, even then it is not the domain of the expression of non-existence.

original: rgyu ci yin zhe na /
analyzed: rgyu ci yin zhe na /
translated: What is the reason?

original: thams cad thams cad kyi tshe zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: thams cad thams cad kyi tshe zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: It is said ‚Äúall at all times‚Äù and so on.

original: gang gi phyir don thams cad dang / dus thams cad dang / dngos po thams cad du mi ldog pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni phyogs snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir don thams cad dang / dus thams cad dang / dngos po thams cad du mi ldog pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni phyogs snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The opponent‚Äôs position is stated in the lines: ‚ÄúBecause it is not excluded from all objects, all times, and all things.‚Äù

original: grub pa'i mtha' smra bas /üîΩde ltar gyur na thams cad ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: grub pa'i mtha' smra bas / de ltar gyur na thams cad ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The Proponents of True Existence respond:üîΩIf that were the case, then everything would be produced from everything, because all objects, all times, and all aspects would exist.

original: gang gi tshe don thams cad dang / dus thams cad dang rnam pa thams cad du yod pa de'i tshe dngos po thams cad yul thams cad du dus thams cad kyi tshe nye bar sbyor ba yin pa'i phyir ro //üîΩde lta na yang 'bras kyi 'bras bu don du gnyer ba nas kyi rnam pa las kyang nas kyi @169b 'bras bu don du gnyer ba yin gyi 'bras bu 'di las ni ma yin no zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: gang gi tshe don thams cad dang / dus thams cad dang rnam pa thams cad du yod pa de'i tshe dngos po thams cad yul thams cad du dus thams cad kyi tshe nye bar sbyor ba yin pa'i phyir ro // de lta na yang 'bras kyi 'bras bu don du gnyer ba nas kyi rnam pa las kyang nas kyi @169b 'bras bu don du gnyer ba yin gyi 'bras bu 'di las ni ma yin no zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: In that case, all things would be connected to all objects at all times.

original: 'bras kyi zhing la nas rmo ba dang / nas kyi zhing la 'bras rmo ba ni ma yin no zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: 'bras kyi zhing la nas rmo ba dang / nas kyi zhing la 'bras rmo ba ni ma yin no zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: Even so, those who seek rice as a result would plant rice seeds, not barley seeds, and they would plant the seeds in a rice field, not a barley field.

original: dbyar char bab pa'i dus na rmo bas dgun gyi dus su nas ma yin no zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: dbyar char bab pa'i dus na rmo bas dgun gyi dus su nas ma yin no zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: The farmer sows the seed in the rainy season, not in the winter.

original: bsags pa'i rgyu mthong ba ni 'di lta bu yin gyi 'di ma yin no //
analyzed: bsags pa'i rgyu mthong ba ni 'di lta bu yin gyi 'di ma yin no //
translated: This is the way to see the cause of accumulation, not the other way around.

original: 'di yang rnam par phye na ni ma yin gyi zho la sogs pa 'di ni 'bras bur 'dod pa'i 'o ma la sogs pa ni 'bras bu yin na //
analyzed: 'di yang rnam par phye na ni ma yin gyi zho la sogs pa 'di ni 'bras bur 'dod pa'i 'o ma la sogs pa ni 'bras bu yin na //
translated: This is not the case if one analyzes, for curd, etc., is the effect, and milk, etc., is the cause.

original: de bzhin du khar gzhong la sogs pa 'di ni rten yin la rgya shug la sogs pa 'di ni brten pa yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du khar gzhong la sogs pa 'di ni rten yin la rgya shug la sogs pa 'di ni brten pa yin no //
translated: Similarly, the bowl, etc., is the support, and the curd, etc., is the supported.

original: myu gu la sogs pa 'di skye ba'i dus kyi tshe 'bras bu dang me tog la sogs pa 'di ni ma yin no //
analyzed: myu gu la sogs pa 'di skye ba'i dus kyi tshe 'bras bu dang me tog la sogs pa 'di ni ma yin no //
translated: The sprout, etc., is the effect, and the seed, etc., is the cause.

original: me rang gi ngo bo sreg par byed pa yin la 'di chus ni ma yin no //
analyzed: me rang gi ngo bo sreg par byed pa yin la 'di chus ni ma yin no //
translated: The fire is the agent of burning, not the water.

original: de ltar thams cad du rtogs pa 'dis rgyu'i byed pa bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar thams cad du rtogs pa 'dis rgyu'i byed pa bstan pa yin no //
translated: In this way, the activity of the cause is demonstrated in all cases.

original: 'dir yang mi 'gyur te zhes bya ba ni 'bras bur gyur ba'i bye brag ma yin no //
analyzed: 'dir yang mi 'gyur te zhes bya ba ni 'bras bur gyur ba'i bye brag ma yin no //
translated: Here, the word ‚Äúalso‚Äù means that the effect is not a specific type of cause.

original: med pa'i rnam par dbye ba las nyes pa ci yod ce na /
analyzed: med pa'i rnam par dbye ba las nyes pa ci yod ce na /
translated: What is the fault of the analysis of nonexistence?

original: dngos po 'ga' zhig gi tshe zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: dngos po 'ga' zhig gi tshe zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says, ‚ÄúAt what time, etc.‚Äù

original: gang gi tshe dngos po 'ga' zhig rnam pa cung zad cig don 'ga' zhig tu dus 'ga' zhig gi tshe rgyu'i rnam par dbye ba med pa de'i 'gro ba thams cad rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog par byed pa med par 'gyur ro /
analyzed: gang gi tshe dngos po 'ga' zhig rnam pa cung zad cig don 'ga' zhig tu dus 'ga' zhig gi tshe rgyu'i rnam par dbye ba med pa de'i 'gro ba thams cad rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog par byed pa med par 'gyur ro /
translated: At what time, some thing, some aspect, some object, some time, if the cause is not analyzed, then the pervasion and counter-pervasion of all things would be impossible.

original: gal te yul dang dus dang rnam pa thams cad mtshungs par gyur pa de'i tshe tha dad pa med pas ji ltar tha dad pa brten nas rjes su 'gro ba ldog par byed pa yin zhes gzhan dogs pas gal te dngos po la tha dad pa med pa'i
analyzed: gal te yul dang dus dang rnam pa thams cad mtshungs par gyur pa de'i tshe tha dad pa med pas ji ltar tha dad pa brten nas rjes su 'gro ba ldog par byed pa yin zhes gzhan dogs pas gal te dngos po la tha dad pa med pa'i
translated: If the object, time, and aspect are all the same, then at that time, since there is no difference, how could difference be based on pervasion and counter-pervasion?

original: gnas skabs zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gnas skabs zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Since another doubts this, he says, ‚ÄúIf there is no difference in the thing, etc.‚Äù

original: de la de ltar ni 'gyur na gnas skabs 'ga' zhig tu 'jug pa dang 'ga' zhig tu ldog pa de dang des byas pa'i gnas skabs su 'gyur ro zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de la de ltar ni 'gyur na gnas skabs 'ga' zhig tu 'jug pa dang 'ga' zhig tu ldog pa de dang des byas pa'i gnas skabs su 'gyur ro zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: If it were like that, then in some circumstances it would engage and in some circumstances it would disengage, and the state produced by that would be a state.

original: grub pa'i mtha' smra bas /
analyzed: grub pa'i mtha' smra bas /
translated: The proponent of tenets says,

original: 'o na ni de nyid du yul thams cad la zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: 'o na ni de nyid du yul thams cad la zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: ‚ÄúWell then, it would be in all objects.‚Äù

original: gang gi tshe yul thams cad la med pa'i tha snyad du 'dod pa de'i tshe gnas skabs gang la 'jug pa dang ldog par 'gyur /
analyzed: gang gi tshe yul thams cad la med pa'i tha snyad du 'dod pa de'i tshe gnas skabs gang la 'jug pa dang ldog par 'gyur /
translated: When you assert that the term nonexistence is in all objects, then in what state would engagement and disengagement occur?

original: des byas pa'i rnam par gzhag pa yang gang zhig yin /
analyzed: des byas pa'i rnam par gzhag pa yang gang zhig yin /
translated: What would be the classification produced by that?

original: gang zhig gis smras pa /
analyzed: gang zhig gis smras pa /
translated: Someone says,

original: yul thams cad la med pa'i tha snyad kyis gdags pa ma yin nam zhe na /üîΩyul 'ga' @170a * //
analyzed: yul thams cad la med pa'i tha snyad kyis gdags pa ma yin nam zhe na / yul 'ga' @170a * //
translated: ‚ÄúIsn‚Äôt the term nonexistence imputed in all objects?‚Äù

original: zhig la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: zhig la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: ‚ÄúIn some objects‚Äù and so on.

original: gang gi tshe 'ga' zhig cha shas kyis byed pas med pa'i tha snyad 'dod pa de lta na rgyu mtshan gang zhig yin zhes bya ba brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: gang gi tshe 'ga' zhig cha shas kyis byed pas med pa'i tha snyad 'dod pa de lta na rgyu mtshan gang zhig yin zhes bya ba brjod par bya ste /
translated: When you assert that the term nonexistence is used in some objects because of a part, then in that case, what is the reason?

original: ci rgyu mtshan med pa yin na ma zhe na /
analyzed: ci rgyu mtshan med pa yin na ma zhe na /
translated: If it is asked, ‚ÄúIs it without a reason?‚Äù

original: mi dmigs pa las gzhan zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: mi dmigs pa las gzhan zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: It is said, ‚ÄúApart from non-observation‚Ä¶‚Äù

original: gang gi phyir mi dmigs pa bshad pa las gzhan rnam pa'i gtan tshigs ni med na /
analyzed: gang gi phyir mi dmigs pa bshad pa las gzhan rnam pa'i gtan tshigs ni med na /
translated: If there is no reason other than the explanation of non-observation,üîΩthen it is like, ‚ÄúHere there is no cold sensation because fire exists.‚Äù

original: 'di na grang ba'i reg pa med de me yod pa'i phyir zhes bya ba yin na de ci mi dmigs pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'di na grang ba'i reg pa med de me yod pa'i phyir zhes bya ba yin na de ci mi dmigs pa yin zhe na /
translated: If it is asked, ‚ÄúIs that non-observation?‚Äù

original: dgag pa dang sgrub pa dag gi zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: dgag pa dang sgrub pa dag gi zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: It is said, ‚ÄúIn the case of negation and affirmation‚Ä¶‚Äù

original: gang la 'ga' zhig bkag pas don gzhan 'gog par byed pa de la mi dmigs pa nyid yod pa yin no //
analyzed: gang la 'ga' zhig bkag pas don gzhan 'gog par byed pa de la mi dmigs pa nyid yod pa yin no //
translated: If one negates something and thereby negates another object, then there is non-observation.

original: gang la don sgrub pas 'ga' zhig 'gog par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: gang la don sgrub pas 'ga' zhig 'gog par byed pa yin te /
translated: If one affirms an object and thereby negates something,

original: de la yang mi dmigs pa nyid rgyu mtshan yin no //
analyzed: de la yang mi dmigs pa nyid rgyu mtshan yin no //
translated: then non-observation is the reason.

original: ji ltar yang don gang dmigs par gyur bas dgag pa ma yin pa gang yin pa de ni med pa nyid mi 'grub ste /
analyzed: ji ltar yang don gang dmigs par gyur bas dgag pa ma yin pa gang yin pa de ni med pa nyid mi 'grub ste /
translated: Also, if an object is observed, then that which is not negated is not established as nonexistent.

original: de'i phyir don gzhan sgrub pa'i mi dmigs pas kyang phan tshun byad pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir don gzhan sgrub pa'i mi dmigs pas kyang phan tshun byad pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, non-apprehension of something else does not prove mutual exclusion.

original: 'dir mi dmigs pa sgrub par byed pa nyid yin du chug kyang 'dod pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'dir mi dmigs pa sgrub par byed pa nyid yin du chug kyang 'dod pa yin zhe na /
translated: Here, one might say that even if non-apprehension is a proof, it is not accepted.

original: mi dmigs pa nyid las zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: mi dmigs pa nyid las zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: To this it is said:

original: gang gi tshe mi dmigs pa 'ga' zhig tu med pa'i tha snyad khas len pa de'i tshe thams cad du de med pa'i tha snyad kyi rgyu mtshan kha blang bar bya'o //
analyzed: gang gi tshe mi dmigs pa 'ga' zhig tu med pa'i tha snyad khas len pa de'i tshe thams cad du de med pa'i tha snyad kyi rgyu mtshan kha blang bar bya'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIf non-apprehension is accepted as a convention of non-existence in some cases, then in all cases the reason for the convention of non-existence should be accepted.‚Äù

original: rgyu ci yin zhe na /
analyzed: rgyu ci yin zhe na /
translated: What is the reason?

original: khyad par med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /üîΩ'dir dmigs pa'i rig byar gyur ba'i mi dmigs pa las 'ga' zhig bye brag med pa yin na /
analyzed: khyad par med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te / 'dir dmigs pa'i rig byar gyur ba'i mi dmigs pa las 'ga' zhig bye brag med pa yin na /
translated: To this it is said: ‚ÄúBecause there is no distinction, etc.‚ÄùüîΩHere, if non-apprehension of something that is an object of apprehension is not distinguished in some cases,

original: 'ga' zhig med pa'i tha snyad kyi rgyu mtshan 'ga' zhig tu yang mi dmigs pa yin par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'ga' zhig med pa'i tha snyad kyi rgyu mtshan 'ga' zhig tu yang mi dmigs pa yin par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: then non-apprehension would not be the reason for the convention of non-existence in some cases.

original: 'dir gzhan dag na re gal te tshad ma thams cad ldog pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te //
analyzed: 'dir gzhan dag na re gal te tshad ma thams cad ldog pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te //
translated: Here, others say, ‚ÄúIf all valid cognitions were reversed,‚Äù and so on.

original: gang la yang tshad ma thams cad nus pa gang yin pa de la med pa'i tha snyad du bya ba yin no //
analyzed: gang la yang tshad ma thams cad nus pa gang yin pa de la med pa'i tha snyad du bya ba yin no //
translated: In any case, a convention of non-existence is made in regard to that which is not possible for all valid cognitions.

original: gang gi phyir tshad ma rgyu mtshan gyi gzhal bya rtogs pa yin pa'i phyir de'i tshad ma med pas gzhal bya gzhan med pa yin no zhe'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir tshad ma rgyu mtshan gyi gzhal bya rtogs pa yin pa'i phyir de'i tshad ma med pas gzhal bya gzhan med pa yin no zhe'o //
translated: Because valid cognition is the realization of the object characterized, when there is no valid cognition of that, there is no other object to be measured.

original: grub pa'i mtha' smra bas /
analyzed: grub pa'i mtha' smra bas /
translated: The proponent of tenets says:

original: bzhad gang du shes rab shin tu gzhon pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: bzhad gang du shes rab shin tu gzhon pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: ‚ÄúThose whose wisdom is very young,‚Äù and so on.

original: 'on te 'di dag ni rtogs pa bzang po yin na ni ci'i @170b phyir bzhad gad byed ce na /üîΩrjes su dpag pa la sogs pa ldog pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: 'on te 'di dag ni rtogs pa bzang po yin na ni ci'i @170b phyir bzhad gad byed ce na / rjes su dpag pa la sogs pa ldog pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: If these are good realizations, then why do you laugh?üîΩ‚ÄúBecause inference and so on are reversed,‚Äù and so on.

original: rjes su dpag pa log pas med pa sgrub par byed pa la 'khrul ba yin no zhes bshad zin te /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa log pas med pa sgrub par byed pa la 'khrul ba yin no zhes bshad zin te /
translated: It has already been explained that it is mistaken to prove non-existence by the reversal of inference and so on.

original: srog chags thams cad kyi mngon sum gyi 'jug pa ldog pa med do zhes bsgrub par bya ba ni ma yin te /
analyzed: srog chags thams cad kyi mngon sum gyi 'jug pa ldog pa med do zhes bsgrub par bya ba ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not being established that the direct perception of all living beings is incapable of refuting the existence of the object.

original: ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not established.

original: bskal ba la bdag nyid kyi mngon sum log kyang med pa sgrub par byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: bskal ba la bdag nyid kyi mngon sum log kyang med pa sgrub par byed pa ma yin te /
translated: Even if one‚Äôs own direct perception were to cease for an eon, it would not establish nonexistence.

original: the tshom gyi rgyu med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: the tshom gyi rgyu med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no cause for doubt.

original: ci 'dra ba'i tshad ma log pas med pa sgrub par byed pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci 'dra ba'i tshad ma log pas med pa sgrub par byed pa yin zhe na /
translated: What kind of cessation of a valid cognition establishes nonexistence?

original: de'i phyir rang bzhin gyi khyad par zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir rang bzhin gyi khyad par zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Therefore, it is said, ‚Äúthe specific nature of a valid cognition,‚Äù and so on.

original: tshad ma gang las don nges pa yod pa'i tha snyad byed pa de nyid kyi tshad ma ldog pa yin pas des med pa'i tha snyad sgrub par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: tshad ma gang las don nges pa yod pa'i tha snyad byed pa de nyid kyi tshad ma ldog pa yin pas des med pa'i tha snyad sgrub par byed pa yin no //
translated: The valid cognition from which the ascertainment of an object is made is the very valid cognition that ceases. Therefore, it establishes the conventional term ‚Äúnonexistent.‚Äù

original: dmigs pa'i rig byar gyur ba las mi dmigs pa'i rang bzhin gyi khyad par las gzhan ma yin no //
analyzed: dmigs pa'i rig byar gyur ba las mi dmigs pa'i rang bzhin gyi khyad par las gzhan ma yin no //
translated: Non-apprehension is not different from the specific nature of non-apprehension of that which is an object of apprehension.

original: rgyu ci yin zhe na /
analyzed: rgyu ci yin zhe na /
translated: What is the reason?

original: de'i rang bzhin yod pa de la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin yod pa de la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: It is said, ‚ÄúThe existence of that specific nature,‚Äù and so on.

original: de lta na de'i don gang yin pa de dang de ni tshad ma yin pas khyab ste /
analyzed: de lta na de'i don gang yin pa de dang de ni tshad ma yin pas khyab ste /
translated: In that case, whatever is its meaning is pervaded by being a valid cognition.

original: de'i phyir yang khyab par byed pa'i tshad ma ldog pas khyab par bya ba'i don ldog pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir yang khyab par byed pa'i tshad ma ldog pas khyab par bya ba'i don ldog pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the pervasion is reversed by the pervasion of the valid cognition, and the meaning to be pervaded is reversed.

original: de lta na ni 'gyur na ldog pa yang mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa 'jug pa de'i phyir med par nges pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de lta na ni 'gyur na ldog pa yang mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa 'jug pa de'i phyir med par nges pa yin no zhe na /
translated: If that were so, then the reversal would also engage with direct perception and inference, and therefore it would be ascertained as non-existent.

original: dmigs pa'i rig byar gyur ba'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: dmigs pa'i rig byar gyur ba'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says that which is an object of observation, and so on.

original: gang yang dmigs pa'i rig byar gyur ba las ma dmigs pa'i don mngon sum yin par bshad pa las gzhan 'ga' zhig dmigs par 'gyur ba ni yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gang yang dmigs pa'i rig byar gyur ba las ma dmigs pa'i don mngon sum yin par bshad pa las gzhan 'ga' zhig dmigs par 'gyur ba ni yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Whatever is an object of observation is not an object of non-observation, and direct perception is explained to be an object of observation. Other than that, there is nothing that is observed.

original: de'i phyir rjes su dpag pa las kyang yang dmigs pa yod pa yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir rjes su dpag pa las kyang yang dmigs pa yod pa yin te /
translated: Therefore, even by inference, the object of observation exists.

original: des na rjes su dpag pas nye bar dmigs pas mi rigs par brtags pa'i yod par 'dod pa de lta bur gyur ba nyid de ni mngon sum gyis kyang yongs su gcod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: des na rjes su dpag pas nye bar dmigs pas mi rigs par brtags pa'i yod par 'dod pa de lta bur gyur ba nyid de ni mngon sum gyis kyang yongs su gcod pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, that which is imagined to exist by the non-existence imagined by inference is not even ascertained by direct perception.

original: de'i rang bzhin med par yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin med par yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says, ‚ÄúNor is it the nature of that non-existence,‚Äù etc.

original: gang dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid kyir gyur ba de las gal te gzhan ma yin na /
analyzed: gang dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid kyir gyur ba de las gal te gzhan ma yin na /
translated: If that which has the characteristic of being perceived is not different from that,

original: de ji ltar mngon sum du mi 'gyur /
analyzed: de ji ltar mngon sum du mi 'gyur /
translated: how can it not be direct perception?

original: gzhan du gyur ba de lta na ni de nyid de'i yul ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan du gyur ba de lta na ni de nyid de'i yul ma yin no //
translated: If it is different, then it is not the object of that.

original: yang cig shos ni /
analyzed: yang cig shos ni /
translated: Again, the other says,

original: 'on kyang sngags dang sman med par zhes bya ba la @171a * //üîΩsogs pa smos te /
analyzed: 'on kyang sngags dang sman med par zhes bya ba la @171a * // sogs pa smos te /
translated: ‚ÄúBut without the mantra and medicine,‚Äù etc.

original: 'di'i sgyu ma mkhan med na gang las sngags dang sman rnams kyi dngos po slob pa na gang gis 'ga' zhig sngar med pa'i dngos po skyed pa yang med la snga ma 'jig pa yang med la cung zad cig bar du chod pa yin pa dang /
analyzed: 'di'i sgyu ma mkhan med na gang las sngags dang sman rnams kyi dngos po slob pa na gang gis 'ga' zhig sngar med pa'i dngos po skyed pa yang med la snga ma 'jig pa yang med la cung zad cig bar du chod pa yin pa dang /
translated: If there is no magician here, from what are the things of the mantra and medicine learned? By what is the non-existence of something previously generated, and the non-destruction of the previous, and the interruption of something slight, and the non-existence of something else, and the existence of something else, and the non-existence of something else, and the existence of something else, and the non-existence of something else, and the existence of something else, and the non-existence of something else, and the existence of something else, and the non-existence of something else, and the existence of something else, and the non-existence of something else, and the existence of something else, and the non-existence of something else, and the existence of something else, and the non-existence of something else, and the existence of something else, and the non-existence of something else, and the existence of something else, and the non-existence of something else, and the existence of something else, and the non-existence of something else, and the existence of something else, and the non-existence of something else, and the existence of something else, and the non-existence of something else, and the existence of something else, and the non-existence of something else, and the existence of something else, and the non-existence of something else, and the existence of something else, and the non-existence of something else, and the existence of something else, and the non-existence of something else, and the existence of something else, and the non-existence of something else, and the existence of something else, and the non-existence of something else, and the existence of something else, and the non-existence of something else, and the existence of something else, and the non-existence of something else, and the existence of something else, and the non-existence of something else, and the existence of something else, and the non-existence of something else, and the existence

original: gzhan yang ring po ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni reg par 'dod pa yin pa de'i phyir skyes bu'i mngon sum ma tshad ba med pa las gzhan pa'i shes pa dang yod pa 'ga' zhig mngon sum gyi yul du gyur pa dang / 'ga' zhig khong du chud pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhan yang ring po ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni reg par 'dod pa yin pa de'i phyir skyes bu'i mngon sum ma tshad ba med pa las gzhan pa'i shes pa dang yod pa 'ga' zhig mngon sum gyi yul du gyur pa dang / 'ga' zhig khong du chud pa yang ma yin te /
translated: Moreover, ‚Äúnot distant‚Äù means ‚Äúdesired to be contacted.‚Äù Therefore, there is no cognition other than the non-deficient direct perception of a person that is the object of direct perception, and there is nothing that is understood.

original: 'ga' zhig ni rjes su dpag pa'i yul la 'ga' zhig ni mngon sum dang 'ga' zhig ni lung las yin no //
analyzed: 'ga' zhig ni rjes su dpag pa'i yul la 'ga' zhig ni mngon sum dang 'ga' zhig ni lung las yin no //
translated: Some are the objects of inference, some are direct perceptions, and some are from scripture.

original: yang ci de dag thams cad srid par mi 'gyur ram zhe na /
analyzed: yang ci de dag thams cad srid par mi 'gyur ram zhe na /
translated: Again, do all of these not exist?

original: khyad par med pa de nyid la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: khyad par med pa de nyid la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says ‚Äúwithout distinction, in reality,‚Äù etc.

original: byas pa'i rnam pa'i bye brag 'di dang khyad par med pa'i don 'gal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: byas pa'i rnam pa'i bye brag 'di dang khyad par med pa'i don 'gal bar 'gyur te /
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúwithout distinction‚Äù would be contradictory, because it is a particular aspect of the produced.

original: 'di gzhan dag na re /
analyzed: 'di gzhan dag na re /
translated: Others say this:

original: gal te khyad par med pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: gal te khyad par med pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: If ‚Äúwithout distinction‚Äù means, etc.

original: gcig la khyad par du byed pa dgag pa 'am /
analyzed: gcig la khyad par du byed pa dgag pa 'am /
translated: It is the negation of distinction in one thing, or

original: gal te gzhan zhig rkyen de'i tha snyad tha dad par 'gyur ro zhe'o //
analyzed: gal te gzhan zhig rkyen de'i tha snyad tha dad par 'gyur ro zhe'o //
translated: If it were different, the condition would be a different convention.

original: grub pa'i mtha' smra bas /
analyzed: grub pa'i mtha' smra bas /
translated: The proponent of tenets says:

original: khyad par de'i bdag nyid du gyur pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /üîΩde'i khyad par ni de'i bdag nyid du gyur ba'am ci gzhan du gyur pa zhig yin na /
analyzed: khyad par de'i bdag nyid du gyur pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te / de'i khyad par ni de'i bdag nyid du gyur ba'am ci gzhan du gyur pa zhig yin na /
translated: That which is the nature of that distinction and so on.üîΩIf it is the nature of that, or if it is different,

original: bdag nyid du gyur pa zhig yin bdag nyid du gyur na /
analyzed: bdag nyid du gyur pa zhig yin bdag nyid du gyur na /
translated: if it is the nature of that,

original: rjes su 'gro ba ma yin pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i skyon smos so //
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba ma yin pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i skyon smos so //
translated: the error of not being concomitant and so on is stated.

original: de'i ldog pa'i khyad par ni ma lus pa ldog par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i ldog pa'i khyad par ni ma lus pa ldog par 'gyur ro //
translated: The distinction of the opposite of that is the complete opposite.

original: 'jug pa yin na yang snga ma de nyid las skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'jug pa yin na yang snga ma de nyid las skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Even if it is engaged, it would arise from that previous one itself.

original: de lta na de ni bde ba dang sdug bsngal bzhin du ji ltar rang bzhin tha dad par mi rtogs /
analyzed: de lta na de ni bde ba dang sdug bsngal bzhin du ji ltar rang bzhin tha dad par mi rtogs /
translated: In that case, how is it not realized that it is a different nature, like pleasure and pain?

original: de ltar ni 'gyur na rjes su 'gro ba dang bcas pa nyid 'jug pa dang ldog par 'gyur ba yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de ltar ni 'gyur na rjes su 'gro ba dang bcas pa nyid 'jug pa dang ldog par 'gyur ba yin no zhe na /
translated: If it were like that, it would be engaged and opposite while having concomitance.

original: rjes su 'gro ba dang bcas pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba dang bcas pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: ‚ÄúIf you say that the qualifier is ‚Äòaccompanied by that which follows,‚Äô etc.

original: gal te rjes su 'gro ba dang bcas pa nyid kyi khyad par du khas blangs pa yang nyams pa yin te /
analyzed: gal te rjes su 'gro ba dang bcas pa nyid kyi khyad par du khas blangs pa yang nyams pa yin te /
translated: If you accept that the qualifier is ‚Äòaccompanied by that which follows,‚Äô then your thesis is undermined.

original: de lta na su zhig ci 'jug pa dang ldog pa yin zhes brjod par 'gyur ram /
analyzed: de lta na su zhig ci 'jug pa dang ldog pa yin zhes brjod par 'gyur ram /
translated: For in that case, what is it that engages and disengages?

original: de dag gi rjes su 'gro ba rtogs pa yang med pa de'i phyir 'di ni ci @171b yang ma yin no //
analyzed: de dag gi rjes su 'gro ba rtogs pa yang med pa de'i phyir 'di ni ci @171b yang ma yin no //
translated: And since there is no apprehension of that which follows, this is nothing at all.

original: yang na gzhan du gyur pa'i khyad par yin pa de'i tshe 'brel pa med pas 'di ni khyad par yin no zhes sgra med pa 'di'i phyogs kyang rags pa'i phyir nye bar dgod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: yang na gzhan du gyur pa'i khyad par yin pa de'i tshe 'brel pa med pas 'di ni khyad par yin no zhes sgra med pa 'di'i phyogs kyang rags pa'i phyir nye bar dgod pa ma yin no //
translated: Or if the qualifier is ‚Äòtransformed,‚Äô then since there is no relation, it is not tenable to posit this as a qualifier, since this position of yours is as incoherent as the statement ‚Äòsound is inaudible.‚Äô

original: gzhan dag gi 'dod pa rang nyid kyi 'dod pa tha mi dad par bstan pa /
analyzed: gzhan dag gi 'dod pa rang nyid kyi 'dod pa tha mi dad par bstan pa /
translated: The explanation that the assertions of others are not different from our own

original: gzhan yang 'di ltar rang bzhin 'ga' zhig ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gzhan yang 'di ltar rang bzhin 'ga' zhig ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Moreover, if you say that some nature, etc.

original: gal te khyed kyang don 'ga' zhig la 'jug pa dang / ldog par 'dod na de kho bo cag gi 'dod pa 'di ci ste khyed khas len par mi byed /
analyzed: gal te khyed kyang don 'ga' zhig la 'jug pa dang / ldog par 'dod na de kho bo cag gi 'dod pa 'di ci ste khyed khas len par mi byed /
translated: If you also accept that something is engaged in or disengaged from something, then why do you not accept this assertion of ours?

original: rjes su bkag pa'i rgyu gzhan med pa ma yin no snyam nas /
analyzed: rjes su bkag pa'i rgyu gzhan med pa ma yin no snyam nas /
translated: It is not that there is no other reason for the refutation of following.

original: gal te rjes su 'gro ba med pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gal te rjes su 'gro ba med pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: If you think that, then ‚ÄúIf there is no following‚Äù and so on is stated.

original: sangs rgyas pa yang rjes su 'gro ba med pa'i skye ba dang 'jig pa 'dod pa yin no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas pa yang rjes su 'gro ba med pa'i skye ba dang 'jig pa 'dod pa yin no //
translated: Buddhists also assert that arising and disintegration are without following.

original: sangs rgyas pas smras pa /
analyzed: sangs rgyas pas smras pa /
translated: The Buddhist says:

original: rjes su 'gro ba zhes bya ba gang yin zhes bya ba ni rang gi ngo bo brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba zhes bya ba gang yin zhes bya ba ni rang gi ngo bo brjod par bya'o //
translated: What is called ‚Äúfollowing‚Äù?

original: gzhan gyis smras pa /
analyzed: gzhan gyis smras pa /
translated: The other says:

original: gal te yod pa'i skye ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni skye ba'am rigs par nyams su myong ba ni yod pa'i nus pa'i ngo bo'i gnas skabs ni rjes su 'gro ba yin no //
analyzed: gal te yod pa'i skye ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni skye ba'am rigs par nyams su myong ba ni yod pa'i nus pa'i ngo bo'i gnas skabs ni rjes su 'gro ba yin no //
translated: If there is arising of an existent and so on, then the experience of arising or disintegration is the state of the essence of the capacity of an existent, which is following.

original: de ltar ni 'gyur na de'i yang skye ba yin no zhen //
analyzed: de ltar ni 'gyur na de'i yang skye ba yin no zhen //
translated: If it were like that, then its arising would also be like that.

original: gal te yod pa'i skye ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gal te yod pa'i skye ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: If you say that the arising of an existent is the arising of something that already exists, etc.

original: skye ba ni sngar yod pa yin no //
analyzed: skye ba ni sngar yod pa yin no //
translated: Arising is something that already exists.

original: 'gal ba yang sngar gnas pa ma yin pa de'i phyir skye ba ni de'i thams cad du skye ba yang ma yin la 'jig pa ni ma lus par 'jig pa yin no //
analyzed: 'gal ba yang sngar gnas pa ma yin pa de'i phyir skye ba ni de'i thams cad du skye ba yang ma yin la 'jig pa ni ma lus par 'jig pa yin no //
translated: And that which is contradictory does not exist previously. Therefore, arising is not the arising of everything, and destruction is not the complete destruction of everything.üîΩAnd we do not see any other capacity that is different.

original: nus pa tha dad pa gzhan yang ma mthong ngo zhes bstan bcos byed pas smras pa ni /
analyzed: nus pa tha dad pa gzhan yang ma mthong ngo zhes bstan bcos byed pas smras pa ni /
translated: The treatise author states:

original: gal te rnam pa thams cad du zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni /
analyzed: gal te rnam pa thams cad du zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni /
translated: If you say that the arising of an existent is the arising of something that already exists, etc.

original: gal te nus pa thams cad du phul du dbyung du med pa de lta na phul du dbyung ba ni gzhan skye ba dang 'jig pa'i tha snyad du byed pa'i rgyu mtshan yin no //
analyzed: gal te nus pa thams cad du phul du dbyung du med pa de lta na phul du dbyung ba ni gzhan skye ba dang 'jig pa'i tha snyad du byed pa'i rgyu mtshan yin no //
translated: If the capacity is not enhanced in any way, then enhancement is the reason for the convention of arising and destruction.

original: gzhan gyi tha snyad du byed pa'i rgyu mtshan ni gal te gnas skabs zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gzhan gyi tha snyad du byed pa'i rgyu mtshan ni gal te gnas skabs zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The reason for the convention of another is if you say that a state, etc.

original: gnas skabs de ni khyad par du byed pa de'i phyir tha snyad grub pa yin no //
analyzed: gnas skabs de ni khyad par du byed pa de'i phyir tha snyad grub pa yin no //
translated: That state is distinguished, and therefore the convention is established.

original: bstan bcos byed pas smras pa /
analyzed: bstan bcos byed pas smras pa /
translated: The author of the treatise replies:

original: gnas skabs de zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni rnam pa gzhan srid pa yin na nus pa'i gnas skabs yin pas de'i phyir gzhan la dris pa yin no //
analyzed: gnas skabs de zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni rnam pa gzhan srid pa yin na nus pa'i gnas skabs yin pas de'i phyir gzhan la dris pa yin no //
translated: If there is another aspect, it is the state of potentiality. Therefore, he asks another question.

original: de kho na nyid kyi phyogs la skyon bstan pa ni gcig yin na ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /üîΩgang gi @172a * //
analyzed: de kho na nyid kyi phyogs la skyon bstan pa ni gcig yin na ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te / gang gi @172a * //
translated: The fault in the position of reality is stated with ‚ÄúIf it is one, etc.‚Äù

original: tshe nus pa'i gnas skabs gcig yin na de'i tshe ji ltar 'di gcig gi bdag nyid cha shas med par grub pa phan tshun 'gal ba mthong ste /
analyzed: tshe nus pa'i gnas skabs gcig yin na de'i tshe ji ltar 'di gcig gi bdag nyid cha shas med par grub pa phan tshun 'gal ba mthong ste /
translated: When the state of potentiality is one, then how is this established as one entity without parts, since mutually contradictory things are seen?

original: 'di lta ste skye ba dang mi skye ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'di lta ste skye ba dang mi skye ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: For example, arising and non-arising, etc.

original: grub pa zhes bya ba ni cig car du'o //
analyzed: grub pa zhes bya ba ni cig car du'o //
translated: ‚ÄúEstablished‚Äù means simultaneously.

original: 'di phan tshun du gal te gnas skabs dang nus pa'i dbye ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: 'di phan tshun du gal te gnas skabs dang nus pa'i dbye ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: This is mutually contradictory. If there is a distinction in state and potentiality, etc.,

original: yod pa'i dbye ba ni 'di lta ste nus pa dang zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: yod pa'i dbye ba ni 'di lta ste nus pa dang zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: The distinction in existence is like this: potentiality, etc.

original: gnas skabs zhes bya ba ni de'i phyir skye ba dang mi skye ba la sogs pa dbye ba zhes bya ba cung zad cig tsam gyis rnam pa tha dad pa yin no //
analyzed: gnas skabs zhes bya ba ni de'i phyir skye ba dang mi skye ba la sogs pa dbye ba zhes bya ba cung zad cig tsam gyis rnam pa tha dad pa yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúThe state‚Äù is the reason. ‚ÄúThe distinction of arising and non-arising, etc.‚Äù is the slight difference in the mode.

original: gzhan gyi ltag chod yin pa bstan pa'i phyir brjed ngas pa'i dang tshul can zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gzhan gyi ltag chod yin pa bstan pa'i phyir brjed ngas pa'i dang tshul can zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: In order to demonstrate that this is a mere quibble, he says, ‚ÄúThe one who is forgetful, etc.‚Äù

original: gnas skabs su yod pa mi dran pa'o //
analyzed: gnas skabs su yod pa mi dran pa'o //
translated: He is forgetful of the state that exists.

original: 'o na ni nus pa'i gnas skabs rnam par dbye ba med pa'i phyogs 'di la 'gal bas gnod pa yin no //
analyzed: 'o na ni nus pa'i gnas skabs rnam par dbye ba med pa'i phyogs 'di la 'gal bas gnod pa yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúBut in this system where the state of potentiality is undifferentiated, there is contradiction and invalidation.‚Äù

original: 'o na te nyes pa 'dir mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'o na te nyes pa 'dir mi 'gyur te /
translated: ‚ÄúBut if this fault does not occur,

original: gzhan khas blangs pa'i phyir ro snyam nas gzhan gyis smras pa /
analyzed: gzhan khas blangs pa'i phyir ro snyam nas gzhan gyis smras pa /
translated: because of the acceptance of something else, then the opponent says:

original: 'on te rnam par dbye ba med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gang gi tshe nus pa'i gnas skabs gang dag tha dad pa khas blangs pa de'i tshe 'gal ba 'ga' zhig kyang med do //
analyzed: 'on te rnam par dbye ba med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gang gi tshe nus pa'i gnas skabs gang dag tha dad pa khas blangs pa de'i tshe 'gal ba 'ga' zhig kyang med do //
translated: If the state of potentiality is accepted as undifferentiated, then there is no contradiction at all.‚Äù

original: skye ba dang mi skye ba la sogs pa tha dad pa'i don gyi yul yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skye ba dang mi skye ba la sogs pa tha dad pa'i don gyi yul yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the object is a different thing, such as arising or non-arising.

original: 'on kyang khyed la skye ba dang 'jig pa'i mtshams sbyor ba grub pa yin te /
analyzed: 'on kyang khyed la skye ba dang 'jig pa'i mtshams sbyor ba grub pa yin te /
translated: However, for you, the connection between arising and destruction is established.

original: rgyu mtshan ci yin zhe na /
analyzed: rgyu mtshan ci yin zhe na /
translated: What is the reason?

original: gang gi phyir rang gi rjes su 'gro ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir rang gi rjes su 'gro ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says, ‚Äúbecause there is no connection with the capacity for the states of arising and destruction,‚Äù and so on.

original: skye ba dang 'jig pa'i gnas skabs kyi mtshams sbyor ba'i nus pa'i rjes su 'gro ba ni med de /
analyzed: skye ba dang 'jig pa'i gnas skabs kyi mtshams sbyor ba'i nus pa'i rjes su 'gro ba ni med de /
translated: There is no connection with the capacity for the states of arising and destruction.

original: de'i skye ba dang 'jig pa ni med do //
analyzed: de'i skye ba dang 'jig pa ni med do //
translated: Because there is no arising and destruction of that.

original: pha rol pos gzhan yang smras pa /
analyzed: pha rol pos gzhan yang smras pa /
translated: Again, the opponent says,

original: gal te de dag la tha dad pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni nus pa dang gsal ba dag phan tshun tha dad pa med pa'i phyir nyes pa 'di ni med do //
analyzed: gal te de dag la tha dad pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni nus pa dang gsal ba dag phan tshun tha dad pa med pa'i phyir nyes pa 'di ni med do //
translated: ‚ÄúIf they are different,‚Äù and so on. Because capacity and manifestation are not mutually different, this fault does not exist.üîΩThe capacity to produce this is simultaneous.

original: 'di byed pa'i nus pa ni cig car ae ma'o lan skyon med ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: 'di byed pa'i nus pa ni cig car ae ma'o lan skyon med ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: ‚ÄúOh, the fault is removed,‚Äù and so on.

original: lan 'di ni skyon dka' zhing rang gi phyogs la mngon par zhen pas na rab tu chags par gyur pas tshod kyang mi shes pa yin no //
analyzed: lan 'di ni skyon dka' zhing rang gi phyogs la mngon par zhen pas na rab tu chags par gyur pas tshod kyang mi shes pa yin no //
translated: This reply is difficult to fault, since it is extremely attached to its own position, and so it does not know the proper measure.

original: 'dir dgos pa ci yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'dir dgos pa ci yin zhe na /
translated: What is the purpose here?

original: tha dad pa med pa la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: tha dad pa med pa la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says, ‚ÄúIf there is no difference, etc.‚Äù

original: tha mi dad pa zhes bya ba ni gcig par bshad pa yin @172b no ;
analyzed: tha mi dad pa zhes bya ba ni gcig par bshad pa yin @172b no ;
translated: ‚ÄúNon-difference‚Äù is explained as ‚Äúsameness.‚Äù

original: / khyed ces bya ba ni khyed cag yod pa'i tha snyad du byed pa de'i tha dad pa'i rgyu mtshan ni ji ltar mthong ba yin no //
analyzed: / khyed ces bya ba ni khyed cag yod pa'i tha snyad du byed pa de'i tha dad pa'i rgyu mtshan ni ji ltar mthong ba yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúYou‚Äù refers to those who make the convention of existence. The reason for the difference is just as it is seen.

original: ldog pa'am mi ldog pa'am skye ba 'am mi skye ba ma yin pa de lta bu la sogs pa ci du ma dang 'brel pa yin nam //
analyzed: ldog pa'am mi ldog pa'am skye ba 'am mi skye ba ma yin pa de lta bu la sogs pa ci du ma dang 'brel pa yin nam //
translated: Is it related to many things, such as non-cessation, non-non-cessation, non-arising, and non-non-arising?

original: yod pa'i tha snyad ji ltar mthong ba yin //
analyzed: yod pa'i tha snyad ji ltar mthong ba yin //
translated: How is the convention of existence just as it is seen?

original: gal te nus pa'i gnas skabs tha mi dad pa 'dod pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te nus pa'i gnas skabs tha mi dad pa 'dod pa yin no zhe na /
translated: If you assert that the non-difference is the state of potentiality,

original: yod do zhes bya ba ni don dam pa yin la brtags pa ni bla ste sel ba ma yin no //
analyzed: yod do zhes bya ba ni don dam pa yin la brtags pa ni bla ste sel ba ma yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúIt exists‚Äù is the ultimate, and the imagined is not the exclusion of other.

original: tha dad pa dang tha mi dad pa mthong ba yin te /
analyzed: tha dad pa dang tha mi dad pa mthong ba yin te /
translated: They are seen to be different and not different.

original: de dag ni dngos po rnams kyi tha dad pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de dag ni dngos po rnams kyi tha dad pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says, ‚ÄúThose things that are called different, etc.‚Äù

original: ldog pa dang ldog pa med pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ldog pa dang ldog pa med pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: They are called ‚Äúexcluded‚Äù and ‚Äúnot excluded.‚Äù

original: de lta na yang gang ldog pa dang skye ba dang skye ba med pa dang gnas pa dang / gnas pa med pa de dang de ni tha dad pa yin te dper na bde ba dang sdug bsngal lta bu'o //
analyzed: de lta na yang gang ldog pa dang skye ba dang skye ba med pa dang gnas pa dang / gnas pa med pa de dang de ni tha dad pa yin te dper na bde ba dang sdug bsngal lta bu'o //
translated: Even so, that which is excluded and that which is not excluded, that which arises and that which does not arise, that which endures and that which does not endure, are different, like pleasure and pain.

original: de dang bral ba zhes bya ba ni gnas pa dang mi gnas pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de dang bral ba zhes bya ba ni gnas pa dang mi gnas pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúFree from that‚Äù refers to endurance and non-endurance, etc.

original: de ni tha mi dad pa'i mtshan nyid nus pa'i gnas skabs kyi bdag nyid gcig pa ni gang gi tshe nus pa dang gsal ba gcig gi bdag nyid du 'dod na de'i tshe 'di dag dpe yin no //
analyzed: de ni tha mi dad pa'i mtshan nyid nus pa'i gnas skabs kyi bdag nyid gcig pa ni gang gi tshe nus pa dang gsal ba gcig gi bdag nyid du 'dod na de'i tshe 'di dag dpe yin no //
translated: The characteristic of non-difference is the single nature of the state of potentiality. When potentiality and manifestation are asserted to be the same nature, then these are examples.

original: tha dad pa dang tha mi dad pa'i rgyu mtshan can la 'dir tha dad pa dang tha mi dad pa'i sgras bshad kyi 'di dag tha dad pa dang tha mi dad pa'i mtshan nyid du mi 'gyur na nus pa ci yod ce na /
analyzed: tha dad pa dang tha mi dad pa'i rgyu mtshan can la 'dir tha dad pa dang tha mi dad pa'i sgras bshad kyi 'di dag tha dad pa dang tha mi dad pa'i mtshan nyid du mi 'gyur na nus pa ci yod ce na /
translated: If the reasons for difference and non-difference are not the characteristics of difference and non-difference, what is their ability?

original: rnam pa gzhan du na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan du na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: In response, he says, ‚ÄúOtherwise, etc.‚Äù

original: gal te 'di dag gi mtshan nyid mi 'dod na de'i tshe dngos po tha dad pa dang tha mi dad par rnam par gzhag par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te 'di dag gi mtshan nyid mi 'dod na de'i tshe dngos po tha dad pa dang tha mi dad par rnam par gzhag par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If the characteristics of these are not accepted, then things would not be established as different or non-different.

original: gzhan gyis rang la grags pa'i tha dad pa dang tha mi dad pa'i mtshan nyid bstan pa /
analyzed: gzhan gyis rang la grags pa'i tha dad pa dang tha mi dad pa'i mtshan nyid bstan pa /
translated: The other party teaches the characteristics of difference and non-difference that are accepted by himself.

original: thams cad bdag nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: thams cad bdag nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says, ‚ÄúEverything, etc.‚Äù

original: yang gang gi tshe thams cad kyi bdag nyid du gyur pa de'i tshe de ni tha dad pa ma yin no //
analyzed: yang gang gi tshe thams cad kyi bdag nyid du gyur pa de'i tshe de ni tha dad pa ma yin no //
translated: When something becomes the nature of everything, then it is not different.

original: gang yang gang las gzhan du gyur pa de yang de las tha dad pa yin no //
analyzed: gang yang gang las gzhan du gyur pa de yang de las tha dad pa yin no //
translated: And that which is different from something is also different from it.

original: dpe ni dper na bum pa ni 'jim pa'i bdag nyid las zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: dpe ni dper na bum pa ni 'jim pa'i bdag nyid las zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The example is stated: ‚ÄúFor example, a pot is not from the nature of clay, etc.‚Äù

original: bum pa skye ba yang thams cad du sa'i bdag nyid yin te /
analyzed: bum pa skye ba yang thams cad du sa'i bdag nyid yin te /
translated: The arising of a pot is not from the nature of earth in every way,

original: de yang sa las tha dad du bya ba med do //
analyzed: de yang sa las tha dad du bya ba med do //
translated: and it is not to be made different from earth.

original: bde ba dang sdug bsngal ba dag kyang phan tshun du yod pa'i bdag nyid ma yin te /üîΩde dang de ni tha dad pas 'dir kho bo cag kyang tha dad pa dang tha mi @173a * //
analyzed: bde ba dang sdug bsngal ba dag kyang phan tshun du yod pa'i bdag nyid ma yin te / de dang de ni tha dad pas 'dir kho bo cag kyang tha dad pa dang tha mi @173a * //
translated: Pleasure and pain also do not have the nature of existing mutually,üîΩand they are not to be made different from each other.üîΩHere, we also assert the nature of being different and not different. Therefore, there is no contradiction.

original: dad pa'i bdag nyid du 'dod pa des na 'ga' zhig 'gal bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni phyogs snga ma'o //
analyzed: dad pa'i bdag nyid du 'dod pa des na 'ga' zhig 'gal bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni phyogs snga ma'o //
translated: This is the opponent‚Äôs position.

original: grub pa'i mtha' smra bas /üîΩbum pa'i rab tu skye ba ni 'jim pa'i bdag nyid ma yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: grub pa'i mtha' smra bas / bum pa'i rab tu skye ba ni 'jim pa'i bdag nyid ma yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The Proponents of the Tenets of the Sa·πÉmitƒ´yas say:üîΩThe arising of a pot is not from the nature of clay, etc.

original: bum pa ni phan tshun du sa'i bdag nyid ma yin gyi 'ga' tsam yin no //
analyzed: bum pa ni phan tshun du sa'i bdag nyid ma yin gyi 'ga' tsam yin no //
translated: A pot is not from the nature of earth in every way, but it is from a mere part of earth.

original: 'on kyang sa'i khyad par 'ga' sa chu 'dzin pa la sogs pa'i dbyibs kyi rnam pa la bum pa zhes grags pa thob pa yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang sa'i khyad par 'ga' sa chu 'dzin pa la sogs pa'i dbyibs kyi rnam pa la bum pa zhes grags pa thob pa yin no //
translated: However, some difference in the earth is obtained in the shape of the pot, which holds water, etc.

original: de ltar ni 'gyur nas las khyad par 'ga' zhig yod pa ma yin no zhe na 'jig rten gsum gyi 'jim pa'i bdag nyid gcig pa ma yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de ltar ni 'gyur nas las khyad par 'ga' zhig yod pa ma yin no zhe na 'jig rten gsum gyi 'jim pa'i bdag nyid gcig pa ma yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: If it is said that there is no difference in the action, it is said that the clay of the three worlds is not of one nature, etc.

original: kye 'jig rten gsum gyi 'ji ba'i bdag nyid du gcig pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ga las shes shen /
analyzed: kye 'jig rten gsum gyi 'ji ba'i bdag nyid du gcig pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ga las shes shen /
translated: Why is it said, O! The clay of the three worlds is not of one nature?

original: rnam par rig pa so sor snang ba tha dad pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: rnam par rig pa so sor snang ba tha dad pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: It is said, Because of the appearance of different cognitions, etc.

original: de lta na rnam par shes pa ni rnam par shes pa'i so sor snang ba tha dad pas sa'i rang bzhin tha dad par blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: de lta na rnam par shes pa ni rnam par shes pa'i so sor snang ba tha dad pas sa'i rang bzhin tha dad par blta bar bya ste /
translated: Thus, consciousness should be seen as having a different nature due to the difference in the appearance of consciousness.

original: de lta na sa'i rang bzhin phye mar gnas pa las gzhan gyi rnam pa so sor snang ba ni rtags kyi rnam pa dang / mchod rten gyi rnam pa dang / gdugs kyi rnam pa dang / brten pa'i rnam pa'i ngo bo ni gzhan gyi rnam pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta na sa'i rang bzhin phye mar gnas pa las gzhan gyi rnam pa so sor snang ba ni rtags kyi rnam pa dang / mchod rten gyi rnam pa dang / gdugs kyi rnam pa dang / brten pa'i rnam pa'i ngo bo ni gzhan gyi rnam pa yin no //
translated: Thus, the form of the other, which is different from the nature of the earth, is the form of the sign, the form of the stupa, the form of the parasol, and the form of the support.

original: de bzhin du gnas skabs ni so sor gnas pa'i rang bzhin tha dad par khas blang bar bya ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du gnas skabs ni so sor gnas pa'i rang bzhin tha dad par khas blang bar bya ste /
translated: Similarly, the state should be accepted as having a different nature in each case.

original: de lta na ma tshos pa'i sa las gzhan pa nus pa dang smin pa dang / tshos pa yang gzhan de'i don byed pa tha dad pa dang don byed pa tha dad pa yang so so'i rang bzhin tha dad par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: de lta na ma tshos pa'i sa las gzhan pa nus pa dang smin pa dang / tshos pa yang gzhan de'i don byed pa tha dad pa dang don byed pa tha dad pa yang so so'i rang bzhin tha dad par blta bar bya'o //
translated: Thus, the uncooked earth is different from the cooked earth in its capacity and ripening, and the cooked earth is different from the uncooked earth in its function. The difference in function is seen as the difference in individual natures.

original: de lta nas sa'i phye ma las gzhan 'bras bu'i bya ba byed pa rtags kyi rnam pa la sogs pa'i gzugs gzhan nyid kyi don bya ba byed pa la sogs pa tha dad pa'i sa thams cad ni tha dad pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta nas sa'i phye ma las gzhan 'bras bu'i bya ba byed pa rtags kyi rnam pa la sogs pa'i gzugs gzhan nyid kyi don bya ba byed pa la sogs pa tha dad pa'i sa thams cad ni tha dad pa yin no //
translated: Thus, the form of the other, which is different from the form of the earth particles, is the form of the sign, etc., which performs the function of the result. All the different earths perform different functions, such as the function of the result.

original: gzhan gyis kyang 'di dag de lta bu'i rgyu yin no snyam nas /
analyzed: gzhan gyis kyang 'di dag de lta bu'i rgyu yin no snyam nas /
translated: Others think that these are the causes of that.

original: gal te bden mod kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin no //
analyzed: gal te bden mod kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin no //
translated: If that is so, etc.

original: gzhan yang sems can bde ba la sogs pa'i rnam pa tha dad pa nyid 'thad pa yin te /
analyzed: gzhan yang sems can bde ba la sogs pa'i rnam pa tha dad pa nyid 'thad pa yin te /
translated: Moreover, the difference in the aspects of pleasure, etc. of sentient beings is tenable.

original: gal te don byed pa tha dad pa la sogs pa tha dad par khas blang bar bya ste /
analyzed: gal te don byed pa tha dad pa la sogs pa tha dad par khas blang bar bya ste /
translated: If the difference in the performance of function, etc. is accepted as different,

original: nus pa tha dad pa med par gzhan gyis de ni bden mod kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: nus pa tha dad pa med par gzhan gyis de ni bden mod kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: without the difference in capacity, the opponent says, that is so, etc.

original: gal te yang don byed pa la sogs pa tha dad pa de lta na yang 'ga' zhig pa'i rang @173b bzhin ni sa'i bdag nyid kyi rjes su 'gro ba des na tha mi dad pa 'dod pa yin no //
analyzed: gal te yang don byed pa la sogs pa tha dad pa de lta na yang 'ga' zhig pa'i rang @173b bzhin ni sa'i bdag nyid kyi rjes su 'gro ba des na tha mi dad pa 'dod pa yin no //
translated: Even if the difference in the performance of function, etc. is like that, still, the nature of some is the same, since it is the same in the case of earth, etc. Therefore, non-difference is accepted.

original: bstan bcos pa las thal bar 'gyur bar brjod pa ni /
analyzed: bstan bcos pa las thal bar 'gyur bar brjod pa ni /
translated: The treatise author states the consequence:

original: bde ba la sogs pa dag dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: bde ba la sogs pa dag dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: If pleasure, etc. are different, etc.

original: bde ba la sogs pa'i yon tan dang ldan pa nyid dang / byed pa po nyid dang za ba po nyid la sogs pa rnams ni de'i phyir de dag kyang phan tshun de dag gcig tu thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bde ba la sogs pa'i yon tan dang ldan pa nyid dang / byed pa po nyid dang za ba po nyid la sogs pa rnams ni de'i phyir de dag kyang phan tshun de dag gcig tu thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: and the possession of the qualities of pleasure, etc., and the status of agent, experiencer, etc., would also be mutually identical.

original: de lta na yang sems can ni gang yang za ba po dang byed pa po dang / yon tan can la sogs pa rnams rjes su rtogs pa de dang de dag kyang thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta na yang sems can ni gang yang za ba po dang byed pa po dang / yon tan can la sogs pa rnams rjes su rtogs pa de dang de dag kyang thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: And even so, the sentient being would be understood as the experiencer, agent, possessor of qualities, etc., and those would also be identical.

original: 'di ni bde ba la sogs pa'ang gzhal bya nyid dang yod pa dang / shes bya nyid la sogs pa rnams rjes su rtogs pa de'i phyir de dag kyang gcig tu bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni bde ba la sogs pa'ang gzhal bya nyid dang yod pa dang / shes bya nyid la sogs pa rnams rjes su rtogs pa de'i phyir de dag kyang gcig tu bstan pa yin no //
translated: And in the same way, pleasure, etc., would be understood as the object of cognition, as existent, as the object of knowledge, etc., and those would also be identical.

original: de ltar ni 'gyur na bde ba la sogs pa ma yin pa rnams bdag nyid thams cad kyi rjes su 'gro ba de dang de dag tha mi dad pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de ltar ni 'gyur na bde ba la sogs pa ma yin pa rnams bdag nyid thams cad kyi rjes su 'gro ba de dang de dag tha mi dad pa yin no zhe na /
translated: If that were so, then those that are not pleasure, etc., would be non-different from that which is all-pervasive.

original: bum pa la sogs pa dag kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: bum pa la sogs pa dag kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says, ‚ÄúEven a pot, etc.,‚Äù and so on.

original: bum pa la sogs pa rnams kyang bdag nyid thams cad kyi rjes su 'gro pa ma yin pa de dag ji ltar tha mi dad par 'dod do //
analyzed: bum pa la sogs pa rnams kyang bdag nyid thams cad kyi rjes su 'gro pa ma yin pa de dag ji ltar tha mi dad par 'dod do //
translated: Also, pots and so on are not omnipresent, so how can they be asserted to be nondifferent?

original: de dag bdag nyid thams cad kyi rjes su 'gro ba ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di las shes she na /
analyzed: de dag bdag nyid thams cad kyi rjes su 'gro ba ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di las shes she na /
translated: How is it known that they are not omnipresent?

original: rang bzhin sna tshogs pa lhan cig ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: rang bzhin sna tshogs pa lhan cig ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The response is ‚ÄúThe various natures are simultaneous, etc.‚Äù

original: gal te de dag bdag nyid thams cad kyi rjes su 'gro bar 'gyur na ni de'i tshe 'di dag dngos po rnams kyi ro dang nus pa dang smin pa la sogs pa'i nus pa so sor snang ba'i sna tshogs pa rnams du ma gang yin pa der mi
analyzed: gal te de dag bdag nyid thams cad kyi rjes su 'gro bar 'gyur na ni de'i tshe 'di dag dngos po rnams kyi ro dang nus pa dang smin pa la sogs pa'i nus pa so sor snang ba'i sna tshogs pa rnams du ma gang yin pa der mi
translated: If they were omnipresent, then the various appearances of the capacities of things, such as taste, potency, ripening, and so on, would not be multiple.

original: 'gyur ro // lhan cig skye ba dang 'gag pa la sogs pa yang thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'gyur ro // lhan cig skye ba dang 'gag pa la sogs pa yang thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Also, arising and ceasing simultaneously would follow.

original: nye bar bsags pa'i rgyu bstan pa ni /
analyzed: nye bar bsags pa'i rgyu bstan pa ni /
translated: The cause of their aggregation is taught:

original: bum pa dang 'jim pa'i bdag nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: bum pa dang 'jim pa'i bdag nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: ‚ÄúThe nature of the pot and clay, etc.‚Äù

original: 'ga' zhig bum pa'i sa'i bdag nyid kyang tha dad par nye bar mtshon pa med de /
analyzed: 'ga' zhig bum pa'i sa'i bdag nyid kyang tha dad par nye bar mtshon pa med de /
translated: Some say: The identity of the earth element in a vase is not separately indicated.

original: bum pa 'di dang sa yin no zhes gang gis de ltar khong du chud par 'gyur //
analyzed: bum pa 'di dang sa yin no zhes gang gis de ltar khong du chud par 'gyur //
translated: How could one understand that this is a vase and this is earth?

original: de'i sa las bum pa 'di skye ba yin zhes bya /
analyzed: de'i sa las bum pa 'di skye ba yin zhes bya /
translated: This vase arises from that earth.

original: de ni de ltar ni 'gyur na tha dad pa nye bar mtshon pa med na rten dang brten pa khong du chud par 'gyur ba yin no zhe na rten dang brten pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de ni de ltar ni 'gyur na tha dad pa nye bar mtshon pa med na rten dang brten pa khong du chud par 'gyur ba yin no zhe na rten dang brten pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: If it were like that, then if the difference is not indicated, the support and the supported would be understood.

original: rten dang brten pa gang ji snyed pa rtogs par mi 'gyur ba de snyed du 'di dang 'di nus par khong du chud pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rten dang brten pa gang ji snyed pa rtogs par mi 'gyur ba de snyed du 'di dang 'di nus par khong du chud pa ma yin no //
translated: As many supports and supported are not understood, that many are not understood to be able to be this and that.

original: gang las shin tu 'das pa ni rtag tu gnas pas rten yin no //
analyzed: gang las shin tu 'das pa ni rtag tu gnas pas rten yin no //
translated: That from which it is completely different is the support because it always abides.

original: de gang la yod pa de la de brten pa ni brten pa'o //
analyzed: de gang la yod pa de la de brten pa ni brten pa'o //
translated: That which has that is the supported because it depends on that.

original: gzhan gyis tha mi dad pa'i mtshan nyid kyis bdag nyid bstan @174a * //
analyzed: gzhan gyis tha mi dad pa'i mtshan nyid kyis bdag nyid bstan @174a * //
translated: The nature of the supported is taught by the characteristic of being different from the other.

original: pa ni / nus pa dang nus pa'i bdag nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: pa ni / nus pa dang nus pa'i bdag nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: ‚ÄúCapable and incapable nature‚Äù and so on.

original: gang gi tshe gang dang gang gi bdag nyid skyed pa de dang de dag tha dad par 'dod pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: gang gi tshe gang dang gang gi bdag nyid skyed pa de dang de dag tha dad par 'dod pa de'i tshe /
translated: When you assert that that which is produced is different from that which produces it,

original: nus pa dang nus pa'i bdag nyid las skye ba'i dngos po rang nyid ma yin pa'i rang gi ngo bo las tha mi dad pa ma yin par 'dod na de'i tshe /
analyzed: nus pa dang nus pa'i bdag nyid las skye ba'i dngos po rang nyid ma yin pa'i rang gi ngo bo las tha mi dad pa ma yin par 'dod na de'i tshe /
translated: then you assert that things produced from a capable and incapable nature are not different from their own nature that is not itself.üîΩIn that case,

original: nus pa dang nus pa'i bdag nyid rab tu skye bar 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: nus pa dang nus pa'i bdag nyid rab tu skye bar 'gyur gyi /
translated: the capable and incapable nature would be produced,

original: rang nyid las ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: rang nyid las ni ma yin gyi /
translated: but not from itself.

original: rang gi ngo bo de tha mi dad pa las mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo de tha mi dad pa las mi 'gyur ro //
translated: It would not be different from its own nature.

original: de yang rang gi ngo bo 'di las tha mi dad pa de'i phyir /
analyzed: de yang rang gi ngo bo 'di las tha mi dad pa de'i phyir /
translated: Moreover, because it is not different from this nature,

original: 'di'i mtshan nyid tha mi dad pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di'i mtshan nyid tha mi dad pa yin no //
translated: it would not be different from its characteristics.

original: de dag gis ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa ni gzhan gyis tha mi dad pa'i mtshan nyid dgag pa 'dis zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de dag gis ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa ni gzhan gyis tha mi dad pa'i mtshan nyid dgag pa 'dis zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúBy those‚Äù and so on means by this refutation of the nondifference of characteristics.

original: de nyid rnam par 'brel ba ni gang yang kun du rtog par 'gyur ba gang dang gang yongs su gyur pa de dang de las zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de nyid rnam par 'brel ba ni gang yang kun du rtog par 'gyur ba gang dang gang yongs su gyur pa de dang de las zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The connection with reality is stated in the passage beginning with ‚Äúwhatever is transformed into anything at all.‚Äù

original: gang yang zhes bya ba ni 'ga' zhig gis 'dir gang dang gang yongs su gyur pa de dang de las tha mi dad pa zhes smas pa tha mi dad pa'i mtshan nyid 'di yang gsal bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: gang yang zhes bya ba ni 'ga' zhig gis 'dir gang dang gang yongs su gyur pa de dang de las tha mi dad pa zhes smas pa tha mi dad pa'i mtshan nyid 'di yang gsal bar rig par bya'o //
translated: ‚Äú Whatever‚Äù means that whatever is transformed into anything at all is not different from that. This characteristic of non-difference should be understood clearly.

original: ji ltar yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar yin zhe na /
translated: How is it?

original: nus pa'i bdag nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: nus pa'i bdag nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The passage beginning with ‚Äúthe nature of potentiality‚Äù explains this.

original: gang gi phyir nus pa'i bdag nyid yongs su gyur pa ma yin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir nus pa'i bdag nyid yongs su gyur pa ma yin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: Because the nature of potentiality is not transformed, it is not different from that.

original: bstan bcos byed pas yongs su gyur pa'i rang gi ngo bo dris pa /
analyzed: bstan bcos byed pas yongs su gyur pa'i rang gi ngo bo dris pa /
translated: The treatise author asks about the nature of transformation:

original: yongs su gyur pa ni zhes bya ba ni ci zhig ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: yongs su gyur pa ni zhes bya ba ni ci zhig ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: ‚ÄúWhat is transformation?‚Äù

original: 'di ni go sla'o //
analyzed: 'di ni go sla'o //
translated: This is easy to understand.

original: gzhan gyis de'i rang gi ngo bo bstan pa ni rdzas kyi gnas skabs zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gzhan gyis de'i rang gi ngo bo bstan pa ni rdzas kyi gnas skabs zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The opponent‚Äôs response to that is stated in the line ‚ÄúThe state of the substance, etc.‚Äù

original: rdzas kyi gnas skabs kyi chos gcig pa ldog pa dang chos gzhan rab tu skye ba ni yongs su gyur pa'i sgrar brjod do //
analyzed: rdzas kyi gnas skabs kyi chos gcig pa ldog pa dang chos gzhan rab tu skye ba ni yongs su gyur pa'i sgrar brjod do //
translated: The single property of the state of the substance is reversed, and the arising of another property is called ‚Äútransformation.‚Äù

original: grub pa'i mtha' smra bas /
analyzed: grub pa'i mtha' smra bas /
translated: The proponent of tenets says,

original: chos gzhan gang yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: chos gzhan gang yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: ‚ÄúWhat is the other property?‚Äù

original: 'di ni chos gang ldog pa dang rab tu skye ba yin na de ni de'i phyir spyi rdzas kyi gnas skabs las gzhan yin nam /
analyzed: 'di ni chos gang ldog pa dang rab tu skye ba yin na de ni de'i phyir spyi rdzas kyi gnas skabs las gzhan yin nam /
translated: If this is the case, then is the universal different from the state of the substance?

original: gnyi ga ni ma yin te rnam par gzhan mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnyi ga ni ma yin te rnam par gzhan mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not both because another mode is not possible.

original: gzhan la yang 'dir brgal zhing brtag pa mtshungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan la yang 'dir brgal zhing brtag pa mtshungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Also, because the same objection and analysis apply to the opponent.

original: gnas skabs gzhan yod kyang nyes pa ci zhig yod ce na /
analyzed: gnas skabs gzhan yod kyang nyes pa ci zhig yod ce na /
translated: If the state is different, what is the problem?

original: gal te de nyid la gnas pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gal te de nyid la gnas pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The response to that is stated in the line ‚ÄúIf it is the same, etc.‚Äù

original: gal te rdzas kyi chos la tha mi dad pa de'i tshe rdzas kyi gnas skabs ldog pa dang rab tu skye ba ni 'thad pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gal te rdzas kyi chos la tha mi dad pa de'i tshe rdzas kyi gnas skabs ldog pa dang rab tu skye ba ni 'thad pa ma yin no //
translated: If it is not different from the substantial entity, then it is not tenable that the state of the substantial entity is reversed and is fully arisen.

original: rdzas kyi chos tha mi dad pa yin no zhes bya ba ni @174b ma grub pa yin no //
analyzed: rdzas kyi chos tha mi dad pa yin no zhes bya ba ni @174b ma grub pa yin no //
translated: That it is not different from the substantial entity is not established.

original: rgyu ci yin zhe na /
analyzed: rgyu ci yin zhe na /
translated: What is the reason?

original: de nyid ltos pa med par zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de nyid ltos pa med par zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says, ‚ÄúIt is not dependent on that,‚Äù and so on.

original: gal te gzhan gyi chos can dang chos yod pa la mi ltos pa yin na tha dad pa la brten par ni mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te gzhan gyi chos can dang chos yod pa la mi ltos pa yin na tha dad pa la brten par ni mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If it is not dependent on the existence of the other, the entity and the attribute, then it would not be based on the difference.

original: ltos par gyur pa ni dper na sgra'i byas pa la sogs pa ni chos gang ma byas pa la sogs pa las ldog pa la ltos pa'i gnas skabs bzhin no //
analyzed: ltos par gyur pa ni dper na sgra'i byas pa la sogs pa ni chos gang ma byas pa la sogs pa las ldog pa la ltos pa'i gnas skabs bzhin no //
translated: That which is dependent, for example, is like the state of the sound‚Äôs impermanence, which is dependent on the opposite of that which is not impermanent.

original: gzhan du khas blangs pa'i skyon bstan pa ni /
analyzed: gzhan du khas blangs pa'i skyon bstan pa ni /
translated: The error of accepting the other is taught:

original: yang na rdzas las don gzhan zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: yang na rdzas las don gzhan zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Or, if it is different from the substance, and so on.

original: gang gi tshe rdzas las tha dad pa'i chos yin pa de'i tshe chos kyi ldog pa dang skye ba rnams kyi yongs su 'gyur bar grub pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gi tshe rdzas las tha dad pa'i chos yin pa de'i tshe chos kyi ldog pa dang skye ba rnams kyi yongs su 'gyur bar grub pa ni ma yin no //
translated: But when it is a quality that is different from the substance, then the reversal of the quality and the arising of the qualities are not established as a transformation.

original: rgyu ci yin zhe na /
analyzed: rgyu ci yin zhe na /
translated: What is the reason?

original: don gzhan du 'gyur ba'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: don gzhan du 'gyur ba'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says, ‚Äúbecause of the transformation into another object, etc.‚Äù

original: gang gi gnas skabs gzhan du gyur ba'i ldog pa dang rab tu skye ba dag ni gnas skabs gzhan gyi yongs su gyur par 'dod pa de lta na ni /
analyzed: gang gi gnas skabs gzhan du gyur ba'i ldog pa dang rab tu skye ba dag ni gnas skabs gzhan gyi yongs su gyur par 'dod pa de lta na ni /
translated: When the reversal and arising of that which is in a certain state is accepted as a transformation into another state,

original: sems pa can la yang yongs su 'gyur bar 'dod par bya'o //
analyzed: sems pa can la yang yongs su 'gyur bar 'dod par bya'o //
translated: then the transformation of a sentient being should also be accepted.

original: gzhan yang rdzas kyi chos zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa 'di ni go sla'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang rdzas kyi chos zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa 'di ni go sla'o //
translated: Moreover, he says, ‚Äúthe quality of a substance, etc.,‚Äù which is easy to understand.

original: ci'i phyir mi 'grub pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir mi 'grub pa yin zhe na /
translated: Why is it not established?

original: 'brel pa med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: 'brel pa med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says, ‚Äúbecause there is no connection,‚Äù etc.

original: rnam pa de lta bu'i sgra la sogs pa'i rgyu mtshan 'ga' zhig dang 'brel pa yod pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rnam pa de lta bu'i sgra la sogs pa'i rgyu mtshan 'ga' zhig dang 'brel pa yod pa ni ma yin no //
translated: There is no connection with any reason for a sound, etc. of that kind.

original: de ltar ni 'gyur na rten dang brten pa'i mtshan nyid kyi 'brel pa yod pa ni ma yin no zhe na rgyu dang 'bras bu'i 'brel pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de ltar ni 'gyur na rten dang brten pa'i mtshan nyid kyi 'brel pa yod pa ni ma yin no zhe na rgyu dang 'bras bu'i 'brel pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: If that were so, there would be no relation of support and supported.üîΩThe response to that is ‚ÄúThere is no relation called cause and effect, etc.‚Äù

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i mtshan nyid kyi 'brel pa bshad pa las gzhan 'ga' zhig kyang yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i mtshan nyid kyi 'brel pa bshad pa las gzhan 'ga' zhig kyang yod pa ma yin te /
translated: There is no relation other than the relation of cause and effect.

original: 'brel pa mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //üîΩde nyid de lta yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'brel pa mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro // de nyid de lta yin no zhe na /
translated: Because a relation is untenable.üîΩIf you say that is so,

original: 'di la yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: 'di la yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: the response to that is ‚ÄúIn this regard, etc.‚Äù

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po yang 'di la 'thad pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po yang 'di la 'thad pa ma yin no //
translated: The state of cause and effect is also untenable in this regard.

original: rgyu ci yin zhe na /
analyzed: rgyu ci yin zhe na /
translated: What is the cause?

original: rang nyid de'i bdag nyid ma yin pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: rang nyid de'i bdag nyid ma yin pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The response to that is ‚ÄúThat which is not of the nature of itself, etc.‚Äù

original: gang gi phyir gang gi bdag nyid ma yin pa 'di ni de'i rgyu ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di khyed kyi grub pa'i mtha' yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir gang gi bdag nyid ma yin pa 'di ni de'i rgyu ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di khyed kyi grub pa'i mtha' yin no //
translated: Because it is your tenet that that which is not of the nature of something is not its cause.

original: de lta na zho'i bdag nyid du grags pa ni 'o ma zho'i rgyu yin te /
analyzed: de lta na zho'i bdag nyid du grags pa ni 'o ma zho'i rgyu yin te /
translated: In that case, milk, which is known to be of the nature of curd, is the cause of curd.

original: zho'i bdag nyid kyi ba lang gi lci ba la sogs pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: zho'i bdag nyid kyi ba lang gi lci ba la sogs pa ni ma yin no //
translated: not from the dung of cows that are themselves made of molasses.

original: rdzas las kyang don gzhan pa'i chos de ji ltar de dag rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos por 'gyur te /üîΩde ltar 'dod par gyur pa yin na gzhan @175a * //
analyzed: rdzas las kyang don gzhan pa'i chos de ji ltar de dag rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos por 'gyur te / de ltar 'dod par gyur pa yin na gzhan @175a * //
translated: And how could a dharma that is a different substantial entity from a substance be the cause or effect of that substance?

original: la yang rgyu dang 'bras bur 'gyur ba yin no zhe na /
analyzed: la yang rgyu dang 'bras bur 'gyur ba yin no zhe na /
translated: If you accept that, then anything could be the cause or effect of anything.

original: don gzhan yin du zin kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: don gzhan yin du zin kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: If you say that even though they are different substantial entities,

original: gang gi tshe gzhan yang chos gzhan gyi rdzas yin par 'dod na ni de'i tshe chos skyed par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang gi tshe gzhan yang chos gzhan gyi rdzas yin par 'dod na ni de'i tshe chos skyed par 'gyur te /
translated: if you accept that one dharma is the substantial entity of another dharma, then in that case a dharma would be the cause of that dharma,

original: rdzas yongs su gyur pa'o zhes khas blang bar bya'o //üîΩde dag kyang kho bo yang 'dod pa nyid de /
analyzed: rdzas yongs su gyur pa'o zhes khas blang bar bya'o // de dag kyang kho bo yang 'dod pa nyid de /
translated: because the substantial entity would be transformed.üîΩWe also accept that.

original: de nyid 'dod pa bstan pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de nyid 'dod pa bstan pa yin no zhe na /
translated: We are simply teaching what you yourself accept.

original: 'di la yang rgyu dang 'bras bu zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: 'di la yang rgyu dang 'bras bu zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Here, he says, ‚ÄúIf you accept that even though they are different substantial entities,

original: de lta na yang dper na sa'i rdzas kyi rgyu dang 'bras bur 'brel par rnam par gnas par 'gyur ba de'i tshe /
analyzed: de lta na yang dper na sa'i rdzas kyi rgyu dang 'bras bur 'brel par rnam par gnas par 'gyur ba de'i tshe /
translated: In that case, for example, when the substance of earth is related as cause and effect,

original: snga ma'i sa'i gong bu'i rdzas ni rgyu byed pa yin la /
analyzed: snga ma'i sa'i gong bu'i rdzas ni rgyu byed pa yin la /
translated: at that time the substance of the prior earth is the cause.
